story:
The Story

Hi, I am Teah, founder of Well.Fit. This business was born out of my passion for creating a unique fitness experience that takes you out of the gym and keeps you on your toes! I wanted to make working out and getting fit fun and accessible to everyone in a non-traditional setting. For the past 5 years I have been organizing and executing urban bootcamps, working one on one with personal training clients, and running the Ladies Gun Club; an all women's bootcamp program. From the River Arts District, to downtown Pack Square, to Carrier Park we have been using every inch of Asheville to keep people moving, excercising and sweating.  

I have a great team, my husband and my family, each who are key players in one area or another of business development and management.  We have also created a team of top notch instructors!

We plan to open Well.Fit, Asheville's premier indoor cycling and fitness studio, in December 2015. In order to bring it all together we need a few more funds so we are asking for your help. I am a born entrepreneur and leader and opening a cycling and fitness studio has always been my DREAM! We are so close to making it happen and with your contributions, together, we can do it!!!


What We Need

We have raised 75% of our start up capital and now we just need an additional $20,000.00 to go toward equipment, supplies and startup operating costs. 


Where It Goes

  • Stereo Equipment $2K
  • TRX anchoring system $500
  • Mirrors $1K
  • Sound insulation materials $3K
  • Furniture and fixtures $500
  • Additional exercise equipment $2K
  • Signage, Decals, Banners $1.5K
  • Additional operating capital $5K
  • Campaign and marketing costs $3K
If we don't completely reach our goal we will prioritize and allocate the funds we do receive accordingly.
We have created lots of options for contributing, please check out our awesome perks!!

This Studio is For You!!

We really are building this studio for you! We want to share our passion for fitness and total well-being with all of you. We are wholeheartedly dedicated to giving you a fun,unique, and balanced fitness experience in a non traditional setting. We plan on using every part of Asheville to create our kick-ass workouts...from the beautiful new Well.Fit studio, to the streets/neighborhoods of Asheville and into the Blue Ridge Mountains. We wanna keep you moving, keep you sweating, keep you working hard and always keep it fresh!!!


I have been running successful fitness operations here in asheville for over 3 years and one of the things that truly sets Well.Fit apart is the community and culture we create.

Here is what some of my bootcamp members have to say: 

“I started with the LGC in april ‘13 and have loved every second. Teah's approach has continuously been fun, challenging, supportive and ever-changing which keeps me motivated to stay on my fitness path. RESULTS...not only have I gained strength, stamina and muscle definition but have lost 2 inches in my hips/waist”      -Alicia Pickett

“Coach T’s approach and methodologies are EXACTLY what I need to stay motivated and involved. She keeps it interesting by creating a routine that is constantly evolving.  Her group is so supportive and positive which really helps me to stay accountable to my personal fitness goals."                                                                  -Brooke Priddy Conrad


 "Well.Fit has an authentic culture – imagine yourself surrounded by your besties cracking jokes while Teah pushes you harder than you could ever push yourself…that is Well.Fit. I feel a part of a community of people having FUN and working towards becoming the healthiest version of themselves, body and mind. Community is truly at the heart of every Well.Fit workout."                                                  -Cate Ryba


In a Nut Shell

Friends, we love Asheville and are blessed to call this place home! We love the community and culture that it creates and are super excited to be adding our little piece to the bigger picture. With your help we will have a dedicated space to continue to grow our Well.Fit community, to continue to push one another, be there for one another, pick each other up when we get knocked down and celebrate together in victory! Well.Fit is more than just fitness...its family. As a small startup we need you, we need the love and support of this Asheville family and community...we can't do it without you!! 



Other Ways You Can Help

Please help in any way you can...no effort is too big or small!! Pick a perk and wear your swag to represent Well.Fit, share our campaign with your friends on social media and TALK US UP!! We know the power of word of mouth...we would not be where we are today without it!!

story:
Health matters to moms. 

 

My name's Audrey, and this is my friend, Bleu. We're moms, as well as senior students conducting undergraduate research in women's healthcare, economic justice, and family wellness around the world. 

We're also both artists with decades of professional creative experience between us.

We're going to Nepal...

...to bring aid to one of the poorest countries in the world, where four out of five rural women go without healthcare, and where "birth trauma" and "low birth weight" are in the top 10 most common causes of death, with "maternal conditions" coming in at #13. 

 

We have an extraordinary opportunity: in our final quarter before graduation, we'll be traveling to Nepal to support two different organizations-- a women's clinic in the Annapurna region that provides critical, low-cost care to postnatal women with prolapsed uteruses (an ostracizing but easily correctable condition that is especially common in Nepali women), and a village clinic in the Khumbu region that provides healthcare for the residents of the sister Sherpa villages Khumjung and Kunde. Additionally, we'll be working with a residential program in Kathmandu, where young girls with injuries, illnesses, and physical disabilities are taken from dangerous circumstances (most living with their mothers in filthy city prisons). The girls are given shelter, healthcare, food, and education, while being taught vital life skills like handiwork, computers, martial arts and self defense, until their families are able to support them again. In addititon to our service, we will deliver critical medical supplies and educational materials to these organizations.

 

After we've returned, and to continue raising money for these excellent organizations, we'll be documenting the state of healthcare, motherhood, and the family in rural Nepal through audio recordings, portrait photography, and storytelling. When we come home, we'll host a mixed-media exhibit at a public art venue in our city (we've already been granted the space!), where we'll sell prints and greeting cards (professionally printed at a local printing press) featuring our photographs to continue raising money for the clinics and residential program.

Sounds amazing, right?

 Thanks to enthusiastic professors, scholarships, and student loans, we've already raised enough for: 

  • Tuition for the quarter we're away  
  • Airfare from the US to Nepal  
  • Necessary photography equipment 

 

So where will your money go? 

 

Here's your opportunity to offer tangible & lasting assistance to these organizations that reach beyond our volunteerism! Extend the impact of our trip through the purchase and delivery of critical medical supplies, educational tools, and medical equipment, as well as practical technical gear and clothing for medical practitioners serving remote and high-altitude villages, warm clothing and shoes for the village residents (many of whom make due with flip-flops year-round), and high-quality school supplies like pencils, calculators, new paper products, and books published after the 1970's. Additionally, we need to raise a bit more money for our personal expenses, which include travel within the country and our lodging and food costs. We also hope to offset some of the childcare expenses that our families will experience while we're away, and provide a good living wage to the porters who will help us carry the supplies to their destinations. 

As far as specific medical supplies, it's the basics we're shooting for initially; we want to bring sterile gauze, clinical-grade scissors and scalpels, bulb syringes, speculums, fetoscopes, stethoscopes, nitrile exam gloves, suturing kits, topical analgesic, topical disinfectants... and more.

$8k is the low-ball figure. That gives us $2.5k for medical supplies and equipment, $1k for birth and contraception education materials, $1k for medicines (antibiotics, antifungals, anti-inflammatories, and prenatal vitamins), $1k for technical clothing and shoes, $2k for our personal expenses, and $500 for school supplies. The extra $700 on our goal total is to cover the costs of this online campaign (paypal and indiegogo both take cuts). 

 

If we don't raise enough money, we'll host a few more fundraisers locally. If we can't meet our financing goals by January 2013, we'll cancel the trip (ie, no delivery of supplies, no photographic/storytelling journey) and all the money we've successfully raised will be split evenly between the two clinics and the girl's home, and wired to each of them directly. 

 

BUT IF WE GO OVER OUR GOAL: 

 

Well, here's where it gets exciting!

Here's a magical wish list of the things we would just really really love to buy for these clinics: 

  • A transcutaneous bilirubin monitor ($2.5k)
  • An external fetal monitor ($3k)
  • Two high-quality childbirth education sets ($1k for two)
  • Two laboratory-quality microscopes ($1k each)
  • Five clinical thermometers ($300 each)
  • Five Trav-L-Pure water purifiers ($200 each)
  • A generator (price dependent on size and shipment capabilities)
  • Two Solar-powered refrigerators ($700 each) 

 ...and so much more!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially at this time, but we've inspired you with our grand project scheme, please pass word along to your friends about this campaign. We're also collecting words and/or art pieces of support and encouragement on 5x5" sheets of white paper which we'll be turning into sturdy, weatherproof flags to gift to each of the clinics upon our arrival. If you're interested in participating in this way, let me know and we'll work out our collection of your contribution! 

 

Thank you guys so much. We are so inspired by this project and so hopeful that we'll be able to pull together to make it work! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

But seriously, did you see this? Best perk of the century, straight up. ----->

story:
Our Story

My name is Lea Josey. On July 11, 2011 my brother-in-law, Matthew Davis (22yrs) was in a motorcycle accident on his way to work.  He and my sister Danielle Davis (24yrs) had just celebrated their 7 month wedding anniversary, when you're newlyweds every month counts.  Matthew suffered multiple fractures but the most troubling was the Severe Traumatic Brain Injury(TBI). Doctors and nurses urged us to remove him from life support giving us the statistics of his injury.  90% of people never wake up from this coma, and the 10% that do cannot retain any semblance of an independent life.  Less than 5% of people with this injury are able to lead anything similar to their previous lifestyle.  Taking him off of life support without even giving him a chance was unacceptable. After 2 months in hospitals Matthew was sent home, because Danielle refused to let him to go a nursing home. Our single mother, Donna Josey, and Danielle cared for Matthew while he was still comatose, fed through a feeding tube, changed, bathed and even did passive therapy to try to maintain his body 24/7 for a month.  After 3 months in a coma, miraculously, Mattie started talking one day.  He was admitted to an acute rehab in Savannah where he is now talking, feeding himself, using the restroom, dressing and bathing his upper body, sitting up on his own, learning to walk and still retain his kind, selfless, funny personality.  Matthew has the medical community in shock, as his recovery is almost impossible and very rarely heard of.  

The Impact

It's important to let other families that suffer from TBI understand the options and meaning behind the medical community's opinions of the outcome of certain injuries.  Nothing is black and white.  Matthew is living proof that anything can happen. The newly married man that was never supposed to open his eyes again, less than 6 months after the injury, is kissing his new wife and will be able to lead a normal independent life with minor mental deficits.  

What We Need & What You Get

Matthew will be returning home soon and my mother's house is not equipped for his needs. He needs a suitable bathroom so he is able to bathe himself. We also want to close in the garage to give them a place to call their own.  This is a huge financial burden due to the astronomical amount of medical bills pouring in.  Matthew has fought so hard and so long to come this far and not have a place to go home to with his wife. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit our blog and let others know about Mattie's amazing story!

story:
Short Summary

Hello. For those of you who do not know me personally, my name is Kaden. To jump into things, I am transgender (FTM). I have been living as male for one year in September of 2012. I have begun HRT (Hormone Replacement Therapy, meaning I receive weekly injections of testosterone.) I will celebrate one year on hormones December 15, 2012.

This fundraiser is about trying to raise money for my top surgery, otherwise known as a double mastectomy. I thought I could put if off longer and wait until I could find a job that offered insurance that covered it, or save the money completely myself. Living with the waiting was hard on me mentally/emotionally, but recently it has become hard on me physically, and I am trying to raise money to have the surgery as soon as possible. About two months ago, I was diagnosed with pleurisy. Currently, I am just getting over pneumonia, which I will probably now be more prone to until I have the surgery. I am in almost constant pain unfortunately. This is because to be read as male and feel comfortable leaving my house each day and feeling true to myself, I bind my chest with something called a binder, to give the appearance of a flat(er) chest.

I have gone through a lot of struggles in my life - to lay it out there, I have struggled with bipolar disorder, anxiety, and an eating disorder. Since beginning this journey of transitioning into my true gender and finally being my true self, I have finally started to become happy and stable and at peace with myself, my life, and so many other things. I have worked hard to get to where I am at today in life, and all I dream about every day is having a body I can be comfortable living in and love.

What I'm Trying To Raise, and Perks for Your Donation

I will be having the surgery locally, so I will not need travel/lodging expenses. The surgery itself costs $6,300, as my insurance denied me coverage, but I am hoping to raise the other $1,300 from savings, an online apparel site I started (http://www.skreened.com/equalityshop) and through a music and drag benefit that is currently in the works.

$5 - My love and eternal gratitude.

$20 - My love, eternal gratitude, and a mix CD.

$50 - All of the above and a print of an original painting, done by yours truly.

$75 - All of the above and also a letter of appreciation to you.

$100 - My love, eternal gratitude, letter of appreciation, and original painting done by yours truly.

 

If you wish to claim the perks associated with the amount you donate, please email me at kadenmurphy@gmail.com with your name, address, and amount you donated so I can know where and what to send you. If you just donated the amount anonymously, please know that my eternal gratitude and love are sent your way :)

The Impact

I fully believe that getting this surgery would drastically change and improve my life, much for the better, in a way I can only dream of right now.

Your Help

I understand that times are hard for everyone, and you can believe and trust fully that any donation amount to this fund will forever be remembered and appreciated. If you are not in a position to donate, please pass the word along to anyone you might think/know who might be interested in helping a guy's dream come true.

Thank you for reading this. Donations can make this dream come true, but support and spreading the word are just as much appreciated.

Kaden.

story:
I was diagnosed with breast cancer on August 1, 2005 - one month before my 55th birthday. I watched my dad die slowly and in great pain from cancer when he was 55 after enduring almost 3 years of chemo.  I watched my youngest brother die much more quickly, but also in great pain from cancer early in the year when he would have turned 55.  I just could not see myself following in their footsteps, so I had to look for alternatives that focused on healing rather than tearing my body down.  I am 63 now.  

I have lived with breast cancer for 8 years now and I am ready to be done with it.  I wake up every morning looking at a tumor that looks like it is trying to get out of my skin.    

The treatment I seek  takes money I don't have, so I need your help and I want to help YOU in the process.

I am writing a book about my journey from my diagnosis through what happens with the treatment. I believe a lot of people with cancer want to know about alternative ways to approach their diagnosis.  My book is going to share my journey.  Educational.  Entertaining.  True. A sneak peek at the first chapter is available by going to my blog by going to http://bbholt.blogspot.com.  You can also follow me on BethHolt50/twitter.com.

Alternative, healthier protocols have made significant progress in treating cancer inside and outside of the traditional medicine realm since 2005. I have learned of one such treatment with a success rate of nearly 100% in completely getting rid of the common protein in EVERY kind of cancer and at ANY stage! What cancer victim wouldn't be thrilled by the prospect of waking up cancer-free?  I know I am!

The treatment is not something cooked up by a couple of hopeful folks in a dark room off the radar.  It is being administered by real doctors who are reporting to and complying with governmental agencies.  Ideally, this will become a mainstream successful, nontoxic solution for treating cancer. I want to take the treatment, but, of course, it would not be covered by the health insurance I no longer have because it isn’t traditional chemo. 

You may know that every round of chemo costs $19,000 on average. Patients often go through many rounds of chemo over months or years or until they die and spend hundreds of thousands of dollars in the process. It astounds me that the treatment I want only costs $32,000 one time for 4 days and it is finished. Resistant cancers can take a little longer to stop in their tracks.  Each additional day over 4 costs $5,000.  No patient to date has needed more than 6 days.  Getting the treatment is where the bulk of the money will go.  I will also incur the costs of getting to the clinic and having the required PetScan to be part of the study.  That's the medical part. 

I have tried to offer some cool perks that go beyond getting a digital or hard copy of the book.  I will meet supporters who select the higher level awards to tell them more about what I have done and offer whatever help I can give to them.  I will incur travel
expenses to honor those incentives and I LOVE to travel!

If the project goal is exceeded, it will afford me the opportunity to take time away from regular life to get the book done.  If the goal is not met, I will write the book anyway, honor the perks at every level, and save whatever is left to go toward getting the treatment later.  Maybe the book will make enough money to cover any shortfall. 

You can help by doing all of these things:  1.Watch both of my videos.  2. Read the excerpt from my book in my blog. 3. Follow my blog posts. 4.  Follow me on Twitter - my name is BethHolt50.  5. Sign up for the highest level support you can afford. 6. Tell everyone you know to do the same.  7. Even if this is not a good time for you to offer financial support, help spread the word about it using your own Facebook and email and utilizing the sharing tools from Indiegogo.

My ultimate goal is not only my own physical healing.  I want to be a source of encouragement, hope, and information to people seeking a different way to approach cancer and wanting to stay healthy in the process. Being able to schedule the treatment would be a fantastic way to start the New Year for me.

With your help, I believe we really can live and give and make a difference together to the many people facing cancer themselves or with a loved one. 

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

DISCLAIMERS:  I am not a trained medical professional.  I am not attempting to diagnose or treat any disease or condition.  I am not being paid by any of the companies whose products I have been using to keep the cancer in line.  I am not violating the laws of any state.  What I write and say is just my opinion, something which is still okay to have in the United States of America.

story:
Goodbye my Darlin

Hello, my name is LeVette Thorne. I am the Executive Director of The Place at the Lake, Benton County Missouri’s only domestic and sexual violence organization.  We save lives every day by helping not only break the cycle of domestic and sexual violence in the lives of our clients, but also in future generations to come through education and prevention which helps ensure brighter futures for the lives of Benton County residents and those in the surrounding area.

This campaign will raise money for operating costs of the emergency shelter provided to clients in order for our organization to continue offering domestic and sexual violence services. This is important because our shelter is usually at full capacity with both in house and outreach clients, proving and making a definite need for the services The Place at the Lake provides.  Some people may feel that domestic violence isn’t a pressing issue in the Unites States, so I kindly ask you to complete the following exercise and see if you feel it is pertinent. ..

Imagine four of the most important women in your life (mother, sister, aunt, friend)

Picture their faces clearly!! Happy and smiling!! (But keep your eyes open so you can read!)

Are you thinking of them?!?!

Can you imagine the color of their eyes, the texture of their hair, their contagious laugh?!

Now choose one of them….

Focus specifically on just the one….

What qualities do you admire most, her kind heart, her true sense of self, her intelligence?

Breathe her in for a moment and think of all the reasons why she is so important to you!

Now imagine someone robbing her of all of the qualities you hold so dear about her.

Imagine she is one of the millions of women suffering from domestic and sexual violence each year…

What would you give to save her?

Did you know that one in four women will become victims of domestic violence in their lifetime?  It could be you that help make that statistic one in five, one in fifty, or one in two hundred. Make a pledge today, make a stand today, save a life today….save her….she is in someone’s favorite four.

What We Need:

We need to raise $5000.00 to help keep our shelter open.  This money will be used for operating expenses included but not limited to electric bills, required Missouri shelter insurances, water/ gas bill, internet for clients and staff use, food, toiletries, and shelter repair expenses.

There are several things that make Place at the Lake unique like the extent of case management, for example staff asks clients to paint a picture of how they would like to see their lives five years from now any way they want. Once that image has been conveyed Case Managers immediately start taking the steps to make their “dream” a reality! And there have been too many success stories to count!

Also our shelter is like going to grandma’s house! We have a beautiful country location surrounded by horses, a beautiful back deck and a family dominated environment! Everyone cooks, eats, and works together to help keep the house running smoothly! And while all domestic violence shelters are a true blessing our home is an actual house which is very comfortable and quiet, not institutional like by any means!

If for some reason Place at the Lake is unable to meet our entire goal, all funds raised will still be used for their original purpose which is operating expenses.

The Impact of your Contribution:

By making a contribution to Place at the Lake you will not only be helping with financial expenses you will literally be helping us break the cycle of domestic violence in our clients’ lives. YOU WILL BE HELPING CHANGE THE LIVES OF OTHERS! You will be doing this by allowing us to continue serving Benton County and the surrounding area, though we take clients from all over the United States.

It doesn’t stop in this area though. Have you ever watched rain come down on still water and witnessed the ripple effect that extends outward at the place of impact? The same thing happens with domestic violence survivors. They reach out and touch lives for the duration of their time on this earth, helping others who have suffered as well, live a life free of abuse. This makes the possibilities endless, literally endless! So while the place of impact may be Benton County Missouri the ripple effect can touch California, New York, China, Spain, etc!

Also, we need your help because Benton County is very rural area with very limited funding sources. I ask you right now to remember the special lady you had thought of in the very beginning of the exercise. Would you save her if it meant a small monetary donation? You may be telling yourself someone else will do it, maybe Place at the Lake isn’t even located in your area! While we may not be located in your area we are all connected. We are all in this country, and population of this world. So while we may not be next door neighbors per say, we are figuratively just a couple of blocks away!

Risks and Challenges:

While I mentioned before that Benton County is located in a rural part of Missouri and funding is limited, we have made a plan to conquer these hurdles by reaching out to you and explaining that YOU can make the difference in someone’s life TODAY!

Ways You Can Help:

I realize that times are tough and money is tight, so I would like to thank you in advance for the kindness and generosity you shown through your donation.

Also please share our link on your facebook, twitter, and other social media accounts! Take a second to forward this to people in your email contact list! Everything you do to help today is greatly appreciated! And one last request. Reach out to that special lady in your life that came to mind earlier. Let her know how valuable and loved she truly is! J

story:
This video will give you the power to

Relax instantly

Keep a clear head regardless of what’s going on around you

Clear stress easily and pleasurably

Without drugs or drama - in less time than it takes to find the Valium.


G’day I’m JOY! a life transformation specialist from New Zealand. I’ve been traveling the world since July 2000 teaching people how to live more joyfully and less stressfully in three minutes or less.


I acquired the skills to more easily and quickly deal with fear, grief, stress and pain when doctors gave up on me following a car accident at 24. My frontal lobes were damaged to the point of autism, I was told I would be dead or brain dead by the time I was 30.


Instead I became a holistic health practitioner, now certified in more than a dozen different health modalities. As I journeyed through these different healing methods I uncovered amazing skills and tools that everyone should be taught in kindergarten but aren’t because it would put the drug companies out of business: Things like how to clear stress in minutes, dissolve emotional trauma painlessly, manage pain without drugs, reprogram your brain to eliminate self sabotaging behaviors – way too many to list.


Sharing what I learned is how I make everything that happened to me make sense.

As 2012 approaches my goal is to empower as many people as possible in the shortest amount of time. I will achieve that goal by recording these skills and distributing them as widely as possible. This video is the beginning of that.  I GUARANTEE it will significantly if not totally clear your stress!


Don’t take my word for this! Check it out for yourself. Give it a fair go; you’ve got nothing to lose but your stress. It will take less time than it would to smoke a cigarette, and give you essential skills for life!


Measure your stress levels right now on a scale of 1 – 100.


Got a number? OK, watch the video, do everything in it with me – I promise it will be easy. Measure your stress levels again at the end.

If you notice a significant difference – and if you don’t you haven’t done the exercises – please consider donating whatever you feel the benefit was worth to you J. I will use the money to continue recording tools to empower you – I have hundreds and the world has never needed them more.


All of my tools are powerful, easy, fun and produce immediate positive results. I teach Enlightenment through Pleasure because I’m DONE with doing it hard and painfully – are you?


If so please help me get them out to the world by contributing what you can, and sharing them with your friends.

enJOY!

story:
Short Summary

Ole Kassow started Cycling Without Age as a way of helping nursing home residents get back into society. As a cycling Copenhagener for whom the bicycle as transport is a given, Ole felt the need to help those with limited mobility. His solution? A classic Copenhagen rickshaw (see picture below). He was inspired by an elderly man, Thorkild, from his local nursing home and he offered to take him for a ride. 

Soon all the other residents wanted a ride, too. He then hooked up with Dorthe Pedersen, a visionary "boundary spanner" consultant from Copenhagen Municipality, and together they bought the first 5 rickshaws. Dorthe has since joined Cycling Without Age.

The reward of giving someone the experience of mobility and wind in the hair was indescribable. Before we knew it, Cycling Without Age spread to many cities in Denmark and beyond. There are now 25 cities in 14 countries that have been granted a royalty free license to give their elderly in their local nursing homes the same fantastic experience (view zoomable map here).

We are passionate about this movement. For us it’s not just riding a rickshaw with the elderly, but rather building that bridge between generations. Exchanging stories, starting new friendships and giving back to them while we are still able to. It’s the most amazing form of social inclusion. We are, after all, heading down the same path at some point.

What We Need & What You Get

We have passionate local ambassadors around the world who are working hard to start Cycling Without Age in their community. We want to kickstart their efforts by providing them with the first bicycle rickshaw and all the know-how they need. We’ll join them and organize community meetings, get their local governments and nursing homes excited about creating renewed relationships between old and young people and we will teach them how to run, operate and maintain the Cycling Without Age rickshaws.

Each take-off package (bike, transport, education, transfer of know-how and campaign fees) costs 8,200 USD. The number of licensees is increasing all the time. With this campaign we hope to raise money for bikes and know-how for at least 12 cities, but our wildest dream is that we can raise money for all 25 or 30 cities, so we can get them started down this amazing road. In total, we need 98,000 USD for 12 cities. If we don’t reach our full campaign target, we will help kickstart as many cities as we can. Just one bike in a city can make a huge difference to 20 volunteers (called rickshaw pilots) and 100 elderly citizens. The elderly will once again be handed the opportunity to connect with their local community and the people in it.

Our rides provide experiences and amazing stories. If you help us reach our target, we will offer you the opportunity to get involved by joining our rides, meeting the founders and Thorkild, the pilots and many others. You’ll get to feel what it’s like to put a smile on the face of an amazing stranger.

The Impact

Rides have a striking impact on the elderly, the voluntary pilots, the staff and on the local community. We’ve learned over the last two years that nursing homes with rickshaws use them as tools for conversations, for creating relationships and for enhancing the quality of life of everybody involved.

The pilots are rewarded with a dopamine kick for making someone else smile and the elderly passengers regain their mobility and ability to take a trip down memory lane. In addition, the nursing home staff experience increased happiness at work and everybody is given an opportunity to develop new friendships.

Risks & Challenges

We're well aware that cycling cultures vary greatly from country to country. The same thing goes for volunteering and how people look upon their elderly citizens. These are all risks to be factored in, however, we already have passionate and committed locals around the world, who are already demonstrating that the idea behind Cycling Without Age bridges cultures and generations.

Cycling Without Age always brings a smile on the face of those who encounter a group out for a ride. We believe that we can change the way people around the world look upon cycling - the happiest means of transport.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to make a contribution, you can still help us:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Cycling Without Age. Show the video to friends, family members, staff at the local nursing home, local businesses, the municipality.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks a million for helping out!

In addition, the nursing home staff experience increased happiness at work and everybody is given an opportunity to develop new friendships.

 We're well aware that cycling cultures vary greatly from country to country. The same thing goes for volunteering and how people look upon their elderly citizens. These are all risks to be factored in, however, we already have passionate and committed locals around the world, who are already demonstrating that the idea behind Cycling Without Age bridges cultures and generations.
Cycling Without Age always brings a smile on the face of those who encounter a group out for a ride. We believe that we can change the way people around the world look upon cycling - the happiest means of transport.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you're unable to make a contribution, you can still help us:

Get the word out and make some noise about Cycling Without Age. Show the video to friends, family members, staff at the local nursing home, local businesses, the municipality. Use the Indiegogo share tools.   Thanks a million for helping out!

story:
Why Physical Therapy In Your Pocket?

 

Rick Good (the taller fellow in the picture) and I (Rod Sheffield) have been making products together in San Diego for the past 20 years.  He and I also have gone on a number of backpacking trips together.  At the time of this photo, I had recovered from several accidents, resulting in two broken arms, a couple of compressed vertebrae, and two broken legs.  I have done a lot of physical therapy exercises.  I have come to realize that I need to do those exercises daily, not only to recover quickly from an injury, but also to keep mobile.  My set of exercises is large enough that I need more than just the paper handouts given to me at the therapist office.  I’ve also done those exercises for long enough that I need a reminder about how to do them properly, and which ones I do each day.  Finally, I need to have continued feedback with the therapists so that they can upgrade my exercises when I get stronger in various areas of my body.  These needs can all be satisfied if only I had the proper mobile application on my smart phone, connected to an application my physical therapists use.

 

What our campaign is about.

 

One of Rick’s product suites is comprised of software that does what I need.  He has created a mobile app that runs on an iPhone. That app downloads the latest set of exercises from a Cloud server accessed by a number of physical therapists.  He has created a Java program that the therapists use to organize the various exercises into protocols for daily use.  An important feature of Rick’s product suite is that the iPhone app and the therapists’ application communicate.  Daily progress is monitored, resulting in continuously tuned therapies based on actual progress.  My physical therapists can truly be in my pocket all the time, coaching me through my exercises, and receiving my inputs regarding exercise effectiveness.

 

The product suite has been used by The Egoscue Method http://www.egoscue.com , a pain and posture therapy business, for the past 8 years.  The various parts of the product suite have been tuned over that time, yet there are areas where it can become even more effective. 

 

The first and most important change we wish to make in this campaign is to improve the exercises.  There are 500 Egoscue exercises that exist in both annotated stills and on line videos.  We will improve these exercises by converting them to animation videos.  The animation videos allow for much more control when being used by the patient on Rick’s eCoach smart phone app.  We will use OpenGL to create these animation videos so that they can easily be played on a variety of smart phone operating systems. 

 

We will integrate this new animated video format on Rick’s existing iPhone eCoach app during this campaign.  We will also update the Java application that the therapists use to an iPad app (PT Planner).  This will enable more efficient capture of stills and video while the therapist is doing examinations in the clinic. That information will be automatically uploaded into the Cloud repository with the patient’s protocol history. 

 

Where your funding is going.

 

The conversion of videos into animation is a complicated process.  We have gotten estimates from professionals specializing in that process.  We will use $100,000 of our funding goal to convert the first 200 exercises.    Selecting which exercises to convert for physical therapy is estimated to use $25,000 of our funding.  The remaining $25,000 will be used to integrate the new animation videos into our apps, which are already underway.  We are using the IndieGoGo flexible funding vehicle so that we can get an early start on converting as many videos as possible.  Should we exceed our funding goal, we will select even more videos to convert so that we cover as many physical therapy protocols as possible.

 

 

How everyone benefits.

 

Not everyone has had quite as many injuries as I have.  However, there are nearly 2 million people in the US alone doing physical therapy daily and that number is growing rapidly.  According to the 2011 Bureau of Labor Statistics report, physical therapy is the fastest growing health business.  Use of our product can make a substantial difference to the recovery time of millions.  We are committed to getting our products out as quickly as possible, and to as many providers as we can.  Your funding will make that happen.  A select group of contributors will also get a chance to use, evaluate, and provide feedback on eCoach.  We encourage everyone, contributors and non-contributors alike, to talk to their physical therapists and health care providers, about getting the PT Planner app to use.  Even the best tool is no good if it is not used.

story:
Carry and drink water on your run without any sloshing or noise.

With RunBottle’s unique patent pending pressure system, you can hydrate during your run free from sloshing, splashing and bouncing. Drink faster and easier without having to suck on the bottle or tilt your head. It saves your energy, keeps your sightline clear, and lets you focus on the road, enjoying the peace of your run without distractions.


 

Stay Focused

Hydrate without tilting your head, losing your balance, or taking your eyes off the road.

Stay Safe

Stand out when you're on your run with the RunBottle's reflective design.

 

How To Get Started

Filling up your RunBottle and getting ready to go is simple. Just lock and load, and enjoy your run.  

 

Comparison

What makes RunBottle different from the competition?

 

Early Reviews for RunBottle

Check out #runbottle on Instagram for more.

 

 

Who We are

The team behind RunBottle.


 

We're Smartshake, a Swedish company that's been making water bottles and shaker bottles for more than a decade. We've got dozens of successful, well-liked products under our belt, most of them focused on the world of fitness and bodybuilding.

Now, we're making RunBottle, our first product exclusively for runners, and we're looking for your support in making it a reality. Creating a new product from scratch and putting it into production is  always difficult and a big investment. Especially when it's a new category for us, and a product that's so unique.

Using Indiegogo was a no-brainer to us. It allows us to reach out to the people who most want to see the RunBottle in the real world, and put it in their hands at a steeply discounted price. We believe it's the best way to get the ball rolling, get the word out, and guarantee success.

 

 

What we need & what you get

We're looking to raise 30 000 Euros. This will be enough to finance a first run of production, fulfill our obligations to you, our backers, and put the RunBottle in select stores and online. We expect to start production as soon as the campaign ends, and get our product to you by early next year.

This campaign is set to have flexible funding. If we don't achieve our campaign goal your funds will still be used to help us launch RunBottle. We will have to adjust the scope of our production run and launch, but we will always honor our backers and deliver the Perks you have selected and paid for during the course of the campaign.

 

Other ways you can help

We understand that you may not be in a position to contribute funds at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't help us. We need all the help we can get in order to spread the word about our campaign, so be sure to follow us and share with your social media friends!

Follow us on:

Facebook  ｜  Instagram

story:
STRAFFR is a smart resistance band and training platform that makes working-out simple, effective, and personalized. What’s more, the compact design means this pocket-friendly equipment is your new travel buddy. Just grab it and go! 

 

 

 

WORK-OUT ANYWHERE, ANYTIME

    We all lead busy lives, and it’s hard to find the time to do anything, let alone working out.

    • Only 21% of adults meet recommended physical activity guidelines
    • Less than 5% of adults do more than 30-minutes of physical activity per day

    When you don’t work out, you feel it. Your muscles weaken, your posture deteriorates, and you feel more pain. That’s why we created STRAFFR: a smart way to get that personal training time you so desperately need.

    WHY TRAIN WITH A RESISTANCE BAND?

    We all make excuses when we don’t want to work out:

    • ‘I’m not going for a run in that rain!’
    • ‘The kids need their dinner!’
    • ‘I’ve just got one more email to send!’

    But that’s where resistance band training comes in. You can do it anywhere, at any time. All you need is a little floor space and 20 minutes for a full-body workout – without even leaving the house!

    Resistance bands are great for:

    With resistance bands, you can choose from hundreds of exercises that will work every muscle group in your body. Just like free weights or weight machines in gyms; with resistance bands, you train your whole body.

    Despite these well-known benefits, classic resistance bands lack quantification. In the gym, it’s easy to measure your progress: the stronger you get, the heavier the weights are that you can lift. But, with traditional resistance bands, you can only estimate how much weight you actually move. It’s more difficult to track your progress and stay motivated. Also, it can be hard to know exactly how to use a resistance band ideally when training without a PT. 

    ENTER STRAFFR, A RESISTANCE BAND LIKE NO OTHER

    Forget what you know about resistance bands. Unlike any other resistance band you’ve seen before, STRAFFR gives you live-action feedback via its app, guiding you through your exercise and making sure every workout counts. STRAFFR’s patent-pending tech, including unique expandable sensors, creates a smart and simple way for you to work out.

    What makes STRAFFR stand out?

    The connected Fitness Platform guides, evaluates and records your progress during and after your session. STRAFFR gives you the help you need to achieve your personal fitness goals. 

    After analyzing your fitness, the STRAFFR app will devise the best training plans for your fitness level. You get a truly personalized experience, while the smart technology follows your lead. 
    As your fitness and ability improve, you can increase the resistance level. Simply alter your grip and the app will follow: it’s like having an infinite number of free weights in your pocket.

    A PERSONAL TRAINER IN YOUR POCKET

    As you train, the app records the power, velocity and repetitions of your session, giving you real-time feedback and post-training analytics.

    Active corrective feedback acts as a personal trainer - for perfect performance, every time. If you complete an exercise too fast or too slow, the STRAFFR app will guide you towards better execution with audio and visual feedback. 

    If you don’t complete a repetition, the app will let you know, just like a personal trainer, pushing you towards a clean and safe execution of every single rep. With STRAFFR, you train more efficiently and effectively to get the results you want.

    Improve your posture, get stronger and feel better, no matter where you are, with STRAFFR.

    BACKED BY EXPERTS

     

    ONE BAND, MULTIPLE USES

    The STRAFFR band allows you to complete a wide selection of exercises at a variety of intensity levels. This customization gives you the most tailored workout possible, so you can achieve your personal fitness goals.

     

    In the app, the Workout Stream is the place where the magic happens. Here, you’ll find all the workouts within the STRAFFR platform. The workouts that are most relevant for you are organized at the top of the screen, but if you scroll down you will find many other exercise plans that fit a variety of occasions: Travelling? Great. Try our efficient workout that’s specifically designed for people on the go. Just woke up and want to start the day fresh? Awesome! Our quick good morning workout will stretch and mobilize you, giving your day the ideal start.

     

     

    But it doesn’t stop here – in only a few clicks, you can create your own workout with your favorite exercises. It’s as easy as starting a group chat on Facebook or WhatsApp:

     

     

    WHAT OUR USERS SAY

    MADE FOR YOU

    At launch, the band will be available in two different strengths in order to give everyone the workout experience they want.

     

     

    The STRAFFR app will be available in German and English (US).

    It will also be able to convert between metric and imperial systems.

    The band can be charged using the USB-C connector. Our enhanced battery management system enables you to train a whole month (21+ hours of training) on one single charge. Furthermore, the fast charge function charges the band to 50% in only 20 Min.

    The STRAFFR band has not only been invented and designed in Germany, but the main components are also produced and assembled here, ensuring the quality you expect from a premium sporting device. 

    The band behind the band: Volker, Stefan, Torben and Hanno all have a passion for sport, but understand how a busy lifestyle can get in the way of staying on track. So, they banded together to make STRAFFR a reality. They all have backgrounds in engineering and tech, producing the functioning prototype and coding the STRAFFR app themselves. They know what is needed to take things to the next level and get STRAFFR to serial production and can't wait to get the bands into your hands! Your smart fitness journey is almost ready to begin.

    TAKING A LOOK AT THE CURRENT STRAFFR BAND AND APP PROTOTYPE

     

    WHAT DOES THE FUTURE HOLD?

    Risks and challenges

    Sweat, blood, tears and a lot of love went into the development of our prototype to make STRAFFR available to you. We have built a fully functioning prototype in hardware and software. Yes, the whole system works and has been tested by real people! Our band design underwent long term testing and the electrical and mechanical designs have been approved. The app design is fully functioning and has been tested and approved for launch. As with any hardware production, issues may arise in the process which could delay shipment, but due to our close relationship with our manufacturer and development partners, we don't foresee any issues prohibiting us from getting STRAFFR to you as soon as possible. Our main challenge is to deliver the best possible user experience - seamless integration of software and hardware.

story:
History of our Scout Hut

The scout hut that serves as home to our Boy Scout Troop 228 was originally a railroad depot.  The railroad came to New London, Minnesota in 1886.  Shortly thereafter this depot building was constructed from local materials.  Our Boy Scout Troop 228 adopted the building when it was no longer needed as a depot building.  In 1976 under the direction of scoutmaster Norm Peterson the building was moved to the current location.  The current location is on a generous gifted long term lease property from Peace Lutheran Church.  Now the property needs to be sold to a different owner and our lease will come to an end. 

                       History of New London Boy Scout Troop 228

New London Troop 228 was founded and chartered in 1920.  There was a brief hiatus during World War II when all able bodied citizens were working on the war effort.  Outside of that this troop is nearing 100 years of chartered service to boys, young men and community.  The troop has helped develop hundreds of young men.  Our troop has now awarded 75 Eagle Scout awards.  If one considers the national average of less than 2% of scouts go on to the Eagle rank then our troop has served thousands of young men.  We continue to have a very active troop with more than 30 currently enrolled Boy Scouts.

                         The building and the troop are inseparable

The video materials that we have attached were filmed, directed and edited by our scouts.  No parent involvement.  The video captures the spirit of the connection between the building and the boys in the troop.

                                          Saving a historic building

We have met with building movers and have determined tht the building is structurally sound and appropriate to move.  We have secured a new location for the building within our community.  We have decided that it is important to save the building for the sake of our troop and for the historic character it brings to our community.

               Ryane Clark, our Eagle Scout, Army veteran and American hero

Ryane Clark is an Eagle Scout from our troop.  He was drawn to law enforcement as a career.  He attended the law enforcement program at Aleandria Technical College in Alexandria MN.  He felt a call to serve all of us and his country in the United States Army.  In October of 2010 Ryane Clark was serving with his unit in Afghanistan.  His unit took enemy fire and Ryane was killed in action by a rocket propelled grenade.  He gave his life in service to his country and to all of us in protecting our freedom.  Boy Scout Troop 228 was able to welcome his body home at the airport and to assist at his funeral in New London, Minnesota.  Ryane would have been proud of his troop.

                                  Help us honor Ryane and his legacy

In addition to moving our hut and Ryane's former scout home we plan to augment Ryane's Eagle Scout project and to fund a perpetual scholarship fund in Ryane's name.  For his Eagle project, Ryane developed a trailhead parking area for our local trail.  The area is in need of further updating and completion.  We want to help his family complete the project.  Ryane's college scholarship fund is already in place and functional.  It simply needs more funds.  Our troop dreams of offering a check to his family and the fund to guarantee that Ryane's memory will be invoked every year as the fund offers an annual scholarship to a deserving student.  It takes a large amount of money to fund a perpetual scholarship gift but we think it is possible.


                                                         Already at work

No Boy Scout waits for a hand out.  Our troop has been hard at work with fundraisers like spaghetti feeds, boy scout work-hour auctions, silent auctions and a well supported Eagle Scout matching grant effort.  We will continue to do this work.  We pledge that your tax deductible donation will go directly toward our efforts.  We have no troop overhead.  Like every Boy Scout troop we function with all volunteer time and this project will be no different.  We want to put every dime possible into Ryane's scholarship fund.  This is our incentive to be completely prudent with every cent you give.   The scouts and leaders of New London Troop 228 look forward to showing each of you our completed projects and the shared pride we will all have when the Ryane Clark memorial scholarship is fully funded. Thank you for your support and for sharing our story with all of your friends!

Sincerely,

NLS Boy Scout troop 228 boys and leaders.

The scout hut that serves as home to our Boy Scout Troop 228 was originally a railroad depot.  The railroad came to New London, Minnesota in 1886.  Shortly thereafter this depot building was constructed from local materials.  Our Boy Scout Troop 228 adopted the building when it was no longer needed as a depot building.  In 1976 under the direction of scoutmaster Norm Peterson the building was moved to the current location.  The current location is on a generous gifted long term lease property from Peace Lutheran Church.  Now the property needs to be sold to a different owner and our lease will come to an end.  
                       History of New London Boy Scout Troop 228
New London Troop 228 was founded and chartered in 1920.  There was a brief hiatus during World War II when all able bodied citizens were working on the war effort.  Outside of that this troop is nearing 100 years of chartered service to boys, young men and community.  The troop has helped develop hundreds of young men.  Our troop has now awarded 75 Eagle Scout awards.  If one considers the national average of less than 2% of scouts go on to the Eagle rank then our troop has served thousands of young men.  We continue to have a very active troop with more than 30 currently enrolled Boy Scouts.
                         The building and the troop are inseparable
The video materials that we have attached were filmed, directed and edited by our scouts.  No parent involvement.  The video captures the spirit of the connection between the building and the boys in the troop.
                                          Saving a historic building 
We have met with building movers and have determined tht the building is structurally sound and appropriate to move.  We have secured a new location for the building within our community.  We have decided that it is important to save the building for the sake of our troop and for the historic character it brings to our community.
               Ryane Clark, our Eagle Scout, Army veteran and American hero
Ryane Clark is an Eagle Scout from our troop.  He was drawn to law enforcement as a career.  He attended the law enforcement program at Aleandria Technical College in Alexandria MN.  He felt a call to serve all of us and his country in the United States Army.  In October of 2010 Ryane Clark was serving with his unit in Afghanistan.  His unit took enemy fire and Ryane was killed in action by a rocket propelled grenade.  He gave his life in service to his country and to all of us in protecting our freedom.  Boy Scout Troop 228 was able to welcome his body home at the airport and to assist at his funeral in New London, Minnesota.  Ryane would have been proud of his troop.
                                  Help us honor Ryane and his legacy
In addition to moving our hut and Ryane's former scout home we plan to augment Ryane's Eagle Scout project and to fund a perpetual scholarship fund in Ryane's name.  For his Eagle project, Ryane developed a trailhead parking area for our local trail.  The area is in need of further updating and completion.  We want to help his family complete the project.  Ryane's college scholarship fund is already in place and functional.  It simply needs more funds.  Our troop dreams of offering a check to his family and the fund to guarantee that Ryane's memory will be invoked every year as the fund offers an annual scholarship to a deserving student.  It takes a large amount of money to fund a perpetual scholarship gift but we think it is possible.

                                                         Already at work
No Boy Scout waits for a hand out.  Our troop has been hard at work with fundraisers like spaghetti feeds, boy scout work-hour auctions, silent auctions and a well supported Eagle Scout matching grant effort.  We will continue to do this work.  We pledge that your tax deductible donation will go directly toward our efforts.  We have no troop overhead.  Like every Boy Scout troop we function with all volunteer time and this project will be no different.  We want to put every dime possible into Ryane's scholarship fund.  This is our incentive to be completely prudent with every cent you give.   The scouts and leaders of New London Troop 228 look forward to showing each of you our completed projects and the shared pride we will all have when the Ryane Clark memorial scholarship is fully funded. Thank you for your support and for sharing our story with all of your friends!
Sincerely,
NLS Boy Scout troop 228 boys and leaders.

story:
Aloha Friends and Supporters

After more than two decades as a clinical first responder, dedicating my career to helping victims of natural disasters, school shootings, and terroristic attacks remove their emotional mask, I have retooled my skills to now lead Lady Ease Limited d/b/a Ease Collection as its Founder and CEO.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $20,000 in an effort to expand our donated mask to another 10,000 mask. We have already donated the first 10,000, this time we need your help. Should we not reach our goal of $20,000, we will make a donation of whatever is equivalent to all of your generosity. 

The mask that you will receive and/or donate will bring the nation closer to accomplishing the nationwide mandate of having every family household, every student k-12 with a mask in their preparedness kit. Please join me in helping to protect and prepare our nation.

As an entrepreneur, who built Lady Ease from the in-law suite of my home to its current 7500 sq. feet new facility, I empathetically set my priorities and designed a washable, re-usable fashion face mask for women, men, and children using eco-friendly fabrics.

My clients range from the individual traveler, to companies who customize their mask with their company's logo, to the fashion conscience user that won't settle for anything less than Ease Collection's "Bling" line. 

I have applied many of the same practices and principles to my approach of preparing my clients for “not if, but when" a disaster strikes to be prepared. As a first responder I understand that during a disaster emergency responders address the most critical needs and may not even be able to get to an area until it is deemed safe. While they work on behalf of the entire community, they also have a responsibility to ensure their family's well-being during a time of crisis.

Your pledges will help provide the much needed mask to the millions of children around the world who need our help.

Thank you for your confidence in me, your support will be most appreciated.

The Impact

Kapiolani Women and Children's Center with over 100 years of caring for children, NEEDS YOUR HELP

Ronald McDonald House serves more than 100,000 children each year, NEEDS YOUR HELP

Children's Miracle Network with more than 170 hospitals in their network, NEEDS YOUR HELP

The Children in your house and across the street NEED YOUR HELP


I NEED YOUR HELP TO HELP THEM


Other Ways You Can Help

As a friend and supporter, should you be unable to make any level of pledge, you can still help. Kindly pass this campaign on to your supporters, family and friends; I would appreciate your efforts.

Together We Will Help Our Children

Always the best,

Denyse

story:
Help Colby Get His Smile Back!
My brother, Colby, has been in the hospital with a serious infection because of an abscessed tooth. He is now out of the hospital, but if he does not get his troubled teeth removed, the infection will likely return. He has also lost most of his two front teeth and because of this, he does not like to smile. He does not have dental insurance and the cost of tooth extractions and dentures is well above his means. A single tooth extraction is around $85. He will need all of his teeth extracted, totaling around $2400. He will also need to be fitted for dentures, which costs around $500. Please help me make my wish for my brother to smile again a reality!
story_txt: Help Colby Get His Smile Back!My brother, Colby, has been in the hospital with a serious infection because of an abscessed tooth. He is now out of the hospital, but if he does not get his troubled teeth removed, the infection will likely return. He has also lost most of his two front teeth and because of this, he does not like to smile. He does not have dental insurance and the cost of tooth extractions and dentures is well above his means. A single tooth extraction is around $85. He will need all of his teeth extracted, totaling around $2400. He will also need to be fitted for dentures, which costs around $500. Please help me make my wish for my brother to smile again a reality!

story:
What the heck?

So Steve has these teeth. They're crookedy and charming, but some of them are needing some (okay, a lot) of work. One of his teeth (fortunately not one of the *really* cute ones) needs to come out, another is going to require an herculean effort to save, and there are root canals and crowns and all sorts of nasty things that will have to be done.

Our Steve is an educator, so naturally he doesn't get paid even close to what he's worth. He has some insurance, but does *anybody* have enough dental coverage? No. But if all of us band together, we can raise enough money to pay for his dental work, and maybe even get enough so he can take a couple of days off to recover from all this oral torture. 

If you're reading this, you probably know how wonderful Steve is. If you don't, this man is the salt of the earth. He adores his children, and he has a smile that would stop traffic. He's one of nicest and kindest and funniest people in the whole world. Let's show some love and keep him healthy and smiling!

What We Need

  • Universal Health Care
  • Stacks of cash (I do not know the *exact* dollar amount, but he's told me some of what the dentist wants to do. It's similar to what *my* dentist wants to do to me, and I have great insurance and I can't afford my work, either. Steve's is going to be at least four grand.)

What You Get

You mean BESIDES that warm feeling in your heart, and knowing that Steve's teeth will be fresh, clean and fixed at "kissing booth level?"

  • For the paltry sum of $25, you will receive a super awesome bumper sticker. it may involve a joke about oral hygiene, but trust me. It will be super awesome. (This may wind up being a refrigerator magnet, which I think is even cooler than a bumper sticker!)
  • If you pledge $40, you will receive something super awesome from our dear friends Steve & Anna at piratemod.com. Hint: It's probably a really cool t-shirt. Details will be forthcoming.
  • If you can spare $50, you're in for a treat! The fabulously talented Holly DeFount is donating the last nine artist proofs of her gorgeous print "Rolling Home." The original was created for the Seadogs Pirate Gift Exchange in 2010. These are artist proof giclée prints of the original ink and colored pencil art. The edition is completely sold out, so this could be the last opportunity to get your mitts on this lovely piece of art. The artwork is approximately 13" x 16", and the paper is 14.5" x 20".
  • For $75 bucks, I will knit you a super fabulous hat to your specifications. It can even be a cunning hat, if you get my drift!
  • CLAIMED! Don't need a hat? For $75, the multitalented Laura Brueckner (or, to the Mad Sal's set, Miss Eileen Dover of the Broadside Music Hall) will make you a gorgeous pair of earrings. She says: "I will (with my fancy jewelry school degree) make a beautiful pair of freshwater pearl and silver earrings, customized with the semiprecious stone of donor's choosing to match your Dickens costume or that stunning out-on-the-town dress. Do you like garnets? Amethyst? Citrine? Done!" Laura has a Graduate Jeweler degree from the Gemological Institute of America (and she's generous and beautiful! What's not to love?)
  • Babies everywhere? For $175, I will make you a baby quilt, or any small quilt - a lap quilt, something for a picnic, or a wall hanging. Challenge me!
  • Need some great music for your event? For $200, the amazingly talented Beth Powell will come play her harp for you for an hour! Weddings, cocktail parties, private dinners, whatever! Beth is a talented musician and has a great sense of humor. No event is too unusual for her! (SF Bay Area only.)
  • Every salty sailor needs a tattoo, right? For a donation of $200, (and a trip to El Sobrante) you can spend up to two hours getting a tattoo from the gorgeous Ophelia Coeur de Noir! I'm thinking "I HEART Steve!"
  • If you're hungry for some great food and you can spare $250, you and a friend (or two) can dine at the best restaurant in Vallejo! Okay, it's my house, but DAMN, can Nathan and I cook! We can eat and drink and play games. Of course, Steve will be there. If you pledge an obscene amout of money, you don't even have to let him win.
  • If you can spare $500, I will sew you a quilt. Seriously.

  • CLAIMED! Need a new Faire outfit? For $800, our very own Wonder Woman Kathy Kingman will make you a beautiful new costume!

    She will do Renaissance/Pirate for men or women, or Victorian for the ladies. The costume can be up to three pieces (chemise/bodice/skirt…) Kathy drafts her own patterns, and can work off of a painting or portrait. She will do an initial consultation, two fittings and a final delivery. We will provide fabric and supplies up to $65.   

Other perks may be added as the word spreads! Give early, give often!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Write to your member of Congress and demand universal health care, effective yesterday.
  • Boost the signal!! Let your friends, family, co-workers, heck, even your enemies know about this project. Even a couple of bucks will help us make our goal and make Steve's teeth happy and shiny!

She will do an initial consultation, two fittings and a final delivery. We will provide fabric and supplies up to $65.   


Other perks may be added as the word spreads! Give early, give often!

Other Ways You Can Help

Write to your member of Congress and demand universal health care, effective yesterday.

Boost the signal!! Let your friends, family, co-workers, heck, even your enemies know about this project. Even a couple of bucks will help us make our goal and make Steve's teeth happy and shiny!

story:
About Me

I'm John, a single 49-year-old man born and living in Santa Rosa, California.  I've been overweight as long as I can remember.  My top weight was 440 pounds.  I've tried multiple times to lose weight and have been somewhat successful, but have never reached goal, and have always put some back on.  I was diagnosed with type-2 diabetes at my top weight.  The lowest I've gotten was 238 pounds.  When I look in the mirror, I don't recognize myself.  I have one photo of myself as a thin child.  When I was at my lowest weight, I had a shock of recognition.  I saw that thin child.

What I'm Trying to Do

My goal, and the goal of this campaign, is for me to permanently lose weight, get fit, and get off my diabetes medication.  My most recent top weight is 383 pounds on May 31st, 2013.  As of today, August 6, 2013, I weigh 345.  I've done this by weighing and measuring my food, using the My Fitness Pal app and website to track my food and exercise, and riding my bicycle.

I need a new bicycle.

At my current weight, my bicycle is causing serious pain and impeding my ability to make progress.  I bought it brand new in 1991.  I've looked on the internet and talked to local bike shops about what I can do to make my bike more comfortable.  Frankly, my bike is too old and some of the specs are odd.  It would cost a lot of money to make the needed changes and it makes more sense to purchase a new bike.

I would use the bike as my primary mode of exercise and as transportation.  The weather in Santa Rosa and the roads are conducive to riding almost year-round.  What's a little rain?

The bike I'm looking at is nothing fancy, i.e., not carbon fiber, no suspension, etc.  The most fancy thing on it is disc brakes, since it takes a lot to stop this big fella, and they're better in the rain.

The gratitude I would feel is immeasurable.  Being obese, yes morbidly, has affected every aspect of my life.  My health, my self-esteem, my relationships (or lack of them), and my employment.

I am hoping to raise $569.99 US.  With this money, I will complete purchase of a bicycle for my use to get healthy and for transportation.  I will provide documentation of the completed purchase.  The bicycle originally cost $869.99.  I had not anticipated crowdsourcing and have already deposited $300.

What You'll See

You will see my progress towards my fitness goal by following me on Facebook, My Fitness Pal, or other arrangements can be made.  I plan on participating in cycling events and competitions as I progress and will post about these as well.

I've lost 150 or more pounds more than once.  I know I can reach my goal! I will get there!  You can help.  I have never been a normal weight in my adult life, so I've set a temporary goal of 200 pounds.  I will reevaluate this goal as I get closer and can make a more infomed decision.

You Can Help

I know you may not be able to contribute with money, but you can still help.  Make some noise, spread the word, let others know about what I'm trying to do.  Oh, and don't forget to use the Indigogo share tools.  Constructive feedback is also helpful.

Gratefully,

John
