story:
Short Summary

My wife, Grace and I believe that everything to heal our bodies was left here on planet Earth by God. We believe plant oils have the ability to heal our physical and emotional bodies and we've seen some miraculous healing using essential oils from plants.

When I broke my left clavicle in 1998, Grace used four (4) plant oils on my broken "collar bone" that stopped my bone pain in 1 or 2 minutes and that pain has never returned! From that day forward, I've been studying, blending and researching plant oils.

I teach clinical aromatherapy to my Massage Therapy students at our local Community College. I am certified in Clinical Aromatherapy. I studied 300 hours at the Institute of Spiritual Healing & Aromatherapy. www.ishaAromatherapy.com  Grace and I have been teaching therapeutic massage and related courses since 1995 and still enjoy helping caring students pursue their dream of becoming a licensed massage and bodywork therapist.

Grace and I are passionate about helping people accelerate their healing by using therapeutic grade essential (plant) oils. We use essential oils virtually every day.

Our dream is to start an Aromatherapy Factory where people can purchase  Organic and Vegan lotions and cremes filled with organic and wildcrafted plant oils through an online web site.  We'd like to start producing our Pain Potion © and Pain Potion Plus ©.

Your support will help make our Dream and Passion a real business. A business that may help provide many people the opportunity to try something natural for the relief of fibromyalgia, sore feet, tired muscles and joint pain.

What We Need & What You Get

The Aromatherapy Factory will require $6627. in order to purchase the following pieces of new equipment, plant oils and supplies:
  • Filling Machine & Mixer     =     1280.
  • Aromatic Oils, Organic & Vegan  Lotion and Creme     =     1100.
  • 2000 Bottles (3 sizes) & Labels     =     2900.
  • Shipping Boxes, Peanuts & Shipping Labels     =     500.
  • Web Site & Plugins     =     447.
  • iPad     =     400.


You guessed it...! Our perks are 2 oz., 4 oz., and   8 oz. beautiful bottles of Pain Potion ©  and Pain Potion Plus © shipped right to your door. It's the gift that keeps on giving!

If we do not reach our goal of $6627., we can search for used equipment, order a smaller non-bulk number of bottles and use our notebook computer. 


Amanda P. is my most talented student Aromatherapist. She is passionate about blending all natural aromatic blends for herself, her family and friends. Amanda is very accurate regarding her assessment skills.

The benefits of using therapeutic essential plant oils are:
  • Cost effective
  • Safe when used correctly
  • Less toxic than most traditional medicine
  • Smells fantastic
  • Fills a need for an alternative choice

Testimonials:

"Dr. Tim" is an amazing massage therapy teacher and an expert Aromatologist. He taught my class a course in Aromatherapy that consisted of an in depth study of the major essential oils. We also learned how to make our own blends, using the Italian and French methods of blending. His knowledge of plant and essential oil uses and contraindications is unparalleled. "

Kristin Duke, LMT, Florida


"This oil relieved pain that I was having in my elbows as well as my neck. My Father has arthritis in his knees and after this oil was rubbed into both knees, he was able to move them more freely and ambulate without pain. It is great that a remedy that is all natural will restore mobility and relieve pain without all the side effects that so many other medications and analgesics usually produce. I strongly recommend this all natural analgesic oil for pain relief."

Sarah U. Lee, RN, BS, MS

Former Dept. Chair - Health Technologies

South Piedmont Community College


"I am pleased to report that my husband, Henry and I both have experienced positive results from using the aromatherapy oil you created. The numbness and pain Henry has suffered as a result of his stroke have been significantly relieved by massaging his feet with the oil every evening."

Mrs. Peggy Hinkle

Former Admissions Representative

South Piedmont Community College


"I just want to thank you for the pain blend that you recommended for my ankle injury. I applied the blend as you directed and noticed immediate pain relief. I was able to stretch the ankle more effectively and with less pain since first injuring the ankle five weeks ago. I also noticed that I was able to tolerate deeper soft tissue therapy to help improve the circulation to the area. I would welcome the opportunity to speak with you about testing this pain blend in our office."

Dr. Mark Fishel, Chiropractor

Monroe, NC


Risks & Challenges

RISK: Overwhelmed with orders and not enough time to fill
Plan: Hire massage therapy students / grads to help production

RISK: Product Liability Insurance & Correct Labeling of product
Plan: Liability insurance counseling and U.S. FDA Labeling Regulations

RISK: Equipment break down
Plan: Purchase all equipment with long term warranties

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, here's how you can help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your sincere support!

Tim & Grace
story_txt:
Short Summary My wife, Grace and I believe that everything to heal our bodies was left here on planet Earth by God. We believe plant oils have the ability to heal our physical and emotional bodies and we've seen some miraculous healing using essential oils from plants. 
When I broke my left clavicle in 1998, Grace used four (4) plant oils on my broken "collar bone" that stopped my bone pain in 1 or 2 minutes and that pain has never returned! From that day forward, I've been studying, blending and researching plant oils. 
I teach clinical aromatherapy to my Massage Therapy students at our local Community College. I am certified in Clinical Aromatherapy. I studied 300 hours at the Institute of Spiritual Healing & Aromatherapy. www.ishaAromatherapy.com  Grace and I have been teaching therapeutic massage and related courses since 1995 and still enjoy helping caring students pursue their dream of becoming a licensed massage and bodywork therapist.
Grace and I are passionate about helping people accelerate their healing by using therapeutic grade essential (plant) oils. We use essential oils virtually every day.
Our dream is to start an Aromatherapy Factory where people can purchase  Organic and Vegan lotions and cremes filled with organic and wildcrafted plant oils through an online web site.  We'd like to start producing our Pain Potion © and Pain Potion Plus ©.
Your support will help make our Dream and Passion a real business. A business that may help provide many people the opportunity to try something natural for the relief of fibromyalgia, sore feet, tired muscles and joint pain.


What We Need & What You GetThe Aromatherapy Factory will require $6627. in order to purchase the following pieces of new equipment, plant oils and supplies:
Filling Machine & Mixer     =     1280.
Aromatic Oils, Organic & Vegan  Lotion and Creme     =     1100.
2000 Bottles (3 sizes) & Labels     =     2900.
Shipping Boxes, Peanuts & Shipping Labels     =     500.
Web Site & Plugins     =     447.
iPad     =     400.





You guessed it...! Our perks are 2 oz., 4 oz., and   8 oz. beautiful bottles of Pain Potion ©  and Pain Potion Plus © shipped right to your door. It's the gift that keeps on giving!If we do not reach our goal of $6627., we can search for used equipment, order a smaller non-bulk number of bottles and use our notebook computer. 


Amanda P. is my most talented student Aromatherapist. She is passionate about blending all natural aromatic blends for herself, her family and friends. Amanda is very accurate regarding her assessment skills.

The benefits of using therapeutic essential plant oils are:
Cost effective
Safe when used correctly
Less toxic than most traditional medicine
Smells fantastic
Fills a need for an alternative choice

Testimonials:

"Dr. Tim" is an amazing massage therapy teacher and an expert Aromatologist. He taught my class a course in Aromatherapy that consisted of an in depth study of the major essential oils. We also learned how to make our own blends, using the Italian and French methods of blending. His knowledge of plant and essential oil uses and contraindications is unparalleled. "Kristin Duke, LMT, Florida

"This oil relieved pain that I was having in my elbows as well as my neck. My Father has arthritis in his knees and after this oil was rubbed into both knees, he was able to move them more freely and ambulate without pain. It is great that a remedy that is all natural will restore mobility and relieve pain without all the side effects that so many other medications and analgesics usually produce. I strongly recommend this all natural analgesic oil for pain relief."
Sarah U. Lee, RN, BS, MS
Former Dept. Chair - Health Technologies
South Piedmont Community College

"I am pleased to report that my husband, Henry and I both have experienced positive results from using the aromatherapy oil you created. The numbness and pain Henry has suffered as a result of his stroke have been significantly relieved by massaging his feet with the oil every evening."
Mrs. Peggy Hinkle
Former Admissions Representative
South Piedmont Community College

"I just want to thank you for the pain blend that you recommended for my ankle injury. I applied the blend as you directed and noticed immediate pain relief. I was able to stretch the ankle more effectively and with less pain since first injuring the ankle five weeks ago. I also noticed that I was able to tolerate deeper soft tissue therapy to help improve the circulation to the area. I would welcome the opportunity to speak with you about testing this pain blend in our office."
Dr. Mark Fishel, Chiropractor
Monroe, NC

  Risks & ChallengesRISK: Overwhelmed with orders and not enough time to fillPlan: Hire massage therapy students / grads to help productionRISK: Product Liability Insurance & Correct Labeling of productPlan: Liability insurance counseling and U.S. FDA Labeling RegulationsRISK: Equipment break downPlan: Purchase all equipment with long term warranties
  Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, here's how you can help:


Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 Thank you for your sincere support!Tim & Grace

story:
Coach T is an AI assistant for tennis players of all backgrounds. It aims to revolutionize how you learn tennis, ultimately helping your game and saving you money. Built with an Intel Curie chip, Coach T is placed on the tennis racket and analyzes your stroke movements, help tennis beginners correct their movements by delivering coaches' instructions in real time, just like the real coach is beside you.

A set of Coach T includes：

1. RACKET DEVICE

2. BLUETOOTH HEADSET

Coach T will revolutionize your tennis learning experience!

 

 

 

STEP 1. Place Coach T on the throat of your racket and connect it with your smartphone via Bluetooth.

STEP 2.  Coach T records the strokes of your racket, as well as the comments and feedback, given by your private coach, such as “finish higher”, finish lower”, or “nice shot!”

STEP 3.  When practicing alone, you can then wear Bluetooth-connected headphones and listen to your coach's instructions based on your swings. When you swing your racket, you will hear your coach's voice based on the movements of your swing. It feels like your coach is right by your side.

 

 

To further improve the record and analysis functions of Coach T, we use the Curie module, released by Intel earlier this year. The neuron networks in Curie automatically recognize and categorize movements.
Coach T recognizes your swing movements and matches it with your coach's vocal feedback, allowing you to improve your strokes with your coach's guidance even when the lesson is over.

 

​​

 

 

When you start learning tennis, your coach will teach you various basic movements, strokes, and tips to introduce you to the game of tennis. You are then to practice these movements and strokes over time until they become more natural.
Now let's imagine if there was a device that allowed you to track your every stroke and told you whether your movement was correct or not, using the exact same words as you private coach would during a private lesson.
This was the problem when Yanni started learning tennis met, and then Yanni had the idea of creating Coach T.
With the latest AI technology enabled by Curie Neurons, this idea is now a reality. We have worked very hard the past couple months and are happy to announce Coach T, an AI device that will change the way we learn tennis.

 

Our team is composed of a group of avid tennis lovers. We found some problems during the period of tennis learning. So we hope that through our efforts, can do some improvement to the tennis teaching.

 

There are a few ways you can greatly help us in addition to backing our project.

  • Like and follow us on Facebook and Twitter! You’ll receive regular project news and updates here.

If we get enough clicks, we could get featured on Indiegogo’s homepage. Let’s try and make it happen!

  • Leave a comment on our project

We really want to hear from you! Leave us feedback, ask us a question, or simply say hi! We’ll try our best to reply as quickly as we can.

  • Connect with us For Insider Campaign Updates

 

General Coach T Info

Q: Who is Coach T targeted for?

A: We created Coach T primarily to help novice tennis players learn faster and more efficiently. It can also be used for tennis coaches, as well, allowing them to teach their students more efficiently and track their progress.

Q: Is Coach T secure when it’s tied to your racket?

A:  In order to prevent Coach T from falling off your racket when playing, we added a number of mechanical fasteners. It’s passed a number of designs and vigorous tests so we are confident that Coach T will be safe and secure when playing.

Q: How did you implement the functions of Coach T?

A: Coach T features the latest Intel chip, Curie, which is about as small as a button and offers excellent performance. With CurieNeurons, Coach T can recognize any movement and offer feedback, which is why Coach T can improve the tennis learning experience with real-time instructions.

Q: Can I change the color of my Coach T?

A: You can easily change the color by replacing the silicone strap. We offer a variety of straps so you can personalize it as you wish. It’s about as easy as changing cell phone cases so you’ll be ready in no time.

Caring for Coach T

Q: How long can Coach T last in a single charge?

A: With a full charge, Coach T can typically last for about a week.

Q: Does there happen to be a warranty?

A: Don’t worry, we’ve got your covered! Coach T comes with a one-year limited manufacturer warranty. Coach T is highly durable in terms of scratch, shock and abrasion resistance. If you run into any manufacturing defect issues (excluding the silicone straps), we’ll repair or replace your Coach T. Coach T is also water resistant but not water-proof. Submerging Coach T in water will void the warranty. 

Distribution

Q: How will I receive my Coach T?

A: All Coach T’s will be shipped straight to your doorstep through DHL global shipping. Quotes can be provided by us based on your location. Once shipped, we will also provide tracking information so you can keep track of your Coach T.

Q: What payment methods are available?

A: We accept PayPal and all major credit cards.

Supporting us 

Q: Can I distribute Coach T in my store, network, or country?

A: Please send us a request to yanni@makercollider.com including your business information, contact info, and distribution network. We would also like to know if you are retailing or wholesaling, under which brands you distribute, and your network of retailers (if applicable).

Q:  I like the idea behind Coach T and would like to help. Other than backing the project, what else can I do to help?

A: We appreciate your enthusiasm and would love to bring Coach T to the masses worldwide. Spreading the word across social media or even mentioning Coach T to a family member or friend of yours would greatly benefit us in promoting our product and cause.

Q: How can I learn more about Coach T? 

A: Feel free to follow us throughout social media as we can be found on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. We plan to regularly post project news and updates!

story:
Update: While we won't be able to achieve all of the goals outlined below, we would like to add a playlist feature where StreamFIT can design playlists for its members for ease of use.
We have a couple more days to make this happen! Below is a sample of what it would look like.

 

We have new contribution awards for: $5, $19, $33, and $79. Check them out!

Short Summary

StreamFIT (SF) is a subscription-based service featuring streaming fitness videos on a web mobile platform at StreamFIT.com.

The company was originally launched in December 2011 by company founder and CEO BJ Gaddour, CSCS. SF currently offers over 250 world class workout videos with new content added monthly, making it the most comprehensive online fitness resource on the market today.

Users can choose between a free membership with four preselected ad-supported videos per month or an unlimited membership with ad-free access to the entire workout database.

BJ is an internationally recognized fitness expert and a member of the Training Advisory Board for Men's Health, the world's largest men's magazine. He is probably best known for the being the creator of Men's Health DeltaFit Speed Shred, the best-selling DVD series in the history of RODALE Publishing.

BJ is also listed as one of the "100 Fittest Men of All-Time" by Men's Health Magazine and one of the "50 Hottest Trainers in America" according to SHAPE Magazine.

We want to further improve our web mobile platform to create a more complete social fitness media experience that helps our members stay more consistent with their training routines.

Your funds will go towards creating each of the following unique features within our web mobile platform:

- Build your own streaming workout video playlists like you can build your own streaming music playlists with a service like Spotify. Whether you want to save your top 10 favorite videos or abs workouts or combine your favorite warmup, workout and cool-down, you'll be able to completely streamline your fitness experience. Playlists will also play automatically back-to-back. Instead of looking for a warmup, then searching for a workout, then a sizzler, you simply store your favorite combos in a playlist and press once!

- Share your workout video playlists with friends and family via social media to encourage others to get fit. Know a friend who travels a lot and wants to get back in shape? Share your hotel room workout playlist! The options are truly endless to inspire others to make a change. Also, you will be able to share playlists with other StreamFIT members within the website.

- Create your own training plans by week, month, or year with an integrated calendar/scheduling function. This will also allow you to track your compliance to see how consistent you've been with your workouts. You'll be able to share these with other members or on social media in addition to searching the ever-growing database for new training plans. The more members who share their training plans, the more training plans all StreamFITTERS will have to choose from!

- Film 50 more streaming workout videos featuring more equipment-free calorie-killing routines you can do anytime, anywhere. Plus, you'll be able to vote for which types of workouts you want us to film!

- A StreamFIT community where all members can get to know one another, share their favorite workout/nutrition tips, and just have a virtual hangout spot with other like-minded fitness lovers from all over the world!

With your help we'll be able to create the most complete online fitness experience the world has ever seen!

Think of how great it will be to store and share playlists of your favorite workouts and have a community of StreamFITTERS sharing training plans with each other!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $100,000 of total funding. Most of the money will go to development and testing for all of the aforementioned website features. Of course, a percentage will go to Indiegogo fees and rounding up the fabulous awards we've put together for you. Remaining funding will be used to produce even more great content for our users.

If we fall short of our goal, the money will still go to developing the workout playlist capability, but it will not be as comprehensive as we described above.
 
Note: If you currently have an Unlimited Annual membership and contribute to a level that provides membership perks. You will get a coupon code that we ask you to use when your current membership expires. So if you are an Annual Member and contribute $150, that means you have your second year paid for!
 
You can expect physical awards relatively quickly after we complete fundraising. We estimate mid to late September 2013.
 
The workout download will come from a new collection of videos, so we will have to produce it after fundraising and should be expected in October 2013.
 
Memberships will be provided in coupon form. We will send them just before launching the new updates so you can enjoy the very development you contributed to. We will have a better idea of the exact date of completion at the end of the fundrasing campaign and will keep you consistently updated.
 
Wristband (We are going to personalize the message for this campaign, but you get the idea):
 
 
 
By the way, this one says: "My performance enhancing drug is a great workout." Didn't want people getting the wrong idea with only a partial message visible ;)
 
T-Shirt:

There will be two t-shirt options, a basic-T and a baby-T for ladies who want a snug fit. We will choose a fabric that is workout friendly with a crewneck style. This gives you an idea of how the front will look. The back will have a yet TBD commemorative message. 
 
 

Why StreamFIT?

BJ took the concept of fast, fun workouts that could be done at home (or in a hotel room when traveling), and then applied the type of thinking that's made companies like Apple and Netflix hugely popular with its customers. Plus, he made it so that folks of ANY fitness level could benefit.

Whether you're a complete beginner or a longtime fitness enthusiast who loves "extreme" workouts, StreamFIT has a solution for you. Lots of them, in fact. With a click of a button, StreamFIT workouts instantly appear on your desktop, laptop, tablet, smartphone—even on your big-screen TV. But that's just the beginning. Here are some of the highlights:

  • StreamFIT workouts are SIMPLE! You can choose your goal, target area, and type of equipment you have available, and easily search the StreamFIT database of more than 250 workouts for the one that you'd like to try. Hit the play button, and you're ready to sweat!
  • StreamFIT workouts are AWESOME! If you haven't heard of "metabolic resistance training," don't worry. Just think of it as your resistance training and cardio workout all rolled into one. You'll use the resistance training —done with just your body-weight or a pair of dumbbells, or any number of other easily accessible equipment options that StreamFIT recommends — to target every muscle in your body. But you'll do it at a pace that also gives you an incredible cardiovascular workout. This approach torches as many calories per minute as running at a 6-minute per mile pace on the treadmill, according to research from the University of Southern Maine. Plus, studies show that it revs up your metabolism for another 48 hours after you're done working out!
  • StreamFIT workouts are NEVER boring! Right now, there are more than 250 workouts on StreamFIT — and that number is growing every single month. You'll not only find workouts from BJ, but also from a number of world-class fitness experts that BJ handpicked himself. From total-body transformation plans such as the Body-Weight Bootcamp (no equipment needed!) and Metabolic Mayhem (just a pair of dumbbells!) to specialty workouts like the Pregnancy Workout, Kettlebell Kaos, and Fit-Over 40, you simply won't find more incredible workouts — or a more convenient way to get in shape — ANYWHERE!

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love your contribution, but one contribution won't get us to our goal. We need you to help us spread the word! Please share this on Facebook and Twitter, via email, or scream it from your rooftop.

If you know someone who loves to workout, please tell them about StreamFIT and what we're trying to accomplish. Maybe you know someone who doesn't exercise because they travel too much, can't make it to the gym, or don't know what to do? Share it with them too. This is what they have been waiting for!

Let's make StreamFIT an online fitness mecca!

Get StreamFIT!

www.StreamFIT.com

NOTE: If you are already an annual member and your donatation includes a free membership, you will be given a coupon code to use once your current membership expires.

Maybe you know someone who doesn't exercise because they travel too much, can't make it to the gym, or don't know what to do? Share it with them too. This is what they have been waiting for!

Let's make StreamFIT an online fitness mecca!
Get StreamFIT!
www.StreamFIT.com
NOTE: If you are already an annual member and your donatation includes a free membership, you will be given a coupon code to use once your current membership expires.

story:
Who we are

We are a group of students and community members helping to raise funds in support of the Smiles International Foundation; an organization of volunteer medical professionals who treat under-priviledged children with cleft pallet and other crono-facial deformities for free.
 
For this fundraiser we're supporting the part of the organization that travels to Tecate, Mexico three weekends a year to perform these surgeries.

Covering Surgery Costs

A standard cleft pallet surgery can easily cost over $4,000 in the United States. Thanks to Dr. Moses and his team donating their services and even covering personal travel, they've gotten the cost of a surgery down to as little as $250.

This means money donated will go directly into covering the cost of anestesia gas, drugs, and other supplies. Even the smallest donation can make a huge difference in funding these life-changing surgeries.

The Impact

If left untreated these children are not only inflicted with ridicule because of their facial appearance, but also can not eat, or speak well causing them to be unable to communicate, negatively affecting their personal, work, and school life.
 
A program like the Smiles of Tecate allows these children the opportunity to live a normal life and grow up to be happy and productive members of society.
 

Help us spread smiles!

story:
About Ben's Friends Patient Communities

My name is Ben Munoz and my organization, Ben's Friends, builds Online Support Communities for Patients with Rare Diseases. Patients with rare diseases struggle to find support offline and online because these conditions lack the critical mass to organize local support groups and Internet sites don't cater to these patients because they are not economically viable through advertising. 

Even your family lacks the information and understanding to give you all the support you need. It can be very lonely and depressing - I know, because 5 years ago while at Kellogg Business School, I nearly died from a rare condition similar to a brain aneurysm. Today, my friends and I have built a network of 30+ support communities, each catering to a specific rare condition. I'm asking for your financial support so we can continue supporting these 30+ communities (and growing) that serve approximately 30,000 patients and their loved ones a month. 


Benï¿½s Condition

My condition is called Arteriovenous Malformation (AVM) and it's extremely rare. I was saved by emergency surgery but 50% of the people who have an AVM bleed are not so lucky. My condition changed my entire outlook on life and I decided to give back to patients who have rare conditions by becoming a Doctor. After finishing business school, I enrolled at UT Austin to complete my medical school pre-requisites. This summer I took the MCAT and applied to medical school. I'm now on the interview trail, anxious to see where I'll be in the Fall.

While recovering from my AVM, I couldn't find a single support group in the Chicago area so I turned to the Internet for help. Unfortunately there were no Internet support groups for AVM patients either! I finally found the support I was looking for by creating my own group at AVMSurvivors.org. Other AVM patients found us and we grew into a close-knit online family of AVM survivors.

In 2008 we started more patient communities and Ben's Friends has been tripling in size every year since. Almost all of our members tell us that they have never before spoken to anyone with their rare disease in their entire lives! They are excited and comforted to find hundreds of people experiencing the same emotions they are experiencing. They don't feel so alone anymore.


Donations are Appreciated

We launched Ben's Friends as a social enterprise, to do good in the world while breaking even. Over 90 volunteer moderators (patients themselves) volunteer their time and none of us take any compensation for our efforts. We have also contributed over $20,000 of our own money because we believe in the cause. The very few online health sites that serve patients with rare diseases, including Ben's Friends, have a very difficult time generating revenue because the patient populations are so small and fragmented. Most shut down eventually.  We don't want to charge a membership fee because most of our patients are on disability and money is very tight for them. To date, we've been incredibly fortunate to receive donations from friends and patients totaling over $15,000.

I'm writing to ask you for help in the form of volunteer time and/or a financial donation. We could use help getting the word out by leveraging your personal network. In addition, we would be incredibly grateful if you would make a donation to our fundraiser.

Our monthly costs are approaching $2,000 and a $100 donation would fund one of our communities for 3 months. A $500 donation would allow us to start a brand new patient community for a rare disease population that usually has no other option. We constantly have patients writing in to ask us to start a support group for them. We have a waiting list of 100 support groups that we could start tomorrow if we had the funds. If one of your loved ones has been touched by a rare condition, we would be happy to start a community for that condition.

Thanks for reading my story and for the support along the way. Ben's Friends is truly a little Internet miracle and we want to keep it going.


Info

Main website: BensFriends.org 

Patient Testimonials: YouTube.com/BensFriendsVideos & blog.BensFriends.org

Press: BensFriends.org/welcome/in-the-news

Team: BensFriends.org/welcome/team


Huge thanks to our sponsors Molly Mutt, Tiny Prints, the20 Wines and Sports Basement. These are businesses run by wonderful people who love and support Ben's Friends. We couldn't do it without them!

Ben's Friends Traffic Per Month :)

(P.S. We have included a Quantcast traffic/visits chart below.  According to Google our traffic is 35% higher & we quote those figures, but the Quantcast chart is pretty :))


A Beautiful Testimonial by Member & Moderator - JC

story:
Short Summary

Hello friends and family,

I greet you in the matchless name of our Lord. I have been invited to go on a medical mission trip to Gondar Ethiopia in Africa this fall. I must raise the money for the trip by September 1, 2014. So I am ask my friends and loved ones to help me. Please consider donating, as no amount is too small or too large. This Jewish Voice mission clinic sees about 8-9 thousand men, women and children in one week. Together we CAN be living witnesses.

What We Need & What You Get

Every person that I, and the group, minister to, you minister to as well.

So please help.

-  You will receive tax credit and documentation when your gift is received. Thank you my friends and I will be posting and sending out pictures when I return.

-  Custom Postcard with images of my travels, and interaction with patients

The Impact

Jewish Voice has been hard at work offering free medical clinics to the most impoverished pockets of Jewish People around the world, particularly Jewish communities in Africa and India.

The history of JVM’s medical outreaches began in Gondar, Ethiopia, in 1999, where 1,300 people were treated. Those small beginnings have grown, thanks to the blessings of God, our faithful, skilled staff, and our loyal volunteers. Now, some 13 years later, we are treating as many as 5,200 - 9,700 + patients per short-term medical clinic trip!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If someone wants to send a check donation toward this trip, they should include the following information on the memo part of the check:

    Sandra Cann Acct #956961 Gondar trip

    Send To:

    ATTN: Celeste Peters

    Jewish Voice Ministries International

    P.O. Box 81439

    Phoenix, AZ 85069

story:
***UPDATE***  Nov 18th

Bill Churchwell at Kiii Channel 3 did a follow up story on Zeph and Josh on Sunday night.  Video link is below.   Also, if you are local to the area and haven't received your perk or shirt yet, please let me or Josh or Zeph know and we will make sure you get it.  For those of you who are out of town, the last shirts will mailed out today so you should receive them either Friday or early next week.   If anyone still wants to order a shirt or hoodie etc, I will be placing one last order in about a week, so just let me know.  Once the shirts were paid for, the fundraising campaign produced just over $3000 for Zeph and Josh and so we were able to pay for all their major expenses.  Thanks again for all your support.

http://www.kiiitv.com/category/194871/video?aut...

***UPDATE***  Nov 11th

After over 30 runs down Bobsled / Skeleton track in one week, Josh Safarik returned home from Lake Placid Saturday night with a big smile and even bigger bruises.   Some of the athletes Josh was training with did not fair so well and one guy in particular unfortunately broke his collar bone when he crashed hard on one of the last curves in the track.  Josh did not break any bones but he does have some grapefruit size bruises on both his shoulders and triceps.   Apparently if you hit the wall at any point during the run, the force of the impact bounces you over and slams you into the opposite wall too.   So I guess its always a two-for-one special.  Driving the skeleton sled sounds quite complex as Josh describes it despite how simple it looks on TV.  Because of the high speed, any little twitch of your muscles or a glance in the wrong direction with your head can steer the sled in an unwanted direction.  This means that the athletes have to remain loose rather than tense for certain parts of the run, which is hard to do at 60 mph with your face an inch off the ice.  It also means that sometimes you can't really even look to see where you are going so the athletes have to study and memorize the layout of the track and sequence of the curves over and over again in their head.  This doesn't sound that easy when there are 20 different turns in the track.  Despite these challenges, Josh and some of the other athletes graduated to the top of the track by Thursday of this past week and ran the entire length of the course many times before training ended on Saturday.  So all in all it was a great week for Josh and its great to have him home in one piece.   Watch for Zeph and Josh on Kiii TV tonight.  Bill Churchwell is doing a follow up story on them and their new adventures in Boblsed and Skeleton.

Josh's Skeleton sled and helmet - patiently waiting for the next run.


***UPDATE***  Nov 4th

With Zeph back home from Bobsled training, its now Josh's time to feel the adrenaline rush at Lake Placid Skeleton School.  Josh flew out of Corpus Christi Sunday and arrived at The Olympic Training Center very excited and a little nervous about the upcoming week.  There are ten athletes in the school, all of them new to Skeleton.   After some dry-land push training, the coaches threw them right in the fire (or I should say ice) on Monday with their first runs down the lower part of the track.  The coaches start them lower down so they don't get up to ludicrous speed on their very first run.  After his slide, Josh described his first expeirence via txt message; "There is not a roller coaster in the world that can beat this."   The althletes continued training today and have been progressing quickly, starting further and further up the track to get more and more speed.  So far Josh has 8 runs under his belt in just two days and with the good runs also come some hard knocks.   Its suprising to hear from both Josh and Zeph how violent these ice sliding sports are.   Josh said on one of his runs he took a hit so hard on turn ten that he wasn't sure his arm was still attached until he got to the bottom and hand a chance to check it.  Later that evening he described the lingering sensation on his shoulder as "getting a tatoo on a sunburn".   He also mentioned the G-forces in the corners are so strong that you struggle just to keep your face off the ice.  Despite the human pinball type injuries, Josh reports a fun level of 20 on a scale of 1 to 10 and you can hear the excitment in his voice when he talks about the experience.  He is pumped to learn as much as he can from the fantastic Olympic coaches and very determined to keep..... going .......faster.

Josh Safarik at the Lake Placid, NY Bobsled / Skeleton Track.

Josh training on the push track.  
Also, the funding campaign has expired but if anyone wants to order t-shirts etc or make a contribution towards Zeph or Josh's expenses you can just email me directly at gregdespins@gmail.com and I will make it happen.


***UPDATE***  Oct 26th

After two weeks of training, the US National Team Bobsled Racing Trials took place Saturday morning in Lake Placid, New York.  Zeph and his driver Hunter Church very much wanted to compete Saturday however their vicious crash this past Thursday on a training run left Hunter with a concussion; the effects of which he really started to feel Saturday morning.  Unfortunately this meant the medical staff at the Lake Placid Olympic Training Center could not clear him to race Saturday.  So despite a gigantic effort and the best intentions from this daring duo, they had no choice but to bow out of the competition.   So after saying goodbye to the Coaches and athletes, Zeph jumped on a plane Saturday afternoon back home to Rockport Texas in good spirits, filled with optimism about his future in the sport of Bobsledding.
Zeph's journey to this point has been truly exceptional despite this last unfortunate turn of events.  It was only this past July when Zeph first learned about bobsledding and as a possible path for his athletic talent, and now just three months later, he was about to compete for a spot on the US National team against seasoned athletes and Olympic champions.  His odds of making the US National Team so quickly where slim but just the fact that he was able to compete at this level is nothing short of extraordinary.  Imagine learning a new sport one day and three months later competing in that sport at the national level.  That just doesn't happen to regular folks.
Now that the honeymoon is over, Zeph will come back home and begin training and preparing for his next chance at a spot on the National Team.  Armed with this experience and the Olympic coaching resources he has gained from these past two weeks, he will be infinitely more prepared to qualify for the US National Team the next time around.  Even though the event is a year away now, the first step in qualifying will be a skills combine in early spring, which isn't too far away.

Zeph Littleton (Brakeman) and Hunter Church (Driver).


***UPDATE***  Oct 23rd

Check out this video link before you read anymore of this post.     Its worth it.
http://youtu.be/1ig4JLAgTJ0
After 3 days of bobsled training without incident, Zeph and his driver decided it was time to crash today.  I'm sure they didn't plan on crashing but apparently if you go down the track enough times as fast as possible, you will eventually crash.  So what does a crash at 60+ miles an hour in a bobsled feel like?  According to Zeph, "The most vicious thing I've ever experienced."  The bobsled flipped on turn 5 which meant there were still plenty more turns to go through, except that they would go through them upside down, sideways, wrongways, and every other way you don't want to be on a bobsled track.  Most car crashes are over in a couple of seconds.  This one went on for probably a full minute before they came to a stop.  Much like a car wreck, Zeph said the safest place to be in a crash is inside the bobsled but apparently it is extremely difficult to stay inside when you are getting slammed into the corners at mach speed.  He even broke the handle off the inside of the sled because he was pulling so hard on it to stay inside.  And if this isn't fun enough for you, then imagine that while all this is going on you can feel your skin getting hot from the friction of your protective suit rubbing against the ice track at 60 mph.  Apparently the suit doesn't tear but your skin still gets rubbed raw.  Yet despite all this Zeph is pumped to do it all again tomorrow.  He said he's glad he got his first crash over with and that he will take a couple of advil and go out again tomorrow as long as they can get the sled back in working order tonight.  That's ARMY tough for you folks.  Hoo-ah!



***UPDATE***  Oct 19th

Zeph will have his first run down the Lake Placid Olympic track on the first day of ice training tomorrow.  He's teamed up with a young driver who is a senior in high school that has been driving bobsled since he was 12 years old.  Apparently he has logged over 100 runs down the Lake Placid track without any crashes.  The coaches described to Zeph how that first run will feel;  "Like stuffing yourself into a garbage can and bouncing down a mountain".  Zeph's been fitted with special shoes, a helmet and some kind of protective suit and can't wait to get his first run in the morning.  Up until this point, this whole experience has been new, exciting and fun but when he laid out his gear on his bed knowing he was going to be actually bobsledding tomorrow, his comment was "This just got real", in slightly more colorful terms.  He ain't scared.  Maybe just a wee bit.



***UPDATE***  Oct 15th

Here is Zeph pushing on the practice track today.  Yesterday the athletes did some more skill testing which included a sprint and a 1 rep max power clean but... the weights were all in Kilograms.  Since he wasn't exactly sure what his max lift was in kg, he just kept lifting and adding more weight on in true Zeph fashion.  Eventually the coach told him to stop because he had scored 100 out of a possible 100pts for the skill.  Only then did he realize he had power cleaned 150kg (330lbs).  A new personal record for him by 15lbs.  It is also 1.75 times his body weight.


***UPDATE***  Oct 13th

Zeph flew out of Corpus Christi yesterday and arrived at the Lake Placid, New York Olympic Training Facility last night.  He was excited and a little nervous but said everyone there was really nice.  This morning the athletes will be divided into groups and begin their training on pushing the bobsled.  Zeph will be there for one week, possibly two, then back home for a week.  Then he and Josh will head back to Lake Placid together for the Skeleton training.  Thanks again for all the support and contributions in the last few days!


***UPDATE***  Oct 9th

Wow!  $3345 contributed in 4 days!  Your support and excitement for Josh and Zeph is nothing short of amazing.  For those who are wondering, we started this campaign before we knew Zeph was also going to get invited to the National Team Bobsled tryouts so....although we've surpassed our initial $2700 goal, your continued contributions will go a long way in getting him through the Bobsled event.  About 35% of the money contributed will be used to purchase all the sweet perks y'all have ordered so you can expect to get an email soon confirming your shirt sizes and shipping info.  
Both Zeph and Josh put in a hard workout today.  Zeph was also trying on cold weather sprinting tights this afternoon :)  (Its pretty chilly up there in New York)  He leaves for the National Bobsled Push Championships on Sunday.

***UPDATE**  Oct 6th.

Zeph got a call from USA Bobsled and they invited him to the US National Team Bobsled "Push Championships" .  This means he now has a shot to tryout for both Bobsled (Oct 12-19) and Skeleton (Nov 2-8).  We are still getting the details but any contributions over the $2700 goal will certainly be appreciated to get Zeph to this event as well.  Your support has been incredible.  Thanks so much!

They are doing what???!

Zeph Littleton and Josh Safarik have been friends since high school and they are also both Coaches at the local CrossfitXLR8  gym in Portland, TX.   When they discovered that the Olympic Regional Development Authority was looking all over the country for athletes to develop into Olympic Bobsled and Skeleton champions, they jumped at the chance to attend a recruiting combine in Dallas this past July.  The combine consisted of three events; a 60m sprint, standing broad jump and a underhand shot toss.  Zeph and Josh both scored extremely well at the event.  They just recently received the exciting news that they have been invited to a 7 day Skeleton school in Lake Placid, New York (site of the 1980 Winter Olympics) by the Olympic Regional Development Authority!  Check out the "Gallery" tab at the top of the page to see quick videos of what Bobsled and Skeleton are all about.

What They Need

 To get to the event this November at Lake Placid, New York, they could certainly use some help with

  • Airfare to Albany, New York- $450 each
  • Ground Transportation - Albany to Lake Placid return - $100 each 
  • Accommodations & Meals - $775 each 

What You Get

All contributors will receive a real snowball from the Adirondack Mountains as well as .....

  • Any of the PERKS below for your contribution amount (shown on right).



Once we receive your contribution, we will contact you by email to confirm the size you would like.

The Impact of your Contribution

The road to the Olympics is long and tough to say the least.  It takes almost unimaginable determination and resilience as well as the emotional and financial support of family, friends and community.   Zeph and Josh had the guts to take that first step to realize an almost impossible dream ; a South Texas Bobsled TEAM!!  We all know its a long shot, but as hockey legend Wayne Gretzky once said, "You miss 100 percent of the shots you don't take".  Help them take this shot.  With a little luck and a ton of hard work, we just might see these two South Texans on the world stage one day going 85 miles an hour down a brain bending ice track.  Yeeehaw!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with anyone you think might like to hear about this campaign.
You could also donate air-miles for a flight for Zeph or Josh.   
Winter Clothes?  Zeph an Josh might need to borrow some woolies :)

Josh's Skeleton sled and helmet - patiently waiting for the next run.

***UPDATE***  Nov 4th

With Zeph back home from Bobsled training, its now Josh's time to feel the adrenaline rush at Lake Placid Skeleton School.  Josh flew out of Corpus Christi Sunday and arrived at The Olympic Training Center very excited and a little nervous about the upcoming week.  There are ten athletes in the school, all of them new to Skeleton.   After some dry-land push training, the coaches threw them right in the fire (or I should say ice) on Monday with their first runs down the lower part of the track.  The coaches start them lower down so they don't get up to ludicrous speed on their very first run.  After his slide, Josh described his first expeirence via txt message; "There is not a roller coaster in the world that can beat this."   The althletes continued training today and have been progressing quickly, starting further and further up the track to get more and more speed.  So far Josh has 8 runs under his belt in just two days and with the good runs also come some hard knocks.   Its suprising to hear from both Josh and Zeph how violent these ice sliding sports are.   Josh said on one of his runs he took a hit so hard on turn ten that he wasn't sure his arm was still attached until he got to the bottom and hand a chance to check it.  Later that evening he described the lingering sensation on his shoulder as "getting a tatoo on a sunburn".   He also mentioned the G-forces in the corners are so strong that you struggle just to keep your face off the ice.  Despite the human pinball type injuries, Josh reports a fun level of 20 on a scale of 1 to 10 and you can hear the excitment in his voice when he talks about the experience.  He is pumped to learn as much as he can from the fantastic Olympic coaches and very determined to keep..... going .......faster.


Josh Safarik at the Lake Placid, NY Bobsled / Skeleton Track.


Josh training on the push track.  

Also, the funding campaign has expired but if anyone wants to order t-shirts etc or make a contribution towards Zeph or Josh's expenses you can just email me directly at gregdespins@gmail.com and I will make it happen.


***UPDATE***  Oct 26th


After two weeks of training, the US National Team Bobsled Racing Trials took place Saturday morning in Lake Placid, New York.  Zeph and his driver Hunter Church very much wanted to compete Saturday however their vicious crash this past Thursday on a training run left Hunter with a concussion; the effects of which he really started to feel Saturday morning.  Unfortunately this meant the medical staff at the Lake Placid Olympic Training Center could not clear him to race Saturday.  So despite a gigantic effort and the best intentions from this daring duo, they had no choice but to bow out of the competition.   So after saying goodbye to the Coaches and athletes, Zeph jumped on a plane Saturday afternoon back home to Rockport Texas in good spirits, filled with optimism about his future in the sport of Bobsledding.
Zeph's journey to this point has been truly exceptional despite this last unfortunate turn of events.  It was only this past July when Zeph first learned about bobsledding and as a possible path for his athletic talent, and now just three months later, he was about to compete for a spot on the US National team against seasoned athletes and Olympic champions.  His odds of making the US National Team so quickly where slim but just the fact that he was able to compete at this level is nothing short of extraordinary.  Imagine learning a new sport one day and three months later competing in that sport at the national level.  That just doesn't happen to regular folks.

Now that the honeymoon is over, Zeph will come back home and begin training and preparing for his next chance at a spot on the National Team.  Armed with this experience and the Olympic coaching resources he has gained from these past two weeks, he will be infinitely more prepared to qualify for the US National Team the next time around.  Even though the event is a year away now, the first step in qualifying will be a skills combine in early spring, which isn't too far away.
Zeph Littleton (Brakeman) and Hunter Church (Driver).



***UPDATE***  Oct 23rd

Check out this video link before you read anymore of this post.     Its worth it.

http://youtu.be/1ig4JLAgTJ0

After 3 days of bobsled training without incident, Zeph and his driver decided it was time to crash today.  I'm sure they didn't plan on crashing but apparently if you go down the track enough times as fast as possible, you will eventually crash.  So what does a crash at 60+ miles an hour in a bobsled feel like?  According to Zeph, "The most vicious thing I've ever experienced."  The bobsled flipped on turn 5 which meant there were still plenty more turns to go through, except that they would go through them upside down, sideways, wrongways, and every other way you don't want to be on a bobsled track.  Most car crashes are over in a couple of seconds.  This one went on for probably a full minute before they came to a stop.  Much like a car wreck, Zeph said the safest place to be in a crash is inside the bobsled but apparently it is extremely difficult to stay inside when you are getting slammed into the corners at mach speed.  He even broke the handle off the inside of the sled because he was pulling so hard on it to stay inside.  And if this isn't fun enough for you, then imagine that while all this is going on you can feel your skin getting hot from the friction of your protective suit rubbing against the ice track at 60 mph.  Apparently the suit doesn't tear but your skin still gets rubbed raw.  Yet despite all this Zeph is pumped to do it all again tomorrow.  He said he's glad he got his first crash over with and that he will take a couple of advil and go out again tomorrow as long as they can get the sled back in working order tonight.  That's ARMY tough for you folks.  Hoo-ah!






***UPDATE***  Oct 19th
Zeph will have his first run down the Lake Placid Olympic track on the first day of ice training tomorrow.  He's teamed up with a young driver who is a senior in high school that has been driving bobsled since he was 12 years old.  Apparently he has logged over 100 runs down the Lake Placid track without any crashes.  The coaches described to Zeph how that first run will feel;  "Like stuffing yourself into a garbage can and bouncing down a mountain".  Zeph's been fitted with special shoes, a helmet and some kind of protective suit and can't wait to get his first run in the morning.  Up until this point, this whole experience has been new, exciting and fun but when he laid out his gear on his bed knowing he was going to be actually bobsledding tomorrow, his comment was "This just got real", in slightly more colorful terms.  He ain't scared.  Maybe just a wee bit.








***UPDATE***  Oct 15th

Here is Zeph pushing on the practice track today.  Yesterday the athletes did some more skill testing which included a sprint and a 1 rep max power clean but... the weights were all in Kilograms.  Since he wasn't exactly sure what his max lift was in kg, he just kept lifting and adding more weight on in true Zeph fashion.  Eventually the coach told him to stop because he had scored 100 out of a possible 100pts for the skill.  Only then did he realize he had power cleaned 150kg (330lbs).  A new personal record for him by 15lbs.  It is also 1.75 times his body weight.


***UPDATE***  Oct 13th
Zeph flew out of Corpus Christi yesterday and arrived at the Lake Placid, New York Olympic Training Facility last night.  He was excited and a little nervous but said everyone there was really nice.  This morning the athletes will be divided into groups and begin their training on pushing the bobsled.  Zeph will be there for one week, possibly two, then back home for a week.  Then he and Josh will head back to Lake Placid together for the Skeleton training.  Thanks again for all the support and contributions in the last few days!




***UPDATE***  Oct 9th
Wow!  $3345 contributed in 4 days!  Your support and excitement for Josh and Zeph is nothing short of amazing.  For those who are wondering, we started this campaign before we knew Zeph was also going to get invited to the National Team Bobsled tryouts so....although we've surpassed our initial $2700 goal, your continued contributions will go a long way in getting him through the Bobsled event.  About 35% of the money contributed will be used to purchase all the sweet perks y'all have ordered so you can expect to get an email soon confirming your shirt sizes and shipping info.  
Both Zeph and Josh put in a hard workout today.  Zeph was also trying on cold weather sprinting tights this afternoon :)  (Its pretty chilly up there in New York)  He leaves for the National Bobsled Push Championships on Sunday.

***UPDATE**  Oct 6th.
Zeph got a call from USA Bobsled and they invited him to the US National Team Bobsled "Push Championships" .  This means he now has a shot to tryout for both Bobsled (Oct 12-19) and Skeleton (Nov 2-8).  We are still getting the details but any contributions over the $2700 goal will certainly be appreciated to get Zeph to this event as well.  Your support has been incredible.  Thanks so much!

They are doing what???! Zeph Littleton and Josh Safarik have been friends since high school and they are also both Coaches at the local CrossfitXLR8  gym in Portland, TX.   When they discovered that the Olympic Regional Development Authority was looking all over the country for athletes to develop into Olympic Bobsled and Skeleton champions, they jumped at the chance to attend a recruiting combine in Dallas this past July.  The combine consisted of three events; a 60m sprint, standing broad jump and a underhand shot toss.  Zeph and Josh both scored extremely well at the event.  They just recently received the exciting news that they have been invited to a 7 day Skeleton school in Lake Placid, New York (site of the 1980 Winter Olympics) by the Olympic Regional Development Authority!  Check out the "Gallery" tab at the top of the page to see quick videos of what Bobsled and Skeleton are all about.   What They Need  To get to the event this November at Lake Placid, New York, they could certainly use some help with 
Airfare to Albany, New York- $450 each Ground Transportation - Albany to Lake Placid return - $100 each 
Accommodations & Meals - $775 each 

  What You Get
All contributors will receive a real snowball from the Adirondack Mountains as well as .....

Any of the PERKS below for your contribution amount (shown on right).











Once we receive your contribution, we will contact you by email to confirm the size you would like.

The Impact of your Contribution The road to the Olympics is long and tough to say the least.  It takes almost unimaginable determination and resilience as well as the emotional and financial support of family, friends and community.   Zeph and Josh had the guts to take that first step to realize an almost impossible dream ; a South Texas Bobsled TEAM!!  We all know its a long shot, but as hockey legend Wayne Gretzky once said, "You miss 100 percent of the shots you don't take".  Help them take this shot.  With a little luck and a ton of hard work, we just might see these two South Texans on the world stage one day going 85 miles an hour down a brain bending ice track.  Yeeehaw!!
Other Ways You Can Help
Share this with anyone you think might like to hear about this campaign.
You could also donate air-miles for a flight for Zeph or Josh.   
Winter Clothes?  Zeph an Josh might need to borrow some woolies :)

story:
I am running my first half marathon on Jan 18 in Mumbai! 

Besides wanting to prove that I can run for 13 miles straight, I'm also running to raise money for the Foundation for Mother and Child Health, an excellent organization in Mumbai that works in economically underprivileged communities to provide full access to preventative healthcare and balanced nutrition. FMCH has three operational sites in the Dhobi Ghat slum, partners in Dharavi, and Virar, an Out-Patients’Department at Wadia Hospital for SAM children and a successfully replicated model in rural Maharashtra that has the long-term capacity to reach more than 100,000 people.

I've committed to raising at least $200 (though I'd love to get to $500 if possible) for them and I'd love your help in reaching this goal. If just 20 people give $10 each, then we're set. Thanks in advance for any support that you can give.

FMCH has three operational sites in the Dhobi Ghat slum, partners in Dharavi, and Virar, an Out-Patients’Department at Wadia Hospital for SAM children and a successfully replicated model in rural Maharashtra that has the long-term capacity to reach more than 100,000 people.I've committed to raising at least $200 (though I'd love to get to $500 if possible) for them and I'd love your help in reaching this goal. If just 20 people give $10 each, then we're set. Thanks in advance for any support that you can give.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Nana Fifield and I'm raising funds for the Ghana Alzheimer's charity.

This charity is very close to my heart as my Father, a retired professor of Mathematics and Physics, is suffering from this terrible disease.

The Ghana Alzheimer's charity works diligently to raise awareness and funds for its sufferers but needs great support, particularly financially, to continue with its awareness programme in Africa, to train, educate and provide much-needed carer for families and sufferers.

Today, the charity is run by very determined, caring and passionate volunteers.  

The goal of this fundraising campaign is to raise enough money for the charity to provide a well-staffed day care centre and community for Alzheimer's sufferers and their families in Ghana.

So please Help us to Make This Happen!

What We Need & What You Get

To set up this Day Care Centre, we need

  • £1,000
  • Every penny counts!

The Impact

You will make a Difference:

  • In a country where awareness is a must and there are few, if any, facilities for sufferers, this facility will give families and sufferers a place to go to learn more about the disease and to receive the care and support they need.
  • The charity is run by a full time medical doctor with a young family who is very passionate about her work as she has endured the effects of this terrible disease on her family.
  • If you've ever experienced or know of someone suffering from Alzheimer's I'm sure you'll be aware of the helpless struggles and 'loss' of someone you love.

Risks & Challenges

 I will be running 13.1 miles at the Reading Half Marathon, aiming to complete it within 1 hour and 50 minutes.

This will be an incredible achievement and will require a huge investment of time and energy, training hard to build my stamina and agility!

  • I am to train 3-4 days a week, spending at least an hour a day pounding the pavement in my hometown.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't contribute financially, that's fine too.

You can contribute by creating your own indiegogo account for the Alzheimer's Ghana charity and raising funds through your own charitable event.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Carson was born September 29th, 2009 with Cerebral Palsy. His family celebrated him third birthday with him only a few short weeks ago. This morning this sweet little boy passed away unexpectedly.

Post from Sara-Carson's Mom

"We lost our sweet, beautiful, handsome little boy suddenly and unexpectedly this morning. Carson, the day you entered our lives 3 years ago you changed us for the better. You made us more patient, caring, and compassionate. We never took a day for granted when you were here. You will always be our angel baby. We love you so much. Rest in peace and comfort sweet baby <3

This sweet boy, his sister and his mother Sara were at our home yesterday. Just yesterday, they were helping to make our home a better place for Easton to come home to. Selflessly making meals for the contractors that also volunteered their time to help out a family that they dont even know. Now I am asking for us to help ease the financial burden for Carson's family and the expenses for his arrangements. This little boy deserves to rest in peace...

story:
Jazzy Has SMA type 1

Hello we are Lawrence and Patina Winston the parents of Jazarria (Jazzy) Winston. We have a daughter who is 10 months old and has Spinal Muscular Atrophy type 1. She has been in the hospital for over 3 months. She has been through so much in such a short time. Spinal Muscular Atrophy type 1 is genetic disease that effects the muscles, heart, spine, and lungs. She is not able to crawl, hold her head up, or even be fed by with a bottle. When she was diagnosed with this disease we were heartbroken. We have been gone from our hometown for so long she has been in Cincinatti childrens hospital for over 2 1/2 months and we have spent every penny we had to get her there.

Need a home that is condusive to her health needs.

We need a home before we can take Jazzy Home.

  • We are in need of $135,000 that is to pay for a home and get it ready for her medical nesscessity.
  • We have started a caring bridge page which keeps you inform on how she is doing. As well as photos of her.
  • The money still goes to a home for her and we will continue to raise funds to meet health requirements as well as her medical expenses.

Help in saving her Life

We have not been able to take our baby home and the hospital has agreed to postpone making arrangments to send her to  a nursing home.

  • You will be helping to save a babies life and give her the chance to survive and not have a life that is in a nursing home and 7 hours aways from her family.
  • We just want to give our child a safe home to live in and be able to take care of her our selves. We do not want her to be in a nursing home.

Other Ways You Can Help

 We understand that everyone is not able to donate but you can still help Jazzy.

  • Tell as many people as you can post on facebook and twitter to get others to donate and help towards bring Jazzy home.
  • Use the indiego tools to help us promote the awareness of her needs as well as this disease.

 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Beards Fork is situated in the Loop Creek watershed in the  heart of central Appalachia, and smack dab in the middle of the billion dollar coal fields. Like other communities in Appalachia it's history is riddled in stories of mining families, mutual aid, and an unwavering sense of place. This proud history lives on as Beards Fork is home to the Southern Appalachian Labor School (SALS). SALS works on vital projects such as the robust after school program, Energy Express, and Youthbuild programs that train local youth in trades, while building affordable housing throughout Fayette County. Over the decades their community programs have supported union miners fighting for Black Lung benefits, leading all the way up to today supporting union miners’ fight for fairness raging currently between Patriot Coal and their pensioners.


All of this community building has happened while being in the middle of a region that has a lot of questions that need to be answered about public health. Beards Fork is in the heart of the diabetes belt, appears to have high levels of various respiratory illnesses such as: Asthma, COPD, and black lung, and through personal accounts of community members- high rates of cancer.


To date, there has been a cloudy understanding of the health problems faced by the people of Beards Fork and their causes. Beards Fork  has many indicators of heightened health risks, with a high poverty rate, food insecurity, contaminated water, air pollution, workplace hazards, and a high rate of industry in the area. The industry around Loop Creek  includes surface mining, to which recent studies have shown a correlative link between with  serious health problems. Local residents of Beards Fork have begun to question the state of public health within their  watershed, and are working together to build community knowledge about their health.


To  address these issues, residents of Beards Fork and the surrounding communities have decided to create a robust and participatory health survey. This survey will connect community members, volunteers, and experts in public health and epidemiology to engage  the community in an effort to learn more about their public health, and give the information needed to make community decisions about the conditions that determine their health.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise 2,700 dollars. Your donation will go to the following.

. 500.00 Donation to the Southern Appalachian Labor School for housing, access to their office and resources.

. 1000.00 Stipend for Project Coordinator Dustin Steele who is working full time with the Coalfield Environmental Health Project this summer to make this survey a reality.

. 200.00 For travel costs for volunteers and trainers.

. 250.00 For food and other expenses during the kick off event and three volunteer days.

. 500.00 Stipend for the Community Coordinator from Beards Fork.  

The Impact

We believe that knowledge is a cornerstone of building power and strengthening communities. This survey will be shaped by the community; they'll help write and administer the survey. Residents will be able to have a common knowledge of the health of their community.  We believe that knowlede of community health can  be the foundations of further action to improve the health of Beards Fork and the surrounding communities.


The methods of this survey are created with the intention of it being replicable, so that other folks in Appalachia can pick up the tools we used to gauge public health in their own communities.  


Finally, and most importantly knowledge of the health of one’s community should be a right to all. Only  through working together can we actualize healthier communities. This information is not only vital to explore if there are clusters of serious illnesses within the Loop Creek watershed, but to create a foundation that continues in the proud Appalachian tradition of neighbor helping neighbor.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out!, If you can’t donate volunteer.  If you can donate volunteer.

  • If you can do neither, share this with your friends.  

  • We are going to have trainings and volunteer days all through the Summer. You can contact us at satjrsteele@gmail.com if you have any questions regarding dates and times of events, and how to get involved.

story:
Our Story

My wonderful loving husband and father to 3 children passed away on March 7, losing his battle with cancer of the esophagus. Steve had his esophagus removed on February 7th and spent a total of 28 days in the hospital with 26 of those in ICU at UT Southwestern/St Paul in Dallas, TX.

 

The Impact

 I have been unemployed since August of 2011, a month after we found out he had cancer. Me not working was a blessing in disguise as it allowed me to be by my husband's side in this final journey he took. We were not financially prepared for this so we are trying to raise some money to assist with the funeral cost. I realize going through this I am in the wrong field, to just cremate someone it is $3000.00!

story:
Why SuperBallz?

We offer a nutrient dense snack, made of organic non-GMO ingredients in their whole form, that balances carbohydrates, proteins, and quality fats. As our culture becomes more conscious of health and the role of nutrition- the processed, “food-like” products masquerading as health food are becoming more prominent. SuperBallz are not only a power packed healthy snack, but an intro to nutrition for your whole family.  And there's no secret, no confusion; nothing but the incredible medicinal powers of 100% organic foods in their purest form. 

                 


From Our Super Heroes:

We believe in the healing power of food.  We believe that providing a quality product paired with nutrition education can lead to personal empowerment and wellness throughout the community.  We believe in using only 100% organic, whole food ingredients in their purest form. And... we believe there is nothing tastier.  

                         

Meet Ali Miller, RD, LD, CDE (on the right): 

Integrative dietitian and owner of Naturally Nourished a nutrition practice using food-as-medicine to prevent disease and promote wellness, a real-foods enthusiast and farm-to-table activist. 

Ali had a mission- to perfect a nutrient-dense snack that balanced sugar levels, promoted healthy body composition, and would be seen as a guiltless pleasure. Her nemesis in this mission: the over-processed bar; unappealing in texture, high in sugar and low in quality ingredients.

Meet Tamara Basham (on the left): 

Montessori teacher and mother of two; balancing time, money and a need for simple, quality  foods for her family.

Tamara's mission- to incorporate healthier snacks into her family’s life with ease. Constantly navigating the treacherous grocery store aisles for truly healthy foods gave way to frustration. Tamara's fight was against misinformation and marketing claims. 

The Collision of Purpose:

These missions crossed paths one day in 2011- when Ali introduced Tamara to her nut ball recipes to try with her own family. These power-packed snacks soon became a family favorite. Whether serving as a quick breakfast, snack, or decadent dessert, there was a sense of confidence that she was providing a health promoting necessity.

This idea that a product could serve as both an indulgence and a key player in optimal nutrition seemed worth sharing with the community. Ali and Tamara continued to build on the synergy of their strengths and passions uniting up-to-date food-as-medicine research with real life applications that appeal to all palates. 

We Need your Help!

We need you to help us fulfill our vision- to see SuperBallz grow beyond our kitchens, beyond the Farmers Market, and onto the grocery store shelves. With your contribution you will provide us the opportunity to create a sustainable product that can be readily available for purchase at local retailers, grocers, fitness/yoga studios, wellness practitioners’ offices, and even vending machines!

As a full-time integrative dietitian with a busy client load and teacher with an active household, we lack the time and resources to make this vision a reality on our own! 

We need $16,500 to fund a launch of SuperBallz. We are hoping to launch in Houston by November 1, 2013 and be available to other Texas markets soon after. Beyond that, we have a vision to be a nationally known brand, promoting nutrient-dense snacks with advocacy for real foods and balanced eating as soon as practical! 

Not only do we need people like you to support the mission and spread the word, we need funding for start-up costs as well as our first three months of operation. We find this an essential minimum to give our vision a true chance! Any & Everything Helps! We are determined to see SuperBallz on market shelves everywhere, and even if we fall short of our goal, we will continue to grow this vision at a slow and organic pace.  Your support is invaluable in helping this vision become a reality.

                       


Beyond the SuperBallz product, our Mission is to EMPOWER the community through outreach and education! We look at SuperBallz as an opportunity to start a conversation about local and organic produce, the importance of labeling GMOs, the role of balanced nutrition in growing children, the impact of quality fats on balancing hormone levels and regulating thyroid health, etc. Once these ballz get a' Rollin' Ali and Tamara will offer monthly outreach classes free to the community to promote optimal eating, mindfulness, and wellness. 


Funds will go to: 

The launch and development of SuperBallz as well as our first 3 months of operation expenses. This includes: Website Development, Packaging, Marketing Materials, Printing Costs, Prototype Development, Operating costs, Ingredients, Samples for outreach events, Kitchen Rental, Licensing, Permits, Nutritional Outreach, Curriculum Development, Training, Kind Wages, and Opportunities for Employment in the Community.

                           

Our Fierce Flavors and Ingredients we are Proud of: 

ChocoChia Bliss Ballz: Almonds, Chia Seeds, Raw Cacao Nibs, Dates, Raw Cacao powder, Walnuts, Vanilla, Course Celtic Grey salt

BerryZesty Boost Ballz: Macadamia nuts, Brazil nuts, Lemon zest, Blueberries, freshly squeeze lemon juice, Cashews, Local Wild Unfiltered Raw Honey, Sea Salt

Carrot CinnEnergy Ballz: Almonds, Gluten-free rolled oats, Carrots, Coconut Oil, Sunflower Seeds, Shredded Coconut, Maple Syrup, Grass-fed Non-denatured Whey protein powder, Cinnamon, Vanilla, Sea Salt 

GojiHemp Harmony Ballz: Sunflower Seeds, Hemp Seeds, Goji Berries, Macca, Sea Salt

Ingredients and flavors are 100%: Organic, Gluten-Free, Agave-Free, GMO-free

SUPPORT OUR VISION! WE ARE UNDERDOGS IN THE FIGHT FOR REAL FOOD! VOTE WITH YOUR DOLLAR FOR OUR SMALL BUSINESS LOOKING TO MAKE BIG CHANGES! CHECK OUT OUR INCENTIVES AND OFFERINGS OF GRATITUDE BELOW!

story:
My name is Cristin and 3 years ago my younger sister Connie was battling breast cancer and was also caught up in insurance issues. At that time, so many people came forward to help and I will never forget the generosity of strangers. 

Reading this article about Bev Veals' similar battle inspired me to try to help her raise the funds so she can have her meds and still heat her home in the winter. Please help if you are able to. 

http://bigstory.ap.org/article/patients-bill-soars-health-law-program-falters


Photo credit Broome/AP
