More images available at; https://imageshack.com/a/DQTz/1
(viewer discretion is advised)

Hi to everyone out there. 

I'm going to introduce you to our first working prototype of a full thrusting, hand held pleasure device for both male and female who like to feel that moment of effortless penetration. We call it MiaMaxx!

Unlike others moving dildos, this device gives a full 75mm (3 inch stroke) for those who want that edge when it really matters. It also has a brilliant vibrating function at the tip of the device.

As you can see from the video we've created our first sexy prototype and it works as beautifully as we had hoped. The final manufactured product will be a tighter, smoother unit with electronics and additional clip-on sleeves finalized for you to enjoy the new deep thrusting experience. The reason we're here is because... 

We're at the end of a long but exciting development stage and would like to complete the final moments of this project with the help of those of you out there who understand this cool journey isn't yet finished.


On behalf of the few of us who worked tirelessly on the MiaMaxx prototype and its clip on sheath designs, we'd like to offer you the opportunity to become part of its exciting completion.

Further details of support through donation can be found at Our Facebook Page



What We Need & What You Get

As  you can see from the video, we've created the working prototype.

But.. we need more funding to complete the first production run!

We are short $45,000 to complete the first pre-orders and finalize the product for launch.

The development of MiaMaxx, though exciting was a more expensive journey than planned for. We also know that to create something special takes a special amount of time. This was reflected in the research and development estimate of 24 months extending to a full 4 years.

Extra funding and your generous support, whether verbal or financial is essential to the progress of MiaMaxx. We are so close now. To have this very special pleasure device waiting to enter your world in early 2015 would make our journey complete. Please support in any way you can.



The Impact

MiaMaxx is a huge step forward for women and men. Throughout history static dildos and vibrators were the most used for pleasure. They were cool and made you feel good... but you did all the work,  MiaMaxx is carefully designed to ease this manual penetration.

As a supporter, you will helps us create the next generation of robotic devices so that will give us simulated sexual motions. We are confidant that you'll love MiaMaxx and we are super thankful to you for your support.

Now let's run through what MiaMaxx can do for these groups.

MiaMaxx will have a basic head length (sleeve) measuring 110mm (4 inches or so) which can be inserted in any orifice that gives you pleasure. It can be used with or without lubrication although a lubricant is recommended for the uninitiated. We will eventually develop our own brand, but first things first.

MiaMaxx has a strong powerful vibrator positioned at the tip. This allows it to be used as a standard dildo. So what you say? Been there, done that? MiaMaxx is not so one dimensional. It's a sleek moving, deep penetrating, hard thrusting pleasure device that will outlast many others before needing a quick re-charge from the charger. If you can personally go on for hours and hours you will understandably outlast it and probably need help, but never fear; if you're not finished partying you can cruise through  with help from an extra longer than normal connector leading back to your charger.

Before this would be needed, the NiCad batteries of MiaMaxx will run for about 30 minutes. This should be enough to please all but the deliciously insatiable.

All you have to do to begin is insert MiaMaxx from any position then start it slowly thrusting. No need to push it in and out yourself. Just hold it and enjoy. When you're comfortable and confident, you can crank up the speed and drift away..

So who would take pleasure from the smooth, effortless thrusting of this device? Well just about everyone! 

  • Single women
  • Single men
  • Gay couples
  • Lesbian couples
  • Heterosexual couples
  • Anyone!



The Head.

At the moment, the maximum extension the head can give is a full 75mm (3 inch) stroke to imitate the thrust of a partner.

It will eventually have two other settings at 25mm (1 inch) and 50mm (2 inches) that can be set to random. Like a guy who likes to dip and tease. (We're almost there with this..)

We are working to have a full 95mm stroke (4 inches) before launch, but at the moment it is a nice 75mm (3 inches).The base unit tip diameter  is 42 mm narrowing to 30mm. The extra sleeves will come in many different girth sizes to suit the most adventurous. 

To accompany these thrusts MiaMaxx has three speed settings; slow, medium and fast. Any combination of these thrusts and speed settings is at the users fingertips easily reached via the curved ergonomic handle. If it is held in both hands with the buttons in easy view you will have an awesome ride and absolute control. No more slippery grip, no more "where's the off button.."

Check out the sleeves:


These are an assortment of "click-on" sleeves that can be attached to the sleek MiaMaxx head. This gives a huge variety of shapes, colors, textures and girth to an already tireless, pumping, hand held stud.

The sleeves are rippled, ringed, club shaped and spiraled with an original penis shape and color range now considered.

This penis range would be part of a size and thickness collection, although a standard shelf bought dildo is recommended over a certain size because of structural and mechanical limitations within the MiaMaxx unit.

Attachment close to final design and production:

A cradle (see below) allows MiaMaxx to be secured in place so full hands free operations can give you the perfect orgasm.


The cradle has suction feet so it can sit securely on walls, floor, bathroom tiles or even glass! It will not move or slide while MiaMaxx gives its series of perfect strokes.


Attachments that are close to final design and production:

Clitoral vibrator. Around the neck of MiaMaxx, behind the extending bellows, a clitoral vibrator will be attached or molded into the handle. (The next step to completion) This arcs over the bellows and would be in constant clitoral contact. This vibrator can be activated in addition to the tip vibrator, the depth settings and the speed settings. So with the vibrators going and MiaMaxx thrusting, everyone can have a load of fun.

So, in conclusion, if the Indiegogo project is successful we will be able to complete the MiaMaxx features and develop further additional extras or add-ons to enhance the toys pleasurable experience, (the stand for example) but for now we only need to complete the main MiaMaxx unit and the "click" on sleeves.

So if you're gay or straight, male or female and you believe this new deep thrusting, hand held device could represent a whole new sexual experience for you and your friends; please help us support its final journey to completion.



How about an app?

Well, we have the MiaMaxx and an array of erotic sleeves.

The next is the integration of WiFi into the toy. This would be incorporated in MiaMaxx 2 allowing a partner to control the speed and depth of thrust through their phone. Put the phone on speaker and start talking dirty.

As previously mentioned, the other feature of the second MiaMaxx would be the clitoral vibrator fixed to the handle. This would appeal mostly to female groups for obvious reasons, but hey, whatever rocks your boat. To the guys out there, turn in around and let it vibrate your scrotum.

But that is not the end.

The next step for us is to finalize the positioning stand for hands free use. (See diagrams) It's a simple rotate and lock device where the MiaMaxx can be used in many positions.

Over the long journey we have discussed with individuals and focus groups about certain aspects of the MiaMaxx device. What for example are the negatives which could take away confidence in the product?

We believed there were 2 main items that needed attention. These are:

1. Electrical. (as in the charger lead)

2. Speed and depth of thrust.

Let's look at the first.

1. It's a known fact that anything electrical needs to be isolated from a water source. IE: Amps+volts+H2O= ZZZZap!! Not good.

Now MiaMaxx is a low voltage device and categorized as splash proof. It's not waterproof because of the charger port. In consequence care needs to be taken, especially when batteries are low and the charger cord is attached. We are compensating for the few who may take MiaMaxx into the shower or bath. We've done this by adding a basic cut-off circuit, like a safety switch. If the device is fully emerged whilst attached to a wall outlet, it will simply go to sleep and may never wake up again. In consequence the warranty may become void.

We have designers and electrical engineers working with us on this cut-off system and will be ready for product launch. Another alternative being considered is a magnetic coupler.

We have instructions regarding these NOT to do scenarios included in our 'How to use/warranty booklet. Of course MiaMaxx can be submerged for a short time in water, as long as the small rubber tab is pressed back into the charger port. This allows for a thorough cleaning after use.

So to reiterate. If you purchase a MiaMaxx through donation, please don't use it as a submarine or play "Hide the Sausage" in the shower. It will love you as much as you love it as long as you follow instructions.

2. Because of the unique thrusting motion of MiaMaxx, the potential for over insertion coupled to a fast motion speed could lead to internal bruising. To overcome this we are programming the electronics to only start the device on the slowest speed. It is then up to the individual to increase the speed and depth settings to find the most comfortable insertion depth. So! no surprises as a full and fast thrust tries to make your eyes pop and water.

Again, instructions regarding this operation are included in our 'How to use' and warranty booklet.

As an addition here we've taken great care to have MiaMaxx manufactured with the most recent and non-toxic materials as used within the Adult Toy Manufacturing Industry. A list of these will be posted as the final outer design and color is completed.

Possible concerns?

Q: What if the removable clip-on head detaches whilst inside?
A: Well we'd like to say squat down and cough as hard as you can, but this isn't going to happen.

We looked at this possibility through earlier design stages and re-jigged the mechanism so a firm twist and tug would release the interchangeable head. If you have vaginal or rectal muscles strong enough to do this, well, there's another career for you somewhere out there.

The final concern is our dwindling overdraft and we hope its not about to bite us in the butt, especially now when we're so close to completion. Your generous donations, curious interest, recommendations to friends and the purchase of pre-launch MiaMaxx products will certainly ease the pain.

On a final note: All members of DareToo Pty Ltd and the Development Team have backgrounds in their own business affairs, so a firm management structure is in place to ensure a long and exciting future in creating many more robotic-type devices.

It’s been mentioned that our journey’s been a long and sometimes frustrating one. Bruno believed in what had been created but mechanical engineering and a sturdy thrusting framework was not a pretty thing. It had to be a sleek hand held pleasure device people would want to use with confidence. Because of this, we feel an integral member of the Team should be awarded a special mention.

Eddie Norcott, VP of engineering at EB2 Global, take a bow. You stayed true to Bruno’s dream when others were ready to take to the bottle. His knowledge and insight within the engineering and manufacturing industry coupled with his expertly sourced industry contacts allowed for a continuous flow of design, research and development to evolve into the sleek, hand held MiaMaxx we have today. His tenacity for solving the many problems encountered has come to fruition and we can now take this moment to personally say… “Thanks Eddie, for a great team effort.”


Not your thing? 

Perhaps you could send this page to your friends or just spread the word.
You just never know..

  • Remember to  use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Background

Dee was a professional and a graduate student. However, depression kicked in and forced her to quit both school and work. Thousands of dollars' worth of therapy, medication and doctors have not helped so far, and she has fallen into despair. Doctors have decided that electroconvulsive therapy ("shock therapy") may be the only way to help. However, Dee's health insurance does not cover most of the costs. Please help with however much you can.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to pay the good doctors at NYU Medical Center, because Aetna's HMO will not cover them. Dee may need up to 12 ECT sessions, and the doctor's fee is close to $400 for each one.

Along with being a social services professional, Dee is also a soapmaker. She will send home made soap to each person who is generous to give $25 or more!

Every cent will go toward the treatment and related expenses. The surplus, if any will go to the National Alliance on Mental Illness. Find out more about NAMI at www.nami.org.

A Small Favor

Remember, mental illness is not a personal failing. It is not due to morals, and it does not discriminate; it affects people of all races, religions, and economic backgrounds. Please, even if you cannot contribute, be sure to remember those close to you with mental illness and try to make their day!

story:
Tamra's Story

Dear Friends,

 

Hello, My name is Tamra Barrow. I am 36 years old, with a wonderful husband Robert and three amazing children who reside in Burnet, TX. Robert and I have been married 9 years, and have had a very rough road.  My daughter Courtney (13) and son Colby (12), are from a previous marriage but Robert has raised them. We tried for three years to have a child together, finally we were blessed with Kenzie 6 years ago.  The family was finally complete. I started having some health issues right after Kenzie was born, and found out that I had Graves Disease and it was recommended that I receive iodine radiation. Before we could deal with this issue the following became priority.

 

One morning approximately 5 years ago while getting my older children ready for school, Kenzie was not making any noise on the baby monitor so I let her sleep while preparing for the morning. When I went into her room, it was a terrible sight. My 7 month old with no previous issues, was in a full blown seizure, barely breathing, burning up with fever and lethargic. Needless to say, before EMS got Kenzie to the local hospital the seizure had lasted at least 25 minutes that we know of. The ICU team from Austin came to get her and we were taken to Brackenridge Children’s hospital (before Dell). After several tests, turned out she had developed a very rare condition called Hemiplegica Hemiconvulsion Epilepsy Syndrome. She was the youngest child and only the 5th child to  ever have this syndrome. The doctors told us she would never walk, talk or eat on her own. Kenzie’s insurance got dropped which was through my employer and caused my insurance to be dropped as well due to her maxing out the 2 million dollar lifetime benefit amount. This was in a 3 month period of ICU, Rehab, procedures and medicine that she had. She is now covered by Medicaid as that was our only option.

 

Once we had her stable and home I had the radiation performed to destroy my Thyroid issue in 2007 and it was said that with medicine replacement it would soon get better. Well, it never did to this day. Though this process (due to being a single income family and me not having insurance). I had to just deal with my health and become a stay at home mom to take care of Kenzie.  Even with lots of therapy and treatments, Kenzie’s seizures continued to become more frequent, she would have anywhere from 2 to 30 a day. With my Grave’s Disease and her being so sick, I was exhausted and the family was in so much stress. Finally in 2009, they found out where the seizure’s were coming from and they performed a Functional Hemispherectomy on Kenzie and took half of her brain out. With a long recovery she is doing better. She continues to have seizures, Cerebral Palsy, and other health problems, though the surgery did give improvement. I still have to stay home with her and can’t hold a job due to all her monthly appointments and her disabilities. I do now have a wonderful team of nurses and personal attendants that help with her care and take some of the stress off of the family.

 

 

My thyroid problems progressively got worse over all this time. I became so sick that we finally found a Endocrinologist that would take payments that did a Ultrasound and found a nodule on my thyroid. She sent me to a surgeon and in December of 2011, he took my thyroid out. None of the doctors thought it was cancerous, it turned out that the nodule and two of the six lymph nodes that they took out were stage 4 Papillary Thyroid Cancer.

 

The endocrinologist said I would need iodine radiation treatment so that the remaining Cancer would not spread, this costs around 8k which is yet to be done due to finances. All of this is to much to handle not having insurance. Knowing that Cancer is in my body has taken a toll on me and my entire family. They also diagnosed me with Hashimoto’s Disease since the removal making it virtually impossible to keep my thyroid hormone levels right with the use of thyroid replacements. The endocrinologist says that until I receive this iodine radiation treatment to remove all of the cancer cells, I will remain on this roller coaster.  I have applied for The Cancer Society’s program  and many other programs and can not seem to get any help. I also applied for the Pre-Existing Insurance plan with the government that has a high monthly premium, and also got denied for coverage, due to being on The Woman’s Health Care plan within the previous 6 months which ended in July of 2012, (this only covered my annual exam and birth control….not any health issues) this was my only hope. I have recently appealed their decision.

 

I am trying to get financial assistance so that I can get the care, and procedures I need done to raise my children and take care of the house front. In the process of all of this, I have also come upon a cluster of female problems and there are some treatments planned but with no insurance and no assistance I cant have these done. The Doctors want to try a shot to be sure of what is wrong before they do a full Hysterectomy.  I am not one for handout’s, and I hate to even be writing this letter, but due to spending over $10,000.00 over the last year on my surgery, doctor visits, x-rays, lab work etc. I have no other option.  My husband is becoming very depressed because we can’t afford it all with just his income, as I am unable to obtain employment due to caring for our handicapped daughter and my health.

 

The doctors have had me on bed rest and pain medicine for over 2 weeks. My whole family is falling apart and the children are confused. Until I can get some assistance, all I can do is take it one day at a time and pray for some miracle’s.  We are just a family trying to get by paycheck to paycheck, and it has been so hard on only Robert‘s income with all the medical bills. We appreciate any help that we can get due to these extremely hard times. Thank you so much for your time to listen my story. Our Family thanks each and everyone of you from the bottom of our heart.

 

Sincerely,

Tamra Barrow

I do now have a wonderful team of nurses and personal attendants that help with her care and take some of the stress off of the family.
 
 
My thyroid problems progressively got worse over all this time. I became so sick that we finally found a Endocrinologist that would take payments that did a Ultrasound and found a nodule on my thyroid. She sent me to a surgeon and in December of 2011, he took my thyroid out. None of the doctors thought it was cancerous, it turned out that the nodule and two of the six lymph nodes that they took out were stage 4 Papillary Thyroid Cancer.
 
The endocrinologist said I would need iodine radiation treatment so that the remaining Cancer would not spread, this costs around 8k which is yet to be done due to finances. All of this is to much to handle not having insurance. Knowing that Cancer is in my body has taken a toll on me and my entire family. They also diagnosed me with Hashimoto’s Disease since the removal making it virtually impossible to keep my thyroid hormone levels right with the use of thyroid replacements. The endocrinologist says that until I receive this iodine radiation treatment to remove all of the cancer cells, I will remain on this roller coaster.  I have applied for The Cancer Society’s program  and many other programs and can not seem to get any help. I also applied for the Pre-Existing Insurance plan with the government that has a high monthly premium, and also got denied for coverage, due to being on The Woman’s Health Care plan within the previous 6 months which ended in July of 2012, (this only covered my annual exam and birth control….not any health issues) this was my only hope. I have recently appealed their decision.
 
I am trying to get financial assistance so that I can get the care, and procedures I need done to raise my children and take care of the house front. In the process of all of this, I have also come upon a cluster of female problems and there are some treatments planned but with no insurance and no assistance I cant have these done. The Doctors want to try a shot to be sure of what is wrong before they do a full Hysterectomy.  I am not one for handout’s, and I hate to even be writing this letter, but due to spending over $10,000.00 over the last year on my surgery, doctor visits, x-rays, lab work etc. I have no other option.  My husband is becoming very depressed because we can’t afford it all with just his income, as I am unable to obtain employment due to caring for our handicapped daughter and my health.
 
The doctors have had me on bed rest and pain medicine for over 2 weeks. My whole family is falling apart and the children are confused. Until I can get some assistance, all I can do is take it one day at a time and pray for some miracle’s.  We are just a family trying to get by paycheck to paycheck, and it has been so hard on only Robert‘s income with all the medical bills. We appreciate any help that we can get due to these extremely hard times. Thank you so much for your time to listen my story. Our Family thanks each and everyone of you from the bottom of our heart.
 
Sincerely,
Tamra Barrow

story:
SUPPORTING WOUNDED U.S. MILITARY MEMBERS THROUGH CYCLING REHABILITATION

Team 4Mil has been supporting wounded veterans for the past 4 years. We find, coach and mentor those able and interested in training and competing in the annual Race Across America bicycle race. This ultimate challenge of endurance gives them something to work for and provides them with the confidence to achieve anything in life despite the injury they have.

Team 4Mil was formed in 2009 by a group of former and active military members. We were approved as a 501 (c) (3) charitable organization October 8th, 2010. EIN: 27-3156634

Our mission from the start has been to use cycling as a means to help fellow wounded veterans rehabilitate from their injuries and return to a new normal in their lives. This way we do all we can to "Keep The Warrior Spirit Alive"

Your contributions will allow us to work with wounded veterans using cycling, nutrition and mentoring to assist them with their recovery. We culminate our efforts each year by entering and supporting an 8 man team of wounded veterans in the annual Race Across America. The 2013 race travels over 3000 miles from Oceanside California to Annapolis Maryland. The team race starts June 15th, 2013. We already have the 8 man team selected for the 2013 race. The only missing element now is the funding needed to equip, rehabilitate, train and support the team leading up to the race finish.

How We Use The Charitable Donations We Receive

We need a minimum of $150,000 to train and prepare an 8 man wounded team for the 2013 Race Across America. It takes $80,000 to pay the entry fee, transport crew, race team, and equipment to the start, feed the crew and racers for approximately 12 days, rent support vehicles to include fuel, and to transport equipment, racers, and crew back home after the finish. The remaining $70,000 is used for transporting and training crew and racers during 2 separate training camps prior to the race. This assumes racers have their own cycling equipment which isn't always the case. Should we get contributions that exceed the $150,000 dollar goal, we will work with cycling equipment companies and shops to provide as much gear for the racers as possible at discounted rates. Anything over and above what is needed for 2013 will be used for subsequent team efforts.

We want to reward those who contribute by offering what we can so you have memorabilia that shows you were an integral part of Team 4Mil succeeding in our mission.

Team 4Mil actively seeks donations all year on our website. Should we only meet a portion of our goal here, it's hoped we can garner enough donations directly from our website. If you aren't able to contribute much or anything at all, we appreciate you spreading the word about our mission and driving traffic to our website. Thank you in advance for that!

Inspiring Others

Team 4Mil is made up entirely of volunteer current, former, and retired military members. 100% of the charitable donations we receive go toward funding our programs for supporting wounded veterans and their families. Some of the other ways your generous contribution can help includes :

  • We continually strive to be a valuable resource for both the wounded veteran AND their families. Our feeling is the family members need and deserve our support as well. They sacrificed a lot and were at least fortunate enough to have their loved ones return home to them alive. As we garner more funding and recognition for all we do, supporting the families with other activities, nutritional counseling, mentoring and friendship will continue to grow and be something they can rely on their entire lives.
  • Team 4Mil has developed a very successful program of rehabilative support utilizing cycling and the Race Across America. As our support network grows, we expect to be involved in other positive activities and programs. Our goal is to hold several events during the year where other American citizens can join the veterans and their families to enrich each other’s lives through competition, fun group activities, friendship and patriotism.

Every dollar we receive is greatly appreciated and used in the most positive manner. We are one of the only veteran support organizations that can say 100% of your dollar goes toward funding programs that directly benefit wounded veterans and their families.

 

Volunteers Needed

We completely understand and respect that not everyone is in a position to contribute monetarily. During the Race Across America especially, we need a team of volunteers to be crew members that help get our racers safely across the country. To give you an idea of the types of jobs our volunteers do here are some examples

  • Crew Chief - Runs the entire operation
  • Mechanic - Maintains equipment
  • Navigation
  • Communications
  • Food Prep

Our most immediate need is for a treasurer who has financial training. We accept applications from non-military members as well. If you are interested in volunteering you can E-Mail Us Here

Thank you for considering any type of support you are able to give to wounded military members and their families through Team 4Mil!

story:
Our Story

One Doctor. Twenty nurses. A population of twenty four thousand. One Village.

It only takes nine to make a difference. Nine nurses working together to bring change to Worawora, Ghana and their health care. We are asking for your help to make our vision attainable. 

Our mission began with PACE Ghana, one man's dream to empower his home country, by bringing awareness, recources, and opportunities. As undergraduate and graduate Registered Nurses, we feel the importance of globally practicing our skills for those in need. This January we are going to travel to Ghana, donating equipment, education, and nursing care.

We are going for two and a half weeks, not only to volunteer in the hospital, but also by making house calls, re-building a collapsed kindergarden school, working in the library, and encouraging health prevention. By this inital journey, we hope to create connections to facilitate Worawora in building their own nursing school.

 

Every Penny Counts!

The cost to each student is approximately $3,000. Not only do we want to decrease the cost of the trip, but also be able to raise enough to donate money and supplies to the community. Worawora is in serious need of medical instruments and funds, and every US dollars converts to two Ghanian dollars, known as cedi. 

The hospital in Worawora, use to be one of the upmost respected hospitals in the country. Unfortunately after the nursing school closed, the hospital crumbled with it. By donating to us, we will begin to rebuild the foundation of the community, with a focus on health care, but we need your help to make it possible!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word and help us reach our goal! Every penny counts! 

Check out : http://www.paceghana.org/ for other ways you can help!

story: Welcome to Love for Mama Maria!! Our dearest friend, Maria Rushing-Tomlin, a mother of four beautiful children, has been diagnosed with basal cell carcinoma (skin cancer) and is in need of immediate surgery, which will cost anywhere from $2,000 to $5,000 (or more), depending upon how deep the cancer runs. Sadly, like so many, Maria does not have health insurance, and any assistance she might receive from the government's new health plan will not be available until January at the earliest, which is far too long for her, AND US, to wait. SO, we are banding together to help her and her family raise funds. Three of Maria's children (the far left and middle two in the above picture) are under the age of ten and desperately need their mother happy and healthy. Her own mother is at this very moment battling stage IV pancreatic and liver cancer, is unable to work, and needs the comfort of knowing her daughter is safe. All funds raised through this site will go directly towards Maria's surgery. For more information, please email us at 4MamaMaria@gmail.com.

story:
In a tiny village in rural West Africa, 700 children rush to school between mud huts, grazing goats and women balancing basins of well water on their heads, in order to make it to school in time. From 8 a.m. onward, they’ll spend eight hours of their day learning, playing, eating and pooping before rushing home again to eat mother’s campfire-cooked dinner, and study by candle light.

Not once in the day will these students wash their hands or have access to safe, clean water.

I've lived in this village since September 2012 as a Peace Corps Volunteer, and have grown to understand the needs, lifestyle and development process of the community. I've worked to promote better health and education for the 3,500 residents—almost half of which are children.

After teaching safe hygiene practices to elementary school students, the students have asked for financial help to build water stations that will allow them to wash their hands and practice the techniques we've trained.

Building 12 hand washing stations at $40 a station will prevent basic diseases such as colds, common viruses and diarrhea that kill countless students in the region each year.

Each hand washing station requires a plastic tub for water storage ($10), a faucet to attach to the base and other general nuts and bolts ($15), an iron stand ($7), manual labor ($5), and soap and water throughout the school year ($3)—a cost the school will budget for the following year. A four per cent fee for indiegogo has also been factored into the budget.

If our goal of $500 isn't met to build 12 washing stations by May 27, we’ll take as much money as we can and build as many stations as possible.

Please follow my Facebook or twitter for updates on the project post May---www.facebook.com/MissToriRose or @VictoriaVoyager

Even one water station at $40 can spare 50 students from disease just because they’ll have an opportunity to wash their hands.

Don’t forget share this project with your friends and family! If each one of your Facebook friends gave $.50, we’ll reach our goal by Friday!

story:
About Us

Our names are Rob Assibey and Fred Afari and we have been living in the Los Angeles area for most of our lives. We have seen first hand the poverty that exists and the lack of healthcare available to the communities of Los Angeles County. We currently work at a charter school in Los Angeles and teach students, who themselves lack health care. Something as simple as getting a physical is a task for them, and it would be fulfilling if we could help change that.

We are both very interested in the medical field and have a passion to make a difference in our community. Being former EMTs and serving in Los Angeles County we witnessed first hand how those without health insurance have suffered. We have estabilshed a non-profit organization with the goal of opening a free community medical clinic in order to service those that are without affordable health care. We have already started teaching discounted CPR classes in the community. We also plan to continue teaching the classes after the clinic is opened. Not only do we want to help our community with affordable health care we also want to increase health awareness as much as possible.

Those of you who contribute will not only help us achieve our goals but will also be chief contributors in the lives of all of the patients our clinic will see. Every single one of you will play an important role in the health of the less fortunate.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have found a location for our clinic to be operated in, unfortunately it is just an open box that needs to be converted into a medical clinc. The money that we receive will go towards the following:

Dry wall for our examination rooms

Plumbing for the sinks that need to be placed in the examination rooms

Electrical wiring

Initial staffing of employees

Rent 

This is a flexible funding campaign (meaning, we get funded regardless of whether we hit our goal or not). Helping us to open up this community clinic is no small feat. We would appreciate every bit of your help. Your contributions also come with some cool perks, if you glance over to the side bar at the right! The donations are not limited to those on the side, you may enter any amount you prefer in the contribute now link.Thanks for your support, it is humbly appreciated. 

 

The Impact

Helping us open this community clinic means a lot - to the neighborhood, to us, and to everyone in the community. It is not just a one time deal, it is a lifetime donation that will never be forgotten. Your help creates opportunities for those that are less fortunate and may be a life changing experience for someone. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are here because of our community. We are very happy with your support and appreciate any way that you choose to give, whether it is through Indiegogo, in person or by simply spreading the word. 

Team up on a donation (and share the rewards) or help us by spreading the word throughout your community. Indiegogo makes it easy to share campaigns through Facebook, email, etc. Every little bit counts! Thanks again for all of your support.

story:
Learn 2 Play Summary

 

Learn to Play  http://learn2playsports.com/  is an Animated Sports Instructional Series for children that have yet to play their first organized sport. L2P teaches basic concepts, lingo and skill set for that particular sport. The ball is the main instructional character, pertaining to the sport. Billy the Baseball, Freddy the Football, Buddy the Basketball, Sammy the Soccer Ball, etc....Other L2P characters, include coaches, officials, talking equipment and shoes, a talking scoreboard and a group of L2P kids or Pre-gamers. A Pre-gamer is a child that has yet to play their first organized sport. Below are a couple of links for short demo examples.

http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=9lxjK1GuOYc&hd=1

http://m.youtube.com/watch?hd=1&v=9idEdkMPCZM            

In addition, I have composed 60 very kid friendly instructional jingles that we call "Field House or Club House Rock". Kids can sing along with the characters while learning to play their favorite sports. "Bat a tat tat, Baseball Bat", "We are the Bases", "Everyone loves a Touchdown", "Head Up is Very Sound", "We Love Basketball", "Elbow in, See the Rim", "Put on your Soccer Shirt", "Use your Head", "Whats the Wordy, We want a Birdie", "Who's your Friend, Your Golf Bag" etc..  Jingle examples below

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wFj7jtzut_g   

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0KKC9IWgn20

In 2013, 50 million kids participated in youth organized sports, 10 million first timers. Learn 2 Play is the perfect tool to start children off in the right healthy direction. Our plan is to produce a sports instructional/gaming mobile app, an illustrated book and an interactive website. In addition, we hope to implement our series into youth associations such as the YMCA, Upward Sports, Boy/Girl Scouts of America, Cal Ripken Little League, USA Football, etc...          

The Advertising and Merchandising possibilities are endless throughout the series. Sports Equipment, Major Sport brands, along with Hasbro, Nerf, Little Tikes, etc....The big picture is a television series on Nickelodeon, Disney or ESPN for kids.

What We Need & What You Get

    We need 175k in order to produce an Animated Instuctional App with Gaming(bulk of funding), an Illustrated L2P, Learn 2 Read Book and an Interactve Learn 2 Play Website. If we do not reach our goal, the funding we do receive will go to publishing Learn 2 Play, Learn 2 Read Books and L2P Sizzle reels.

    The Impact

     

    Youth Sports are popular all around the world, Soccer in Europe and South America, Baseball in Japan /Far East, Golf World Wide, Basketball in Europe, etc. China is now promoting university and youth sports. Every L2P Sport will be instructed in multiple languages.

    *50 million kids participate in youth sports in the USA,

    *250 million kids play Soccer, *10 million kids play Baseball, *5 milliion kids play Basketball and  *60 million people play Golf around the world. 

    Approximately *370,00 babies are being born everyday worldwide. The 3-7 age demographic has never been targeted for sports instruction, Parents love to watch their kids compete and are always looking for an edge, This is a Global Produt that can put private coaching within everyones reach.         
                                                                                                                                                           

     

    Risks & Challenges 

     

    We believe a major challenge after production will be marketing our product. The company that we have teamed up with to produce our App is Phunware out of Austin Texas. In addition to production, they will be marketing the L2P Sports App as well,  Phunware has created Apps for ESPN, NFL, and the PGA. These are companies that we will be targeting for marketing and partnerships. Phunware has agreed to help us form relationships with these companies and many more. Along with Phunware, Learn 2 Play has put an in house marketing team together to contact Youth Sports Organizations, Toy Companies, Educational Programs and the Heath/Fitness Industry.

    Bio

     

    I grew up with some type of a ball in my hands. If you could pass it, catch it, kick it, hit it, field it, dribble it or shoot it, I wanted to be a part of it. I started playing organized sports at a very early age and continued to play team sports all the way to college. In college,  I parlayed my love of sports into a physical education degree and eventually a full time coaching/teaching position.

    Today I hold multiple coaching positions, which include high school football and golf, private instructional coaching (all ages and all sports) and volunteer youth coaching at the YMCA. I am a huge advocate of Physical Education, Organized Sports and Teamwork. What a child learns from being a part of a team can give them a solid foundation for life; which leads to a healthy life style and enhances their chance to succeed. This series can educate parents as well and they  can Learn 2 Play a sport along with their child.

     

    Everyone Wants to Learn 2 Play!

Billy the Baseball, Freddy the Football, Buddy the Basketball, Sammy the Soccer Ball, etc....Other L2P characters, include coaches, officials, talking equipment and shoes, a talking scoreboard and a group of L2P kids or Pre-gamers. A Pre-gamer is a child that has yet to play their first organized sport. Below are a couple of links for short demo examples. http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=9lxjK1GuOYc&hd=1 http://m.youtube.com/watch?hd=1&v=9idEdkMPCZM             In addition, I have composed 60 very kid friendly instructional jingles that we call "Field House or Club House Rock". Kids can sing along with the characters while learning to play their favorite sports. "Bat a tat tat, Baseball Bat", "We are the Bases", "Everyone loves a Touchdown", "Head Up is Very Sound", "We Love Basketball", "Elbow in, See the Rim", "Put on your Soccer Shirt", "Use your Head", "Whats the Wordy, We want a Birdie", "Who's your Friend, Your Golf Bag" etc..  Jingle examples below  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wFj7jtzut_g     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0KKC9IWgn20 In 2013, 50 million kids participated in youth organized sports, 10 million first timers. Learn 2 Play is the perfect tool to start children off in the right healthy direction. Our plan is to produce a sports instructional/gaming mobile app, an illustrated book and an interactive website. In addition, we hope to implement our series into youth associations such as the YMCA, Upward Sports, Boy/Girl Scouts of America, Cal Ripken Little League, USA Football, etc...           The Advertising and Merchandising possibilities are endless throughout the series. Sports Equipment, Major Sport brands, along with Hasbro, Nerf, Little Tikes, etc....The big picture is a television series on Nickelodeon, Disney or ESPN for kids.   What We Need & What You Get We need 175k in order to produce an Animated Instuctional App with Gaming(bulk of funding), an Illustrated L2P, Learn 2 Read Book and an Interactve Learn 2 Play Website. If we do not reach our goal, the funding we do receive will go to publishing Learn 2 Play, Learn 2 Read Books and L2P Sizzle reels.  The Impact  Youth Sports are popular all around the world, Soccer in Europe and South America, Baseball in Japan /Far East, Golf World Wide, Basketball in Europe, etc. China is now promoting university and youth sports. Every L2P Sport will be instructed in multiple languages. *50 million kids participate in youth sports in the USA, *250 million kids play Soccer, *10 million kids play Baseball, *5 milliion kids play Basketball and  *60 million people play Golf around the world. Approximately *370,00 babies are being born everyday worldwide. The 3-7 age demographic has never been targeted for sports instruction, Parents love to watch their kids compete and are always looking for an edge, This is a Global Produt that can put private coaching within everyones reach.                                                                                                                                                                   Risks & Challenges   We believe a major challenge after production will be marketing our product. The company that we have teamed up with to produce our App is Phunware out of Austin Texas. In addition to production, they will be marketing the L2P Sports App as well,  Phunware has created Apps for ESPN, NFL, and the PGA. These are companies that we will be targeting for marketing and partnerships. Phunware has agreed to help us form relationships with these companies and many more. Along with Phunware, Learn 2 Play has put an in house marketing team together to contact Youth Sports Organizations, Toy Companies, Educational Programs and the Heath/Fitness Industry.  Bio  I grew up with some type of a ball in my hands. If you could pass it, catch it, kick it, hit it, field it, dribble it or shoot it, I wanted to be a part of it. I started playing organized sports at a very early age and continued to play team sports all the way to college. In college,  I parlayed my love of sports into a physical education degree and eventually a full time coaching/teaching position. Today I hold multiple coaching positions, which include high school football and golf, private instructional coaching (all ages and all sports) and volunteer youth coaching at the YMCA. I am a huge advocate of Physical Education, Organized Sports and Teamwork. What a child learns from being a part of a team can give them a solid foundation for life; which leads to a healthy life style and enhances their chance to succeed. This series can educate parents as well and they  can Learn 2 Play a sport along with their child. Everyone Wants to Learn 2 Play!

story:
What is COHA?

Based in Washington, D.C., COHA is a non-profit, tax-exempt organization with the mission to educate the global public, policymakers, and academia about the affairs of North, Central, and South America. Through our biweekly Washington Report on the Hemisphere (WRH), our website publications, interviews on television and radio (including BBC, Al-Jazeera, The NY Times, and the Washington Post), and interactions in the field and behind the scenes with policymakers, we seek to shape continental policy toward the promotion of justice and democracy. COHA prides itself in standing up for the voice, rights, and interests of marginalized groups.

In 1975, the Council on Hemispheric Affairs was born from the love and passion that founder and longtime director Larry Birns holds for the affairs and people of the Americas. Along with our fearless leader, COHA is run by a passionate and motivated family of researchers. Our intern program forms the backbone of COHA. Each year we host around 60 undergraduate and graduate students who volunteer their time for a 14-week period. All interns fill the position of Research Associate, and are tasked with researching and writing articles for our publications. In addition to their productive responsibilities as Research Associates, interns also take on various administrative roles within the organization. Supporting our team of Research Associates is a group of Senior Research Fellows: successful academics with many years of experience in the field of inter-American affairs. Our Research Fellows write for COHA, fill an advisory role, and supervise COHA’s publications in order to ensure that we produce the highest quality academic and policy work.

What We Need & How We Show Our Thanks

As a nonprofit organization, COHA receives funding from subscriptions to its biweekly publication (WRH), grants, and personal donations. In other words, we rely on the generosity and conviction of those who believe in our mission of contributing to informed public opinion about American issues. We use the money we get from donations to help pay for operating costs: printing and mailing fees for the WRH, rent, utilities, and office supplies. Our donors hold a special place in our hearts, and we express our gratitude by offering free subscriptions to the WRH, publishing the names of contributors on our website and social media, and inviting contributors for a tour of the office, along with other special rewards and recognitions.
That said, we will use all of the money that is donated to us to further our cause. Our campaign is a Flexible Funding campaign with Indiegogo so all of your donations will go towards our cause regardless of whether we reach our goal or not.

 The Impact : Your Donation Makes the Difference

COHA’s voice illuminates inter-American policy by praising just and democratic actions and denouncing the actions of dictators and imperialists. This role is doubly vital, since mainstream U.S. media and society ignores many of these social and political issues, especially pertaining to Latin America. COHA’s work brings these issues much-needed attention. Any contribution on COHA’s behalf adds volume to a voice that cries out against violations of fundamental human rights. Whether a contribution balances our budget or simply raises awareness of COHA’s mission, it plays an important role in giving the people of the Americas a better understanding of our continent and promoting a sustainable and equitable future. 

Other Ways you Can Help

  • Go to coha.org to learn more about what we do. Sign up for our mailing list, or subscribe to our scholarly publication, The Washington Report on the Hemisphere.
  • Share our site  or  Indiegogo page on the web. Every bit counts.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread our message!

If you cannot donate today but care about our cause, there are other ways you can help COHA:

story:
Who We Are

El Centro Integral Warmi is a non-profit organization that provides social services to the children and families of Cochabamba, Bolivia, with the aim of helping them grow as students, community members, and people.

From our founding in 1982, we have supported over 2000 children, taking them off the streets and into our center, giving them the opportunity to receive a healthy meal, education, and protection. Because of our center, the children's parents can go to work (often at low-paying domestic service or physical labor jobs) without worrying about their children, thus promoting a stronger and more nurturing home environment. Our work helps ease domestic violence, empowers local mothers, and promotes the eradication of poverty.

Why We Need Your Help

Last fall, when Máxima, a 10-year-old beneficiary of Warmi, suffered third-degree burns due to a kitchen fire, her parents were unable to pay her medical bills and had to turn to outside help. We at Warmi held a fundraiser for Máxima, and are happy to announce that she is on the road to recovery.
However, it is our hope that in these situations of need, rather than desperately looking for outside funding at the last minute, parents will be able to rest easy knowing that they can provide basic medical care for their children. Up until last year, Warmi provided medical insurance for its beneficiaries, to cover everything from emergencies such as that of Máxima to routine dental and doctor visits. Due to funding shortages, however, we have been unable to continue this service.
For just 15 bolivianos per child per month -- that's about $2 -- you can help us make sure that the children of Warmi are insured and that no medical hardship is too heavy to bear. From all the children and families at Warmi, thank you.

Quienes Somos

El Centro Integral Warmi es una institución sin fines de lucro que provee servicios sociales en vista de ofrecer un desarrollo integral a los niños, niñas, y adolescentes con necesidades en la ciudad de Cochabamba.

Desde nuestro incipio en 1982, hemos soportado a dos mil niños, rescatándolos de la calle y dándolos una oportunidad para recibir comida, educación, y protección. Por nuestro trabajo, los padres y madres pueden ir a trabajar sin preocuparse sobre sus hijos, promoviendo un ambiente en el hogar más seguro y fortalecido. Nuestro trabajo ayuda a evitar la violencia doméstica, empoderar a las mujeres, y promover la erradicación de la pobreza.

Por Qué Necesitamos Su Ayuda

El otoño pasado, cuando Máxima, una beneficiaria de Warmi, sufrió quemaduras de tercer grado por un fuego en la cocina, sus padres no podrían pagar sus cuentas médicas y tenían que pedir ayuda de la comunidad. Felizmente, tenían éxito, y ahora Máxima se está recuperando.
Sin embargo, aquí en Warmi esperamos que en situaciones de emergencia, en vez de desesperadamente buscando ayuda, los padres puedan tener confianza que pueden proveer seguro médico básico para sus hijos. Hasta el año pasado, Warmi proveyó seguro médico para sus beneficiarios, para cobrar todo, desde cirugía a visitas al dentista. Debido a una falta de dinero, desafortunadamente, ya no podemos ofrecer este servicio.
Para sólo 15 bolivianos cada mes por niño, usted puede ayudarnos a asegurar que cada niño en Warmi tiene recursos en caso de que haya emergencia. Desde todos a Warmi, mil gracias.

story:
Get an intimate massage lesson tutorial by celebrity massage therapist, Clinton Marbury.

Working as a professional celebrity massage therapist over the years has given me a unique perspective in what people actually want for a massage. 

Massage at your home with the people you love should feel like if you where in an actual spa! 

What if laying (face down) on the bed or floor could be just as comfortable as on a massage table? Or if your touch felt just like a professional massage therapist? What if you had everything you needed to receive Spa Quality massage at home!

Now with The Massage 365 home massage set you can!

I came up with the massage 365 program because I thought about how, everybody loves a great massage, but not everybody had the extra time or money to go to the spa or chiropractor every time they are in pain or need to relax.

When people do massage at home its never the same, its hard to get comfortable and nearly impossible to lay with correct spine alignment on the bed or the floor. Most people twist their neck from side to side which actually puts more pressure on the nerves in your neck causing muscles spasms. Even if you can manage to get comfortable temporarily, your partner might be a little less than ideal massage therapist, poking and jabbing in all the wrong places, until you decide maybe you will just try more pain relievers instead.

DVD Series 

We created the DVD series with 20 min massage routines so anyone can follow along and massage you like a pro and massage cushion, that is portable and can be placed on any flat surface and can be just like laying on a professional massage table. 

You will have everything you need to get the relaxation experience of a spa at home: 

  • a scented massage candle that melts into a hot massage lotion, 
  • aromatherapy body oil 
  • a massage cream

Sneak Peek of our DVD series

Pillow: 


We spent two years working on what will be the best portable massage pillow you will ever need. The pillow is light-weight, easily portable and compact so you can store it easily. 

  • The pillow angles your chest and neck just enough to lift your body so you can breathe easily while still laying in a comfortable position 
  • Allows for correct alignment of your spine , and cervical vertebrae in your neck
  • made from durable polyethylene foam to be extremely lightweight with - layers of memory foam on top for ultimate comfort 
  • Easily portable and storable when not in use 
  • The head rest maintains perfect alignment of your neck with the side panels allow for easy breathing 
  • The ankle pillow lifts your ankles when your face down so your feet can be more elevated and comfortable and lifts your knees when face up so reduce pressure on your lower back while resting. 
  • Carrying case is easy to use and carry anywhere.

The Massage 365 system is not just a product, but a movement, to change the way quality massage can be accessed by everyone at home or anywhere you need to get massage.

Use Massage 365 as a great way to show appreciation to someone special in your life, like a husband or wife that has been working hard all day. 

Maybe you want to have a romantic date night to spice things up with a new boyfriend or girlfriend its also a fun and easy way to give and receive massage with friends or to help out a family member that might be in pain and could use a really great massage.

I am on Indiegogo to raise the funding to mass produce the massage cushions and finish the productions on the videos.  So if you want to take massage into your own hands and want to be apart of my project please pick on of the rewards below and of course share this video with all of your friends online to spread the word.

We have finished the entire DVD series and have the initial prototype of the cushion.

We have met with the different manufacturers involved in the process and have done everything possible to reduce any delays once we reach our funding. However we are a small company and can't guarantee any delays made by the post Indiegogo process but we will do everything in order to establish we deliver the rewards on time.

story:
What is Cliri ?

Cliri, is a craft (handicrafts) Indonesian traditional. Which are producing or selling products that are etnic or traditional. Cliri stringing has meaning or form and has a strong but flexible nature.

Cliri present to assemble or form a positive synergy in a flexible but robust way in goal.

A wide variety of unique products made ​​by handmade, craft a woven bag, fedora hats, and other accessories. All products are made by skilled hands using the materials - environmentally friendly natural materials such as pandanus weaving, rushes, water hyacinth, palm leaf rib, coconut shells, coconut twigs, etc. 


The Cliri Handycraft

Our debut handmade style ‘Handycraft’ is available at a special Indiegogo launch with free worldwide postage. Select a perk on the right hand side to pre-order your Traditional Handycraf. 

1. Diamond Ring

Have 2 ring : Silver plated and Gold plated, choose your size ring.


2. Emerald Ring

Ring with gold plated, have 3 color of emerald : Blue, Green, Red. Choose your size ring.

3. Fedora

Have design for new young man or anyone still have the passion  on fashion from pandanus woven materials.

3.Beursie

4.Zorroa

5.Pine

6.Ouiya

7.Fettucia

8.Zlato

9.Wibi

10.Nauha

11.Trenza

12.Webin

13.Geweef


Pre-Order Today!!

Due to the initial costs and high minimum order quantities in production  our handycrafted, we need your support to allow us to begin our first production run. Here’s how you can support our campaign :

1) Select a perk on the right hand side to start your pre-order. That all with Free shipping to worldwide.

2) Continue onto the next page to enter shipping information followed by payment details. Note; if you would like to contribute extra over and above the cost of the perk you have selected, you can change the figure above.

3) Complete payment via Paypal or using your credit/debit card. Cliri will use these funds to process the first production run, bringing the project to life.

4) We aim to deliver your first products of handycraft before the end of September, 2014.

Get in Touch

Enquiries: clirilife@gmail.com

Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign! We'd hugely appreciate you sharing it with your friends.

Lurie.

story:
Our Story

Hello, My name is Dr. Jean Charles. I practice emergency medicine in Long Island, NY. I am teaming up with my wife Dr. Karen Isaacs-Charles and colleagues to conduct a medical mission to Guyana. The theme of the mission is to "Give Back". My wife was born in Guyana  and immigrated to the U.S. with her parents when she was very young. This project is her brainchild. This will be her first return trip to Guyana in 21 years and we would want it be a home coming of thanksgiving and celebration. Thus, we formed our Health and Wellness Medical Team which consists of health care proffesionals. We are planning a two day health clinic on April 3rd and 4th for the Seafield Village West Coast Berbice residents. All neighborhing towns are also invited.  Part of the mission will be to screen for diabetes, hypertension, and skin diseases. We will also perform medical physicals and initiate treatment. Our nutrionist/health coach will provide a holostic approach to patient care. We also plan to donate medical supplies to the Davis Memorial Hospital for their hospitalized patients.

The Impact

 The theme of our organization is "Health and Wellness".  We believe that your health is your most cherished asset. This trip is more than providing medical service to people that probably have not or lack the ability to see a physician regulargy. This trip is more than us using our God given talents to help those in need. This trip is more than us taking our three children and exposing them to what it means to give back. This Campaign is about doing the good work of the Lord. We can each do our small part. Community service can start in your home/neighborhood, and in this case in another continent.  What path will you choose. We also hope that this can inspire you to start your own campaign for helping others.  


What can You do to help?

This project has grown from our original plan of going to Guyana to provide basic health screening. The mission trip has actually blossomed to providing complete screening/physicals and medical treatment initiation for  residents. We have already purchased the medicines and  supplies with no help from any organizations. However it is costly to completely finance such an endeaver on our own. We need the necessary funds to ship 29 boxes with a combined weight 435lbs to Guyana via air. Our Goal is to raise $2,500.  This will help us with the cost of sending the medical supplies. It will also go along way in securing transportation for our team once we arrive in Guyana. The Village is about a 2 hour drive from the capital. We will need to retain the service of a personal driver/guide during our stay.  A personal guide is key since we will be going back and forth between the capital and the villages providing our services. You can be confident that 100% of your donations will go towards helping the Guyanese people.  We are doing this because we care and want to give back. All donations are appreciated.
story_txt:
Our Story
Hello, My name is Dr. Jean Charles. I practice emergency medicine in Long Island, NY. I am teaming up with my wife Dr. Karen Isaacs-Charles and colleagues to conduct a medical mission to Guyana. The theme of the mission is to "Give Back". My wife was born in Guyana  and immigrated to the U.S. with her parents when she was very young. This project is her brainchild. This will be her first return trip to Guyana in 21 years and we would want it be a home coming of thanksgiving and celebration. Thus, we formed our Health and Wellness Medical Team which consists of health care proffesionals. We are planning a two day health clinic on April 3rd and 4th for the Seafield Village West Coast Berbice residents. All neighborhing towns are also invited.  Part of the mission will be to screen for diabetes, hypertension, and skin diseases. We will also perform medical physicals and initiate treatment. Our nutrionist/health coach will provide a holostic approach to patient care. We also plan to donate medical supplies to the Davis Memorial Hospital for their hospitalized patients. 

The Impact
 The theme of our organization is "Health and Wellness".  We believe that your health is your most cherished asset. This trip is more than providing medical service to people that probably have not or lack the ability to see a physician regulargy. This trip is more than us using our God given talents to help those in need. This trip is more than us taking our three children and exposing them to what it means to give back. This Campaign is about doing the good work of the Lord. We can each do our small part. Community service can start in your home/neighborhood, and in this case in another continent.  What path will you choose. We also hope that this can inspire you to start your own campaign for helping others.  


What can You do to help?
This project has grown from our original plan of going to Guyana to provide basic health screening. The mission trip has actually blossomed to providing complete screening/physicals and medical treatment initiation for  residents. We have already purchased the medicines and  supplies with no help from any organizations. However it is costly to completely finance such an endeaver on our own. We need the necessary funds to ship 29 boxes with a combined weight 435lbs to Guyana via air. Our Goal is to raise $2,500.  This will help us with the cost of sending the medical supplies. It will also go along way in securing transportation for our team once we arrive in Guyana. The Village is about a 2 hour drive from the capital. We will need to retain the service of a personal driver/guide during our stay.  A personal guide is key since we will be going back and forth between the capital and the villages providing our services. You can be confident that 100% of your donations will go towards helping the Guyanese people.  We are doing this because we care and want to give back. All donations are appreciated.

story:
My beloved cousin Brenda Akers has always been the most incredibly caring, loving person with lots of giggles.  Throughout her life she has created fundraisers for others' needs and now she needs help.  The local Moose Lodge is attempting to raise $5000 in a proving account for the anit-rejection drugs.  They must prove to the Transplant Organization that there is a beginning balance of $5,000 to cover the beginning rejection drugs.  She has been on disability for some time now but the new medicare rules will not pay for these drugs.  In addition, the new medicare rules no longer pays the total cost of dialysis to keep her alive until the transplant.  Her bill for these treatments now exceeds $1000.  She has medical bills mounding into the thousands.  We are setting a goal of $30,000 to be placed in an account that can only be paid to medical expenses.  I can't say how much longer her body will hold out but I was devastated when I saw her condition.  Please help me help her, so that the medical field will proceed in saving her..... and if you know anyone with A- blood ... she needs a kidney - a direct donor could save her.

Those donating will be saving several lives, Brenda's and her children.  They have experienced losses this year and I am not sure they will endure the loss of their mother.  Her children are adults with children but they rely on her for moral support and have remained a very close family.  I will make sure that these funds are cared for and protected to be used for the intended purpose.  If you cannot contribute even a few dollars then please spread the word that we are looking for an A- donor and send the link to this site to as many people as possible.

Recent Facebook Post: 

Keenan Odom I love my momma. She the bestest mommy I have ever had. And with her having her last grandbaby due in Nov, I pray everyday for God to place his healing hand upon her so she can see him and hold him.
 
Shelley:  Just take one minute to think... we have see collections taken up at church, at bars, at gatherings, amongst friends.... if this were your friend, your fellow rider, your sister, your cousin, your friend.... what would you do? WWYD?  Pass this by or do what you can to help... letting people know, donating one dollar, donating more... doing nothing cannot be acceptable in your heart.... doing something is paying it forward, it is a rippling effect action... that will come back to you....

story:
My Story

Hi! My name is Kat and sometime during my life I was bitten by a tick. I would soon find that ticks are very powerful insects: They have the ability to make you forget your name or phone number, say "lettuce" instead of "gasoline", create debilitating pain and fatigue, make your muscles twitch uncontrollably, including causing up to 15 seizures a day, isolate you from your friends and family and leave you depressed, alone and broke. The cost of treatment for this highly controversial disease is in the tens of thousands...if you're lucky enough to be insured. 


The Impact

By helping raise the money I need to pay for the treatments for Late Stage Chronic/Neurological Lyme Disease and co infections, you're helping a 28 year old girl have a shot at a normal life again. You're helping a girl go back to her life of adventure and activism. I want to inspire the world to be active in their life and the world around them whether it be philanthropic, social activism, socially responsible media or creative business ventures like TOM's Shoes. Since I've gotten sick, I haven't been able to volunteer, fund-raise or pursue any other avenue of social responsibility. My wish is that I will soon be able to return to this. 


What You Can Do

The funds raised will go towards the cost of medical treatment for Late Stage Chronic Lyme Disease and co infections. Current treatments cost upwards of $700 per month but could increase in January as I will have to meet my insurance deductible all over again. This summer I had minor surgery to insert a port-a-cath in my chest and now give myself twice daily IV infusions. The money I raise through this will go to medical expenses ONLY, NOT personal living expenses. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your social network. No contribution is too small! Sharing my page on Facebook, Twitter or even email is simple, thanks to the share tools IndieGoGo has implemented!


About Lyme

For more information on Lyme Disease, please visit:

www.lymenet.org

www.lymedisease.org

story:
Our Story

        The mission of Positive Sport Coaching is to educate and encourage positive attitudes and behaviors in all athletic events by coaches, parents, administrators, media, fans and players.

        Positive Sport Coaching is a non-profit (501 (c) 3) founded in 1993.  At present, over 8,609  coaches and 1,343 parents have received training and certification from Positive Sport Coaching. Roughly translated, that is over 96,881 young athletes per year who benefit in positive ways as a result of their coaches and parents training by Positive Sport Coaching.  However, it is important to note that less than 1% of the three million coaches in the United States receive any type of coaching education.  Training, and the means to provide it, is critically needed.

      Positive Sport Coaching educates individuals on the importance of respect, non-discrimination, the fun aspects of sport, and the satisfaction of doing one's best.  Our programs continue to fulfill the critical need for education in youth sports.  Coaches of sport are teaching our youth valuable life lessons. Participation in sport helps the young person build positive self-expression, a strong work ethic, morals and cooperation through team building.  The Positive Sport Coaching programs include sports philosophy, motivation, skills, health, nutrition, management and abuse recognition and prevention.

 

       

The Impact

Factual studies about sports abuse:

45.3% of young athletes surveyed said they have been called names, yelled at while playing sports

21.5% said they have been pressured to play with an injury

17.5% said that they have been hit, kicked or slapped by a coach

3.4% said they have been pressured into sex or sexually molested

 (Minnesota Amateur Sports Commission)

 

 

     A major barrier in solving the problem of abuse is that many coaches are not clear what behaviors constitute maltreatment of abuse.  Most recognize that behaviors once considered by many to be acceptable are now considered to be racist, sexist, harassing, or abusive.  No wonder coaches are confused about not only what not to do, but what to do.  When the people who should be guiding young athletes are emotionally, physically, or sexually abusive, a hostile and destructive environment can occur.  This can erode self-esteem, confidence and trust not only by the players, but by parents as well.

   


Our Goals and Objectives

    We have the programs in place and they are fine tuned.  It's time to get the message out to the three million plus coaches and 26 million sport parents.  You can help with this important message with your contribution.  Positive Sport Coaching has a plan to broadcast this valuable information and training to the schools, clubs and recreation centers in the United States.  Includes the parents, coaches administrators and the young athlete.     All these organizations have a legal responsibility to prevent and eliminate sports abuse from there programs.

  

The Plan 

Market by doing the following  advanced Press releases for 13 consecutive months:

  1. Search Engine Optimized Press Releases, Embedded live website with our image, Boost Search engine results, reach premium publishers and news groups, Face book, Twitter, Blogs, detailed Analytics and Tracking.
  2. 65 National News Outlets (Fox, CNN, etc.), 4,000 Regional Media Outlets Nationwide (Magazine, Radio, Newspaper, etc) Includes Northeast, South, west and Midwest, Sport Specific Media Outlets.
  3. Vast Online Distribution (30,000 Syndicated News Sites including Google, Yahoo, etc) including sports specific websites.
  4. 300,000 RSS Subscribers (35,000 Journalists, Bloggers, etc) chosen by sport category coach, parent and youth concerns.

 

Distribution of 750 packets that include print and dvd information

 

Train Qualified Individuals to teach live Coaching, Sports Safety, Sport Parent, and Sports Abuse Clinics.

 

How Funds Are To Be Distributed

Press Releases (eleven)       $2,700.00

Print, DVD Postage (750)      $4,560.00

New Instructor Training         $6,300.00

Phone, Travel, misc.             $3,990.00        

 

    

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Yes, We need your help by forwarding our information to an organization, administrator, or persons that has a interest or concern about helping us build a positive foundation for the future of our youth.  www.positivesportcoaching.org  On FaceBook  Friends at Positive Sport Coaching, Twitter, Linkedin,
