story:
THE CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED, WHAT NOW?

First of all, thanks to everybody who has funded this campaign! We are really grateful for your support and happy to tell you that eventhough we did not receive the money we needed, we will not give up!  We are starting a new campaign on Sellanapp.com, so come have a look at this site for updates on our campaign. For all of you that still want to fund us, please do so on sellanapp. And the added bonus for funding us here, is that you'll receive a revenue share. So, come help us out! And last but not least, like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Ilovemeapp to get daily updates on how to work actively on your own mental health.

We love you!

Eva, Anouk and Anne

WHO IS IlOVEME?

Iloveme was founded in 2011 by Anne Pasdeloup, because she noticed a big gap in the health care system for people that have minor or mild psychological problems. Often friends and family asked her questions about their psychological health, because they didn't know where to go, where to find the right information, or they didn't feel comfortable to visit a doctor yet. Anne is set on making this systeem more accessible and improving it by providing a service that gives people with mild psychological problems accurate information. That way, people will be able to form their own opinion and start working on their problems before visiting a healthcare professional. Anne asked her former study friends Eva Faas and Anouk Hövels to join her working on this project. Read about their personal motivations below.


From left to right: Eva, Anne & Anouk.

OUR TEAM

Eva Faas, Chief Editor:

Having worked with mainly young adults the past years, I have seen the amount of problems shame and a lack of knowledge concerning psychological disorders and effective treatments can cause. Many of my clients should have received treatment at an earlier stage, but the taboo resting on psychological illnesses kept a lot of them from seeking help. Some of them did ask for help in the past, but received ineffective treatment or didn’t feel comfortable with their psychologist. Unaware that there are different kinds of treatments and disillusioned by the experience, they did not try again.

Anne Pasdeloup, Founder:

While working in a Psychiatric Hospital, I quickly realized how dependent people with mental problems are on healthcare professionals. Most of our clients were already experiencing feelings of hopelessness, and felt unable to help themselves, before they sought our help. I want to change this. I want to let everybody know that they CAN change their own situation, that they are not victims and can help themselves. That is why I founded Iloveme, and created an app to empower people around the world.

Anouk Hövels, Text Writer:

During my work I discovered that children and adults are the same in many ways. What fascinates me, is the ability of children to learn quite complicated things in a short period of time when the subject is presented in a funny, adventurous or exciting way. Once people grow up, the same methods remain effective. Think about writing in a diary or having a laugh with friends; activities many people use to actively cope with challenges in everyday life. More important, it gives them a better understanding of themselves. Iloveme offers a professional way of mental support. I am convinced that the positive and playful way of presenting it makes the app appealing and therefore powerful for many people.

BACKGROUND

About 1 in 5 adults suffer from a mental disorder. An even larger group of people suffer from mental problems that haven’t turned into a disorder yet. In fact, 50% of the population will experience some mental problems over their lifetimes. 40% of these people never seek for treatment. The main reasons for not doing it, are that people cannot afford te costs of health care, they feel too ashamed, don't want others to find out, they don't know where to go for help and they experience a lack of time. By not treating mental problems it will take a lot longer for them to disappear (if ever) and with time, the chance of problems getting worse increases. Anne, Eva and Anouk have been doing research and working diligently in order to create an accessible questionnaire and content for the app.

WHY LOVEME ? 

By using an app for coping with problems our aim is offering an appealing way of supporting people. We chose for a mobile app because we think it is good way to interact with others and to keep track of thoughts and feelings at all times. It fits the aim of becoming more aware of feelings and behaviour, to let people change their own behaviour and give and receive support of others. Iloveme distinguishes itself in comparison with other websites and apps by focussing on empowerment. The idea for a mobile application for Iphone and Android provides easy accessible and practical information. It offers people with mental problems the opportunity to actively work on their own psychological wellbeing. It's also based on effective methods in preventing mental problems from becoming worse and improving quality of life. The app uses three important pillars of treatment: Psycho-education by integrating a library with information of all kinds of problems, a mood diary and offering a forum to increase the support system. 

IlOVEME MOBILE APP SUMMARIZED

    • Developed by experienced psychologists
    • For free
    • Anonymous
    • Accessible at any time
    • Questionnaire
    • Detailed library of mental illnesses, treatments and practical tips for each category
    • Mood Meter to create awareness and gain insight in self
    • Support given by using the forum

Jane is using the the ILoveme app to connect with others with similar problems.

METHODS PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE 

 1. QUESTIONNAIRE

Imagine you haven’t been able to sleep for weeks. You might assume that you are developing a sleeping disorder. But could it also be stress at work? Have you been drinking less or more lately? Have you been travelling? Sometimes it can be difficult to separate the original problem from all the different symptoms that occur.

Our questionnaire is based on the DSM-V and covers the entire spectrum of psychological disorders. It is developed to give a personal overview of which categories are applicable to the user and indicates in which category the main problems lies.

2. LIBRARY

The extensive library contains information on psychological disorders, provides a better understanding of how certain problems uphold each other and gives usable tips and tricks on how to deal with these problems.


 3. MOOD TRACKER

The Mood Tracker will ask you to indicate your mood at random times and to fill out where you are and what you are doing. Weekly, monthly and even yearly charts will show mood fluctuations over time and helps you keep track of your progress.

Gaining more insight in your emotional state at different times contributes to recovery by making clear what (external) factors are sustaining the problem and which ones are part of the solution.

4. FORUM

The Iloveme forum contains subgroups for the different problem categories, allowing the Iloveme users to connect with peers and to give and receive advice and support from each other within a save and anonymous environment.


Jane is feeling better and back in control again.

STATUS QUO

We have finished almost all content. We have described the main part of the origin and symptoms of most of the 16 DSM-V categories of mental illnesses ranging from eating disorders to stress and work related problems. We finished the questionnaire offering the user an overview of all the symptoms they experience as well as the functional model of the app (read a more elaborate overview below). Now the time has come to finish all categories, write more about self help, build the application and go live! Building such an elaborate application and marketing it in a way that reaches as many people with psychological problems as possible is very costly. Fortunately, Iloveme has received a government grant which started us in the right direction. Secondly, we are talking with investment companies, health insurance companies and other health care professionals. They made clear they see Iloveme as a promising app to invest in. That's why we have an optimistic view towards the chances of receiving a basic amount of money to build the app. Of course we rather reach our goals more independently so the more money people like you are willing to donate, the less dependent we are. Also, we expect that we need extra funding to realize our project. At this point, we ask you to support Iloveme reaching our final goal.

IlOVEME MAKE IT HAPPEN

If you want Iloveme to happen, you are very welcome to support it by making a contribution. By supporting Iloveme, you are not only contributing to the wellbeing of people with psychological problems but you are also helping children in war-effected countries. This is because we believe in the importance of help in case of psychological trauma at an early stage. We would be very pleased if Iloveme receives sufficient investments and donations so our app will become reality. Of course, we will do our very best to find investors that can help us with the additional money. Though, IF Iloveme does not reach the goal of receiving enough money, the app may not be build. Again, we hope we can make our wish become true but in case we won’t because of an inadequate amount of donations and/or investments, we are willing to refund your donation minus 19 % for the Indiegogo fee (9%) and War Child (10%). Another option is contributing the remaining amount to War Child. 

If you’d prefer us to refund your donation in case there won't be an app, please let us know beforehand . Please write an email to ilovemeapp@gmail.com with the number of your bankaccount so we are able to refund you the money if necessary. In that case, we refund you the money before the end of 2014. Please remember, even a small amount of money will help! For every $10 you give, we will donate $1 to War Child. By making a donation of $50 you will also receive a free consult from one of our psychologists. By making a donation of $100 you will receive a free consult from one of our psychologists and you will be mentioned as a sponsor in the app. Either way, Iloveme loves you too.

With special thanks to:

Sacha Alexander Post (Film)

Inez de Groot (Actress)

Gijs Molenaar (Music)

 

War Child helps rebuild war-affected communities to provide the support necessary for children to experience a stable childhood. When war itself ends, the consequences endure. By making a long-term investment to help children develop into healthy, educated and productive adults, the cycle of violence can be broken. That is why War Child is dedicated to protecting childhood by bringing education, opportunity and justice to where they are needed most.

friends Eva Faas and Anouk Hövels to join her working on this project. Read about their personal motivations below.From left to right: Eva, Anne & Anouk.OUR TEAMEva Faas, Chief Editor:Having worked with mainly young adults the past years, I have seen the amount of problems shame and a lack of knowledge concerning psychological disorders and effective treatments can cause. Many of my clients should have received treatment at an earlier stage, but the taboo resting on psychological illnesses kept a lot of them from seeking help. Some of them did ask for help in the past, but received ineffective treatment or didn’t feel comfortable with their psychologist. Unaware that there are different kinds of treatments and disillusioned by the experience, they did not try again.Anne Pasdeloup, Founder:While working in a Psychiatric Hospital, I quickly realized how dependent people with mental problems are on healthcare professionals. Most of our clients were already experiencing feelings of hopelessness, and felt unable to help themselves, before they sought our help. I want to change this. I want to let everybody know that they CAN change their own situation, that they are not victims and can help themselves. That is why I founded Iloveme, and created an app to empower people around the world.Anouk Hövels, Text Writer:During my work I discovered that children and adults are the same in many ways. What fascinates me, is the ability of children to learn quite complicated things in a short period of time when the subject is presented in a funny, adventurous or exciting way. Once people grow up, the same methods remain effective. Think about writing in a diary or having a laugh with friends; activities many people use to actively cope with challenges in everyday life. More important, it gives them a better understanding of themselves. Iloveme offers a professional way of mental support. I am convinced that the positive and playful way of presenting it makes the app appealing and therefore powerful for many people.BACKGROUNDAbout 1 in 5 adults suffer from a mental disorder. An even larger group
of people suffer from mental problems that haven’t turned into a disorder yet.
In fact, 50% of the population will experience some mental problems over their
lifetimes. 40% of these people never seek for treatment. The main reasons for
not doing it, are that people cannot afford te costs of health care,
they feel too ashamed, don't want others to find out, they
don't know where to go for help and they experience a lack of time. By not treating mental problems it will take a lot longer
for them to disappear (if ever) and with time, the chance of problems getting worse
increases. Anne, Eva and Anouk have been doing research and
working diligently in order to create an accessible questionnaire and content
for the app. WHY LOVEME ? By using an app for coping with problems
our aim is offering an appealing way of supporting people. We chose for a mobile app because we think it is good way to interact with others and to keep track of thoughts and feelings at all
times. It fits the aim of becoming more aware of feelings and behaviour, to let people change their own behaviour and give and receive support of others. Iloveme distinguishes itself in comparison with other websites and apps by
focussing on empowerment. The idea for a mobile application for Iphone and Android provides easy accessible and practical information. It offers people with mental problems the opportunity to actively work on their own psychological wellbeing. It's also based on effective methods
in preventing mental problems from becoming
worse and improving quality of life. The app uses three important pillars of
treatment: Psycho-education by integrating a library with information of all
kinds of problems, a mood diary and offering a forum to increase the support
system. 
IlOVEME MOBILE APP SUMMARIZED
Developed by experienced psychologists
For free
Anonymous
Accessible at any time
Questionnaire
Detailed library of mental
     illnesses, treatments and practical tips for each category
Mood Meter to create
     awareness and gain insight in self
Support given by using the forum
Jane is using the the ILoveme app to connect with others with similar problems.METHODS PROVEN TO BE
EFFECTIVE  1. QUESTIONNAIRE
Imagine you haven’t been able to sleep for weeks. You might assume that
you are developing a sleeping disorder. But could it also be stress at work?
Have you been drinking less or more lately? Have you been travelling? Sometimes
it can be difficult to separate the original problem from all the different
symptoms that occur.
Our questionnaire is based on the DSM-V and covers the entire spectrum of
psychological disorders. It is developed to give a personal overview of which
categories are applicable to the user and indicates in which category the main
problems lies.2. LIBRARY
The extensive library contains information on psychological disorders,
provides a better understanding of how certain problems uphold each other and
gives usable tips and
tricks on how to deal with these problems. 3. MOOD TRACKER
The Mood Tracker will ask you to indicate your mood at random times and
to fill out where you are and what you are doing. Weekly, monthly and even yearly
charts will show mood fluctuations over time and helps you keep track of your
progress. 
Gaining more insight in your emotional state at different times
contributes to recovery by making clear what (external) factors are sustaining
the problem and which ones are part of the solution. 4. FORUM
The Iloveme forum contains subgroups
for the different problem categories, allowing the Iloveme
users to connect with peers and to give and receive advice and support
from each other within a save and
anonymous environment.
Jane is feeling better and back in control again.STATUS QUO
We have finished almost all content. We have described
the main part of the origin and symptoms of most of the 16 DSM-V categories of mental illnesses
ranging from eating disorders to stress and work related problems. We finished
the questionnaire offering the user an overview of all the symptoms they
experience as well as the functional model of the app (read a more elaborate
overview below). Now the time has come to finish all categories, write more
about self help, build the application and go live! Building such an elaborate
application and marketing it in a way that reaches as many people with
psychological problems as possible is very costly. Fortunately, Iloveme has received a government grant which started us in the right direction. Secondly,
we are talking with investment
companies, health insurance companies and other health care professionals. They
made clear they see Iloveme as a promising
app to invest in. That's why we have an optimistic view towards the chances of receiving
a basic amount of money to build the app. Of course we rather reach our goals more independently so the more money people like you are willing to donate, the less dependent we are. Also, we expect that we
need extra funding to realize our project. At
this point, we ask you to support Iloveme reaching our final goal.
IlOVEME MAKE IT HAPPEN
If you
want Iloveme to happen, you are very welcome to support it by making a
contribution. By supporting Iloveme, you are not only contributing to the
wellbeing of people with psychological problems but you are also helping
children in war-effected countries. This is because we believe in the importance of help in case of psychological trauma at an early stage. We would be very pleased if Iloveme receives
sufficient investments and donations so our app will become reality. Of course, we will do our very best to find investors that can help us with the
additional money. Though, IF Iloveme does not reach the goal of receiving enough
money, the app may not be build. Again, we hope we can make our wish become true but in
case we won’t because of an inadequate amount of donations and/or investments, we are willing to refund your donation minus 19 % for the
Indiegogo fee (9%) and War Child (10%). Another option is contributing the
remaining amount to War Child. If you’d prefer us to refund your donation in case there won't be an app, please let us know beforehand . Please write an email to ilovemeapp@gmail.com with the number of your bankaccount so we are able to refund you the money if necessary. In that case, we refund you the money before the end of 2014. Please remember, even a small amount of
money will help! For every $10 you give, we will donate $1 to War Child. By
making a donation of $50 you will also receive a free consult from one of our
psychologists. By making a donation of $100 you will receive a free consult
from one of our psychologists and you will be mentioned as a sponsor in the
app. Either way, Iloveme loves you too.With special thanks to:Sacha Alexander Post (Film)Inez de Groot (Actress) Gijs Molenaar (Music) War Child helps rebuild war-affected communities to provide the support necessary for children to experience a stable childhood. When war itself ends, the consequences endure. By making a long-term investment to help children develop into healthy, educated and productive adults, the cycle of violence can be broken. That is why War Child is dedicated to protecting childhood by bringing education, opportunity and justice to where they are needed most.

story:
We are trying to raise enough money to purchase a newer and more reliable van and / or replace transmission on and make many  other much needed repairs on existing van. 

Please help if you feel the need to do so.  Thank you !

Springfield Track Club (STC) is a not for profit 501(c)(3) youth organization.

Springfield Track Club was established to: expose youth to an elevated level of track & field; to challenge them athletically; to promote a positive atmosphere; and to promote within each athlete a sense of responsibility, improved self-esteem, and an increased sense of commitment to themselves and others. We will participate in both USA Track and Field (USATF) and Amateur Athletic Union (AAU) local, regional and national competitions, maintaining elite status. Our vision allows our youth to succeed in becoming outstanding citizens, build character and instill a commitment to excellence that will propel them into the future.

story:
GR8SKN - Who We Are

Here at Teenceuticals LLC, the makers of the GR8SKN line, we are the ONLY company dedicated to developing natural chemical-free skincare products for teens through twenties. GR8SKN products are based on meticulous research and a vision that achieving clear and radiant skin can be simple, healthy, and even fun!

 Our FDA-Approved Products use only the finest natural ingredients derived from nature. Fight Breakouts Naturally! Our original formulas help fight breakouts and improve problematic skin without the use of toxic ingredients and preservatives, but they also accomplish what other, harsher products don’t: they keep your skin healthy in the long-run. Teen skin needs its own skincare, because it has its own set of unique requirements.

"Our products work with the skin, not against it, They are real products for real people" - Dr. Janine 



What is Different About Our Ingredients?

At GR8SKN, we use only the healthiest all natural ingredients in our products: 
  • We are the only teen line on the market that uses probiotics and a fat-soluble form of triple Vitamin A, which is used in prescription acne treatments. Our night treatment, RESET, uses a gentler dose to help improve your complexion without damaging the skin. 
  • Tea Tree Oil is an essential oil that contains many therapeutic uses. It works as an antibacterial and antifungal that can help destroy the bacteria involved in the development of acne. It has benefits over benzoyl peroxide - it results in less itching, scaling, and irritation
  • Willow Bark works as a natural exfoliant that has the ability to help shed dead skin cells and clear pores. It also stimulates new cell formation.
  • Our products also contain Mandelic Acid (made from almonds) that is an effective antibacterial and increases cell turnover in the pores. And Vitamin C - essential for helping to prevent acne scarring, the production of collagen, and powerful antioxidant that works as a natural sunscreen.
  • Antioxidants help prevent cellular damage and  they neutralize and eliminate free radicals!
  • At GR8SKN, one of our core beliefs is offering full transparency of our selective ingredients. We are very proud to list EVERY ingredient that goes into each of our products. 
  • For more info about our ingredients go to gr8skn.com/our-products/or just shoot us an e-mail!


Teenceuticals is unlike any other company: our biggest goal is to become the most prominent health brand for young adults. Not only do we offer them safe and natural products, we foment health awareness by encouraging young adults to read labels, shop mindfully, and avoid toxic ingredients.  We see ourselves as the "antidote" to large corporations who prioritize profit over the health of their customers. 

Our campaign isn't just about the money, we also want to help: So we have decided to donate 5% of the funds we raise to Campaign for Safe Cosmetics - they are a broad-based coalition working to clean up the beauty aisle through public advocacy and market campaigns designed to eliminate dangerous chemicals linked to cancer, reproductive harm and other adverse health impacts from cosmetics and personal care products.


Why Are We Doing This?
The short version: we are not happy with the teen skincare and acne treatments currently on the market. Many products in the beauty isle contain toxic chemicals that can lead to serious health problems that range from severe skin allergies, infertility, to cancer. There are many products that claim to be "natural" and "green", but our products actually back that up with ingredients derived from nature--all pleasantly packaged in our unique eco-friendly bottles.

The real story, however, begins in South Africa when our Founder, Dr. Janine, lost a 9-year old patient to melanoma at one of her associated medical practices. When melanoma began to emerge in her own family, she realized the necessity of sun protection. Unfortunately, she found no products on the market appropriate for her own red-haired, at-risk teens. Thus, after considerable research and development, Screen debuted as the first "teenceutical"--the progenitor of a product line that has expanded to include acne-treatments, facial cleansers, moisturizers. Yes, this means that our products help improve problem skin, but they also do what other, harsher products don’t: they keep skin healthy in the long-run. They have been specifically designed to nourish and protect the skin.

  • Most over-the-counter acne treatments, as well as skincare products, contain very harsh ingredients with potentially severe side-effects. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has recently released a consumer update warning that, "...the use of certain acne products containing the active ingredients benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid can cause rare but serious and potentially life-threatening allergic reactions or severe irritation." Regulators stressed that these severe allergic reactions are much more serious than rashes and irritations often seen with skincare products. 
  • Unfortunately, this information has largely been suppressed or ignored by large corporations (e.g. brands like Proactiv, Neutrogena, and Aveeno). Our products are effective without the need to use these harsh active ingredients that can cause severe allergies. NONE of our products contain benzoyl peroxide (BPO) or salicylic acid.

  • We are a Proud Member of the Safe Cosmetics Business Network!

  • Watch this eye-opening video! Most people have repeatedly heard about the risks and dangers of UV radiation and skin cancer, but it isn't until we actually SEE the sun damage that we truly acknowledge this threat:

Skin Cancer Preventative Measures

  • A new study published in the American College of Physicians’ Annals of Internal Medicine (released June 3, 2013) is the first research in humans to show conclusively that sunscreen can help prevent photoaging (premature aging caused by the sun). 
  • While there is an abundance of indirect evidence suggesting sunscreen has anti-aging benefits, this is the first clinical human trial to show it. This study provides evidence that daily sunscreen use significantly slows skin aging, even in middle-aged men and women. Daily application of broad spectrum (UVA/UVB) sunscreen with an SPF of 15 or higher is an important part of the complete sun protection regimen that The Skin Cancer Foundation advocates. 
  • Source: http://www.skincancer.org/prevention/sun-protection/sunscreen/aging

  • Screen, our face-friendly SPF 30 sunscreen was specifically designed for everyday use (once in the morning with reapplication every two hours) and has a pleasant watermelon scent--free of synthetic fragrances. Screen doesn't only help protect the skin and offer anti-aging benefits; ingredients such as coffeeberry and zinc oxide protect without causing breakouts! Enjoy the sun without worrying about sun damage.

    

  • On top of creating a natural alternative line of products for teens, we believe that promoting skin health and creating more awareness around skin cancer prevention is crucial.
  • 1 in 5 Americans will develop skin cancer in the course of a lifetime. That's a frightening statistic. 
  • One person dies of melanoma every 62 minutes.
  • Melanoma is the most common form of cancer for young adults 25-29 years old and the second most common form of cancer for young people 15-29 years old. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently raising $85,000 which will go towards:

The first $20,000, will be used to cover the cost of securing the highest grade natural ingredients, bottling/packaging and fund the manufacturing process to allow us to lower our manufacturing costs.

In return for your early support, you'll be one of the first to get our new GR8SKN products and support a startup trying to redefine the way the world looks at cosmetics and skincare and help an eco-friendly company!

Please support and contribute to our Indiegogo campaign. Spread the word to all your friends that you think could benefit from our product, share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook and Twitter, so we can grow the GR8SKN vision. And with your help, we can make this world a more healthy and holistic place. 

  • New Product Development (e.g. natural lip balm,  natural exfoliators,  natural anti-antiperspirant/deodorant, natural waterproof sunscreen, natural shampoos, and natural conditioners, etc) 
  • Purchase Order Fulfillment (We are currently speaking with a couple high-end retailers!)
  • Product Samples
  • Teen E-zine 
  • Marketing and PR
  • Infomercial Spot

The Impact

  • Your contributions will help us grow a unique and healthy alternative product line containing all natural ingredients out there for young adults. Our Products Are Also: 

  • ●GMO-Free●Paraben Free●Sulfate Free●Gluten Free●Not Tested on Animals

  • You will help the environment by supporting products that are eco-friendly - our products have recyclable packaging made with post-consumer materials. Other brands claim to be "green" yet their packaging proves otherwise.

  • You can help us reach our target market and help teens and young adults make informed decisions about products that are safe. Together we can improve their overall health by helping them make informed choices and avoid toxic products.

  • Here at GR8SKN we are completely committed to safe, effective, and natural skincare products - Support a company that has a purpose-driven mission and contribute now to GR8SKN For Change! Check back frequently for new perks and updates! #gr8skn

About the GR8SKN Team

Janine Ellenberger- Janine is the Founder and President of Teenceuticals LLC (the makers of GR8SKN). Janine is an accomplished medical professional with over 20 years of experience in the aesthetic and anti-aging industries. Dr. Janine is now applying her skills to this entrepreneurial pursuit.

Larry Graham- Larry is the Marketing Director at GR8SKN and graduated from Villanova University. Larry has a diverse background that includes marketing, sales, personal training, and financial analysis but now devotes the majority of his time helping startups thrive. His future plans include pursuing his M.B.A and starting his own company.

Sam Vitale- Sam works as Creative Director at GR8SKN, a title that includes writing copy and blog posts; designing info-graphics and product branding; and creating animations and videos. When not immersed in start-up life, Sam inhabits the Villanova English department, where she is pursing a Masters in Literature. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Times can be tough and money may be tight, but there are other ways you can help!

    • Help us get the word out about our campaign! You can like our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/pages/GR8SKNTeenceuticals-Skincare/214642695441 and "like" or "share" our campaign-related posts
    • Follow us on Twitter www.twitter.com/gr8skn and help spread awareness about our Indiegogo campaign, share our campaign posts to your followers!
    • Follow us on Instagram @gr8_skn 
    • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Use #gr8skn
    *We expect to fulfill our crowdfunding orders by November 2014. Delays are unlikely but in the event there are any delays we will keep you informed every step of the way. 
    *For Our International Supporters: please add $25 to your orders. If any customs charges apply, you are responsible for them. It will make things much easier for everyone. Thanks for your support!

    *For questions or customer service please email janine@teenceuticals.com or call 855-447-8756

    *For Press Inquiries please email larry@teenceuticals.com

story:
You can find other language below.
Click blue name!!

English

Spanish

Polish



ENGLISH  

Ms Alicja is 80 years old. She has graduated the secondary school and for all her life she has been working as a bookkeeper. She was considered as a cheerful, old woman who didn’t expect any big changes in her life. While she was a carefree retired person, she used to spend her time reading books, watching TV, listening to music from the old vinyls and playing with her beloved dog Alan. Unfortunately, the huge changes in her life were coming. Her eyesight were getting worse. The doctors diagnosed her with cataract in her right eye. Moreover, it was found out that there is also a cornea damage in the same eye and it has to be immediately transplanted. Those two treatments – cornea transplantation as well as cataract surgery may be done at the same time during one operation. She has been enrolled for the surgery waiting list as soon as possible, but… there is a big obstacle we have met with. In Poland, there is only one queue in which the patients from the private and public hospitals are waiting for their turn to have a cornea surgery. Ms Alicja needs the surgery immediately but there are more than 5000 people waiting for their turn. Surgery is needed right away to save her right eye! What is more, recently, the left eye has been also diagnosed with cataract. Because of the fact that she has to wait for the surgery so long, there is a danger of blindness. All the things that had made her happy are impossible to do at that time. Even her beloved dog, Alan, had to be given to her acquaintance because she was not able to look after him anymore. The cataract is in advanced stage. Because of that, there were situations in which Ms Alicja became injured – she fell over many times during everyday activities or housework. Her right shoulder has been in a bed condition for the last few years. The only solution is to perform an operation immediately. It is possible in Czech Republic or Germany only. Ms Alicja needs 6500$ for the surgery of her right eye but, unfortunately, she can’t afford it. We would like to make a request for financial support. Any sum of money is very important for Ms Alicja. Thank you all for your support and devoted time. 

email: alicjaproject@gmail.com Alicja Project Trio Quartet


GERMAN  

Frau Alicja ist 80 Jahre alt. Sie hat die Oberschule mit Abitur beendet und sie hat das ganze Leben als Buchhalterin gearbeitet. Sie ist eine heitere alte Frau, die von dem Leben keine großen Änderungen erwartet hat. Die Zeit als Pensionierte hat sie bescheiden ,doch angenehm verbracht. Das Lesen, Fernsehen und Hören der alten Grammophonplatten und Spielen mit ihrem geliebten Hund Alan – das waren ihre Alltagstätigkeiten.

Die riesigen Änderungen sind jedoch sukzessiv gekommen. Ihr früher Scharfblick wird immer schlechter und die Ärzte haben zuerst den Katarakt in ihrem rechten Augen festgestellt. Und was noch schlimmer ist, es hat sich erwiesen, dass mit der Zeit die Hornhaut beschädigt ist und die Hornhautübertragung notwendig ist. Beide chirurgischen Handgriffe d.h. die Hornhauptübertragung und die Kataraktentfernung sind während einer gebundenen Operation zu machen. Frau Alicja ist also in eine Liste zur Operation eingeschrieben. Und hier haben wir mit einem riesigen Problem zu tun. Es besteht darin, dass wir hier in Polen eine einzige Schlange der Patienten zur Übertragung haben, die das ganze Land, also alle staatlichen und privaten Krankenhäuser, umfasst.

Für die Augenhornhautübertragung warten, der Reihe nach, über 5000 Personen. Und die Operation zur Rettung dieses rechten Augen ist nötig sofort !!  Unglücklicherweise wird das linke Auge immer schlechter: auch hier haben die Ärzte den Katarakt festgestellt !!

Da die Operation zuerst an dem Augen durchzuführen ist, das schlechter ist, kann man erwarten, dass Frau Alicja in kurzer Zeit völlig blind wird. Das bedeutet, dass alle Tätigkeiten mit den sie früher Freude hatte, bald unmöglich sein werden.

Ihren Hund Alan, die letzte Lebensfreude musste sie den Bekannten abgeben, weil die Spaziergänge und auch das Treppenhinaufgehen und Treppensteigen jetzt unausführbar sind!!

Frau Alicja, indem sie die Spaziergänge mit dem geliebten Hund machte, aber nicht nur dann, ist die Treppe hinuntergefallen und hat sich empfindlich verletzt. Die rechte Schulter tut sie seit vielen Jahren weh!!

Eine einzige Lösung dieses Problems ist in dieser Situation die rasche Durchführung der Operation, die nur in den Nachbarländern, also in Tschechen bzw. in Deutschland, natürlich gegen Bezahlung, möglich ist. Nur die Operation des rechten Augen kostet 6.500 $; dieser Betrag liegt aber ganz außer der finanziellen Möglichkeiten Frau Alicja.

Daher wenden wir uns an Alle mit der Bitte um finanzielle Unterstützung!
Jeder Betrag ist für Frau Alicja wichtig, weil er sie von dauerhafter Blindheit entfernt!!

Wir danken Ihnen herzlichst für die uns geopferte Zeit als auch für die Schenkung.

email: alicjaproject@gmail.com Alicja Project Trio Quartet

SPANISH  

¡SE NECESITA AYUDA URGENTEMENTE!

Alicia tiene 80 años. Ha terminado la educación secundaria y toda la vida ha trabajado como contable. Siendo una mujer entrada en años, Alicia era una persona  muy serena y alegre que no esperaba que su vida cambiase.  Después de haberse jubilado,  pasaba su tiempo libre de una manera modesta y agradable. Le gustaba leer, ver la televisión, escuchar  la música reproducida de los viejos discos de vinilo, pero, sobre todo, le gustaba jugar con su querido perro – Alan.

No obstatnte, poco a poco han ido apareciendo cambios en su comportamiento.  Su vista ha ido de mal en peor y los médicos le han diagnosticado una catarata en el ojo derecho.

Lo peor es que transcurridas unas semanas, le han detectado una lesión en la córnea del mismo ojo y han acordado que un transplante de córnea es imprescindible.

Ambas operaciones quirúrgicas, es decir, el transplante de córnea y  la destrucción del cristalino opaco (catarata) se realizan en una misma operación, por tanto la han inscrito en la lista de espera para operarse... Aquí empiezan los problemas. A grandes rasgos, consisten en que en Polonia hay solamente una lista de espera general para todos los transplanstes de córneas, tanto para los pacientes provenientes de hospitales privados, como los de públicos.

¡Más de 5000 personas esperan su transplante de córnea, pero Alicia necesita el transplante urgentemente! Por si fuese poco, su ojo izquierdo ha empeorado y allí también han diagnosticado una catarata.

Como primero se efectúa una operación del ojo que se encuentra en estado peor, Alicia está amenazada por la ceguera total. Por tanto, todas las cosas que le causaban alegría en la vida, para ella van a desaparecer. Su querido perro - Alan fue acogido por sus vecinos, porque Alicia no era capaz de sacarlo a pasear, la subida por la escalera se había convertido para ella en una verdadera tortura. Muchas veces al salir con el perro, Alicia casi se cae por la escalera salvada por la pared contra la que podía atenerse en el entresuelo bajo la ventana. Además, su hombro derecho esta en mal estado desde hace años.

La única solución de los problemas de Alicia es una operación quirúrgica urgente que se realiza en los países como: Alemania o Rebública Checa, la operación es muy cara. Solamente el tratamiento quirúrgico del ojo derecho viene a costar 6500$ y Alicia no es capaz de pagarlo.

Por tanto, nos dirigimos a todos para pedir ayuda financiera para la operación de Alicia. Cada importe es para nosotros muy importante, aunque sea muy poco.

¡Cada cantidad de dinero la aleja de la ceguera!

Muchas gracias por el tiempo dedicado a leer nuestra petición, así como  por la donación. 

email: alicjaproject@gmail.com Alicja Project Trio Quartet


FRENCH  

Madame Alicja a 80 ans. Elle a fait les études secondaires et toute sa vie a travaillé comme comptable. Elle était une femme joyeuse qui ne s'attendait pas à avoir dans sa vie de grands changements. Elle a passé sont temps à la retraite modestement et agréablement. Elle aimait lire, regarder la télévision, écouter de la musique de vieux microsillons et jouer avec son chien bien-aimé, Alan !

Mais d’énormes changements ont lieu progressivement. Sa vue se détériorait de plus en plus. D’abbord, les médecins ont diagnostiqué la cataracte de l'œil droit. Et ce qui est pire, il s’est avéré que dans le même œil la  cornée était endommagée et devait être transplantée. Les deux traitements, de transplanter la cornée et d’enlever la cataracte, sont à effectuer lors d'une même opération combinée.

Elle a été enregistrée dans la queue pour une opération de l'œil, mais ici un vrai problème commence. Il réside dans le fait qu'en Pologne, son pays natal, il y a une seule file d'attente pour les opérations de cornées de tous les hôpitaux publics et privés en Pologne. Dans la file d'attente pour la transplantation de la cornée  il y a plus de 5.000 personnes qui attendent. Cependant, l’opération pour sauver l’oeil droit de Mme Alicja est nécessaire immédiatement!

D’autres soucis se sont produits. L'état ​​de son œil gauche s’est détérioré rapidement : et ici la cataracte a été diagnostiquée! Pusque la première intervention chirurgicale est pratiquée sur l'œil en pire état, il y a le risque de la cécité totale !

Donc, toutes les choses qui apportaient de la joie dans la vie de Mme Alicja deviennet impossibles. La dernière joie de sa vie - le chien Alan a dû être donné aux amis parce que sortir avec le chien  ainsi que monter les escaliers sont devenus impossibles ! Pas une seule fois, en sortant avec Alan, Alicja est tombée dans les escaliers, s'arrêtant sur ​​le mur au-dessous du rebord de la fenêtre à mi-étage. De plus, son épaule droite est en mauvais état depuis quelques années!

La seule solution dans cette situation est une opération immédiate qui n’est possible que dans les pays voisins, à savoir en République Tchèque ou en Allemagne. Elle est bien sûr payante de 6500 $ pour l’opération de l'œil droit. Et malheureusement cette somme d’argent est complètement hors des possibilités financières de Madame Alicja.

Nous nous addressons donc à tous qui pourraient nous aider à financer l’opération. Chaque somme d’argent est important pour nous parce qu’elle eloigne Madame Alicja de la cécité totale !
Nous vous remercions pour votre temps et votre contribution !


email: alicjaproject@gmail.com Alicja Project Trio Quartet


POLISH  

Pani Alicja ma 80 lat Ma wykształcenie średnie a całe życie pracowała jako buchalter. Była pogodną starszą kobietą , która nie oczekiwała już w swym życiu większych zmian. Swój czas na emeryturze spędzała skromnie i przyjemnie Bardzo lubiła czytać, oglądać TV, słuchać muzyki ze starych płyt gramofonowych oraz zabawę ze swym ukochanym psem Alanem!

Lecz stopniowo zachodziły ogromne zmiany. Jej wzrok coraz bardziej się pogarszał, lekarze zdiagnozowali wpierw zaćmę w jej prawym oku. A co gorsza z biegiem czasu w tym samym oku okazało się że jest uszkodzona rogówka która jest do przeszczepu. Oba zabiegi tj. przeszczep rogówki i usunięcie zaćmy wykonuje się w czasie jednej połączonej operacji.  No i została zapisana na operację oka, lecz....... I tu zaczyna się prawdziwy problem .

Polega on na tym że w Polsce  jest jedna ogólnokrajowa kolejka do przeszczepu  rogówek dla wszystkich szpitali państwowych jak i prywatnych.

Na przeszczep rogówki oka oczekuje w kolejce ponad 5000 osób. A operacja by uratować to prawe oko jest potrzebna natychmiast! Jak by tych wszystkich nieszczęść było mało zaczął szybko pogarszać się stan lewego oka: zdiagnozowano tu też zaćmę!

A ponieważ najpierw wykonuje się operację na oku w gorszym stanie pani Alicji grozi już niedługo całkowita ślepota!!!!!  Tak więc wszystkie rzeczy które przynosiły jej radość w życiu stają się już teraz niemożliwe

Ostatnią radość życia , pies Alan musiał być oddany do  znajomych gdyż wychodzenie z nim na spacer ,a co za tym idzie pokonywanie schodów stało się niewykonalne!!!

 Pani Alicja nie raz wychodząc z Alanem i nie tylko wtedy ,wywróciła się na schodach zatrzymując się na ścianie pod parapetem okna na półpiętrze klatki schodowej A prawy bark ma w złym stanie już od kilku lat!!!! 

 Jedynym wyjściem w tej sytuacji jest pilne wykonanie operacji, które jest możliwe ale tylko w sąsiednich krajach czyli Czechach lub Niemczech oczywiście odpłatnie .Tylko na operację prawego oka jest to suma 6500$ która to suma jest kompletnie poza finansowymi możliwościami panii Alicji .

  Zwracamy się więc do wszystkich o wsparcie finansowe! Każda kwota jest dla niej ważna

  Dosłownie każda suma bo oddala ją od trwałej ślepoty!!!

  Dziękujemy za poświęcony nam czas jak i za darowiznę

email: alicjaproject@gmail.com Alicja Project Trio Quartet


by  Alicja Project Trio Quartet

znajomych gdyż wychodzenie z nim na spacer ,a co za tym idzie
pokonywanie schodów stało się niewykonalne!!! Pani Alicja nie raz wychodząc z Alanem i nie

lat!!!!   Jedynym wyjściem w tej sytuacji jest

Niemczech oczywiście odpłatnie .Tylko na operację prawego oka jest to suma 6500$ która to suma jest kompletnie
poza finansowymi możliwościami panii Alicji .  Zwracamy się więc do wszystkich o
wsparcie finansowe! Każda kwota jest dla niej ważna  Dosłownie każda suma bo oddala ją od
trwałej ślepoty!!!  Dziękujemy za poświęcony nam czas jak i za darowiznę

Alicja Project Trio Quartet

by  Alicja Project Trio Quartet

story:
"If women are healthy and educated, their families will flourish… when families flourish, communities and nations flourish.” Former First Lady and Senator Hillary Clinton

They feel ill most of the time, but that does not change anything in their daily routine! Life must continue as usual. They look after everyone else in their families, except after themselves. They work hard both in their homes and in the fields whether they feel well or not, barely finding time to rest. They just do not seek medical advice or treatment because it is well beyond their means. Thus, they simply ignore their conditions that when caught early could either be cured or managed. This is the tragedy of the women of Lango sub-region in Northern Uganda!

Lango Sub-region is one of the areas emerging from the over 20 years of civil war. During the war, the locals’ priority was just surviving the war. Now that the war has ended, the priority has shifted to just surviving the poverty that has engulfed the region. The people are mostly subsistence farmers with little or no means of generating income. This means health issues are not a priority.

Early this year, about 1,896 women from Lango sub-region; from 3 out of the region’s 8 districts were very lucky to get a medical screening organized by Isis-Women’s International Cross Cultural Exchange (WICCE). Although the main focus of the exercise was to screen for cervical cancer, the medical team screened for other issues as well. Of the women who were screened, 100 required surgeries to remove cancerous cells; 30 showed early signs of cancer or abnormal changes and 13 were positive with cervical cancer. However, equally disturbing, after the screening, the medical team identified and treated the most common condition; 1,521 women (80%) had chronic pelvic inflammatory disease (PID)!

According to the CDC, Pelvic Inflammatory Disease is an infection of a woman’s reproductive organs. It is a complication often caused by some STDs, likechlamydiaandgonorrhea though other infections that are not sexually transmitted can also cause it.

If PID is untreated, it may result in serious, life-threatening complications:

·  Infection can spread to the blood or to other parts of the body.

·  PID can result in the rupture of the fallopian tubes.

·  PID increases the risk of ectopic pregnancy, a life-threatening condition, especially in this part of the world.

Health professionals in the region attribute the high rate of PID in this population to a lack of affordable health care services in the region, compounded by a lack of awareness and yet these women reported that they felt unwell at all times and that these illnesses were affecting their abilities to work effectively in the fields and at home.

It may take several very aggressive interventions and multi-pronged approaches for this region to get back on its feet but addressing health issues should be one of the first steps towards getting this region to flourish.

The Project:

The Lango Association of North America (LAONA), a non-profit public charity in the USA, will undertake to extend the health screening done earlier this year by Isis-Women’s International Cross Cultural Exchange to all the women in Lango sub-region who were not screened through the Isis-WICCE project. The main focus of this project will be on screening the women for PID and providing treatment as necessary.  The Association will partner with major health centres to provide for the screening and treatment.

The Association hopes to set up women’s health education centres across the 8 districts when funding becomes available so that the women, whether they are in the villages or in townships, have access to information that will help them monitor and act immediately on the health issues that concern them. 

The Association needs to raise US $50,000 to fund this screening and treatment, where treatment is necessary; and to provide for basic women’s health education across the sub-region. 

Other Ways you can help:

We appreciate that not everyone can contribute but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Link us to your Facebook page and tell your Facebook friends about the campaign.
  • There are Indiegogo share tools that are available to help spread the word.

We thank you all for caring!

The Lango Association of North America is a registered Nonprofit in the State of Missouri (resgistration number N01299599) and currently awaiting IRS 501(c)(3) determination.
